Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, appalling staff, great price”
Reviews.Author: Redneck84
Reviews.Content: In brief - location, for the price, is outstanding. The hotel was very cheap and was clean, even though the beds were small and bathroom v small. We were partying for a week so it was fine. The big drawback was the staff at the front desk - the rudest I have ever encountered. Smug, unhelpful, aggressive. Saw one shouting at a guest that there are plenty more hotels in NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Attritionghost
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is quite basic, it is very clean with professional and friendly staff, especially those who are in charge of parking. Free parking is certainly a plus in New York City. The location of the hotel is great. There are a number of restaurants within a short-walk distance. We stayed here for 4 nights, with 3 nights in a double-double room and 1 night in a king room. While costing more bucks, the king room was much roomier and had 1 microwave, 1 fridge, and 2 one-seater sofa. The closet was much bigger too. I would suggest offering the in-room coffee/tea maker. Also avoid using the paid-computer in the lobby. The minimum charge for the use of the internet was 2 bucks. After I put two dollars, the computer screen still showed that one more dollar was needed. I asked the front desk, but the gentleman asked me to call a 1-800 number on the computer. Apparantly, the hotel was not in charge of the machine. Overall, we enjoyed the saty.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: allynator2096
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel over St. Patrick's Day weekend. We live only 2 hours from the city, so this stay was more to avoid the St. Patty's Day crowds on the train. The first thing that I LOVED about this hotel, was the free parking garage. Parking in NYC is always very expensive and hard to find, so being able to park for free right at the hotel was awesome. Check-in was quick and easy. We were on the 4th floor in room 408. We had an awesome view of 42nd Street. It was especially cool on the 18th, because we were able to watch the NYC half marathon run right by the hotel. The hotel's location was great. A quick walk to Port Authority, Grand Central, and Times Square. There was a deli/restaurant right next to the hotel that was good for a grab and go breakfast. The hotel room was pretty big for an NYC hotel. Usually you get a room about the size of a small closet, where you can touch both the walls from your bed. This room had 2 double beds and a decent sized bathroom. It wasn't as small as most NYC hotel rooms. The room was clean and comfortable. The windows were a bit thin, and you could hear any street noise clearly, but this isn't unusual for the City. My only complaint with this hotel (again, for the money this hotel was excellent) was the elevators. They were so slow, that we often had to resort to the stairs because after 5 minutes of waiting, we would get fed up. It's a small hotel, so the elevators shouldn't have taken so long. But I would definitely stay at this hotel again. I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a good value in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Michelle028
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night at the Travel Inn hotel before a cruise. The place was clean and comfortable. Close walk to Times Square and major sites around NYC. Front desk staff was incredible..thanks Salim and Zeeshan. Thank you also to the front desk gentleman (forgot his name)who ordered pizza for us that evening b/c we couldn't decide where to go for dinner. We had free parking which was the main selling point for us. Room was very warm so we kept the windows open through the night. There is a CVS pharmacy across the street which was good as well b/c I forgot a few things from home. I would definitely stay again at this hotel - note this is good for pre-cruise or post-cruise, especially if you don't want to spend alot of money in NYC for accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, excellent service, superb location”
Reviews.Author: Ryan2002
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 2 hours before we were due to check in, the friendly receptionist directed us to the diner attached to the hotel for some refreshments and said she would give us a call when our room was ready. Within half an hour a room was available so we checked in. The room itself as stated in other reviews is a little dated, however the cleanliness could not be faulted. We had a twin room which was a good size for a manhattan hotel, the flat screen tv, microwave and fridge were an added bonus. The diner next to the hotel is a great place to begin your day, they have a large variety of drinks and food, all at reasonable prices. The hotel is located within hells kitchen, an area full of great restraunts and bars. Stay away from times square and head down some of the side streets which are filled with hidden gems, at about 2/3rds the cost. During our stay we wanted to visit the 9/11 memorial site (an extremely emotional but worth while experience). You have to print your passes off beforehand which we tried to do at the hotel recption, unfortunately the printer stopped working. The hotel porter however saw what had happened and very nicely took us up to the managers office area where he let us print out our passes. During our stay it was my girlfriends 30th birthday, we booked a car to take us back to jfk via the hotel reception. The hotel very kindly urgraded us to a limousine which was a perfect way to end a fantastic holiday. So all in all i dont think you will find a better value hotel in manhattan, clean spacious rooms, fantastic location and very friendly staff! we look forward to our return in the future! couple of useful tips - *dont use taxis to get around manhattan, they are extremely expensive. the subway is safe and it is only $30 for a weeks pass * as a uk visitor the new jersery gardens shopping mall was very cheap compared with manhattan. get the train from penn station to newark airport. from the first stop at newark there is a shuttle bus that takes you straight to the mall. all the named outlets are there and if you go to the help desk with your uk passport you get a voucher booklet that will give youu more money off. *for the best view of manhattan the temptation will be to go up the empire state building which is a little small and extremely busy. for a better view go up to the top of the rockefeller centre instead. it has multiple viewing platforms, and you have a great view of central park, as well as downtown and the empire state.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: thedales34
Reviews.Content: For our fitst time in New York we were apprehenisive regaqrding this hotel as some of the reviews were not so good. But we were pleasantly surprised. The location was great, three blocks from Times Square but just down from all the razamataz of 42nd Street. Upon arrival we were upgraded to Kingsize Room which had a fridge and microwave. The room was a good size and we overlooked the pool area..Everything was spotlessly clean and the towels were pure white (not grey like in some hotels we have stayed in). Another great feature was the ability to pre-check in our return flight - in Reception there was a PC which gave you free access to whichever airline your return flight was booked with. There was also a machine in Reception whereby you could book for tickets, trips, etc. using your credit card. We highly recommend this hotel and thank everyone there for making our stay so perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for economy traveler”
Reviews.Author: RollerFan
Reviews.Content: I hesitated with the VG rating but the location, price and parking(!) just had to bump it up from avg. BARELY a 10 min, walk & you're in Times Sq! AND the hotel is HALF the price of a place in Times Sq. This is an economy/budget hotel so don't expect the world but it was safe, convenient, the staff was nice enough and the room itself was pretty quiet. (Don't know if this changes on the weekends or in the summer.) Based on this first visit I would recommend this hotel for the budget conscious traveler. Positives: Again, location (Times Sq./Hell's Kitchen/Chelsea; also right out of the Lincoln Tunnel). Price. Parking. Fast check-in. Clean bathroom. HDtv. Windows open. Felt safe. A small lobby to relax if needed. Pool (closed while we were there). A staff member offered cool help squeezing into ultra-tight parking space in garage. Gym (although equipment is old--it is an option at least, includes tv in exercise area.) Negatives: The housekeeping staff left a little to be desired--Found old cigarette butts in the window frame of our non-smoking room. After room service our comforter was still on the floor, mattress pad on bed wasn't attached, bed a little old, pillow case almost see-through.--It's a little petty but I'm just offering details about comfort/quality. No bellstaff offered/seen. Heat would not turn off completely. If you hate noise (then I guess you're doomed cuz it's NYC!) however, the back hotel rooms (north tower) are right over a train track and construction sites. VERY NOISY if you are not used to "ambient" city noise-haha. Overall, I'm glad I saw this place on tripadvisor. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “3 blocks from Times Square and Subway to anywhere in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: sebrina_travels
Reviews.Content: Like many others have said, the location of this hotel is great! After parking for free in the dedicated hotel lot (read: no non-hotel guests allowed, attached to the hotel), we were able to walk or take the subway all over the city. The ease of the location made the trip that much better. There are several great restaurants right around (Amy's Bread Bakery was one of our favorites). It is also very close to the Intrepid Sea, Air, and Space Museum which is part of the reciprocal admission plan with many museums (we were able to use our Chicago Field Museum Membership to get in for free). Thanks to all the wonderful reviewers at Trip Advisor, I was able to ask ahead of time for a room with a fridge and microwave so we were able to have breakfast in our room with things we brought from home. The cons for this hotel again echo what many others have said- The room was very warm in the evenings, so much so that it did affect my sleep. I would suggest that management consider getting fans for the rooms if there is no way to fix the heating issues. If you like a warm room though, this might be best for you. If you do not, definitely make sure that you open your windows as far as you can before you leave during the day so the room is cooler when you get back. This helped us a lot. One other small thing- The front desk staff, while not outwardly rude, also were not overly friendly or helpful. When I first got there to check in, I had to wait while the front desk person finished his personal phone call. It was not a big deal, but if you are looking for friendly reception and helpful advice, you may not be satisfied with what is provided.

Reviews.Title: “unfortunate circumstances”
Reviews.Author: sabrina m
Reviews.Content: We asked managment to look into a change for our hotel room and have never been answered more rudely or with more disregard than we were at the travel inn. Needless to say we were extremely disappointed with the un professional manner in which our "complaint" was handled. That being said, the hotels location was great & free parking was wonderful. Our hotel room was very small but very clean. The only complaint we have is that our room was actually facing the pool and on an outdoor balcony.The room door was not insulated properly and therefore the cold would come in from the bottom and side of the door, this made the room very cold especially at night. Other than our unfortunate dispute this hotel was perfect for a week end in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location !”
Reviews.Author: amandasfllowers
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean if a little dated hotel . It's facilities are basic but for a Manhattan base it's a good hotel . Rooms are ok size, with fridge & microwave but no kettle. The bathroom in our room, 626 needed a bit of work in the bath/ shower area. The rooms are very hot despite turning the heating off & due to the layout it didn't feel safe to leave the window open at night. It's a little unusual in that the window & door open onto an open corridor used by everyone on your floor. The elevator situation is unusual too in that you have to take one lift to floor 3 then walk around a corner & then take another to the higher floors . The walls are very thin & as guests come & go all night long , a good nights sleep is tricky. Even people chatting in their rooms seems surprisingly loud at 4 am . An unwelcome disturbance at 5 am when the occupants of room 726 decided our room was theirs. Check in was quick if not particularly friendly and we only spoke to the staff again at check out & when our key cards stopped working. There is a small gym which we didn't use & a vending machine & ice machine. The diner next door is great. The housekeeping was excellent but we forgot to leave a tip so apologise. Luggage storage for check out is available with the security guard in the parking area. Wifi available in reception & in your room but we didn't try it . Plenty of leaflets in the hotel with information about attractions, subways etc . Hotel was opposite police station so some additional noise there with sirens. Wardrobe space limited especially for a family room & not enough electrical sockets . A tv channel guide would have been helpful .

Reviews.Title: “All you need in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Jimgreenleaf2010
Reviews.Content: I need little when it comes to visiting NYC. This place meets all of them. The room was small but clean, and everything worked fine. the location is the real draw - it is very easy to get to, and is within walking distance to the Theater District, Madison Square Garden, and Lincoln Center. The thing that puts it over the top - FREE ONSITE PARKING!

Reviews.Title: “Location is why you stay here”
Reviews.Author: shawchessplayer
Reviews.Content: On the whole this hotel is good enough. The location is everything - on 42cnd and 5 mins to Times Square. And the price can be good. If you get a good deal then its OK. The rooms are a little dated, but I think they have some decent rooms, and some not as good. I think they vary. The pool area is a nice quite haven from busy NY. If you time it right you might get some sun as well, though it is surrounded by tall buildings. The worst issue for me was that some of the staff - or maybe as I suspect owners - don't give out a very good impression. Never a smile. Note, I say 'some' of the staff. Our room didn't have a fridge or microwave as we were expecting, so if you want these you may need to make a point of it. On the plus side though, nice big Tellies.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Avalongirl83
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on a 4 day whirlwind trip to NYC. This hotel was absolutely perfect for our needs. Finding it was easy off the Lincoln Tunnel, parking was a WONDERFUL addition to the room. We were able to check in an hour early (and they allowed us to park even before we were able to check in to make the most of our first day) and start checking out the city. The hotel is wonderful, clean with a microwave and fridge in the room. Very comfortable size. Downstairs and right next door there is a great little deli that was very convenient for breakfast and lunch the day we left town. It also has good coffee and sodas and other snacks for sale. Travel Inn is so close to Times Square (about 4 blocks or so) and only two blocks from the Metro. UNBELIEVABLE for the price we paid. I was nervous (because it was so cheap) but my expectations were far exceeded. I will be returning in a few months and bringing my four year old to see the city and I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Thank you guys for making this trip so easy and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for our party of five, four of whom were on a first trip to NYC, so wanted to see as much as possible in our 5 day stay. Travel Inn proved to be a perfect location - short walk to Times Square, Theatre District etc. Cross town bus stop outside the hotel and only a short walk to subway and Port Authority bus terminal. We were assigned two large (by NY standards) adjoining rooms - very comfortable and great heating, especially as it was minus 5 one day! The rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels and toiletries. Added bonus was having full size fridge and microwave which came in handy after a long day's sightseeing. We would recommend this hotel and hope to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Especially for the Price”
Reviews.Author: ncm7772
Reviews.Content: There are many positive reviews, so it should be a no brainer that this is a good hotel. Other than a few cons; such as the rooms having a bit of an "old" look to them, and if you get a room in the back, you may hear a train passing by periodically. Also, the bathroom was small. Other than that, this is a very solid hotel. First off, free parking. An extreme luxery in Manhattan. Very few hotels have that. You're about a 15 minute walk to Times Square, as well as the subway, meaning virtually anywhere in the city can be reached in decent time. In addition to being near Times Square, you also have the oppurtunity to have a more "New York" feel around the hotel itself, without the ritzy, touristy Times Square area. Also, all amenities worked great, the beds were comfortable and always a plus, the TV had great picture. Obviously for the great price you can get this hotel for, don't expect a luxerious 5 star hotel, but I'd personally rather save big $ on a hotel and explore NYC, rather than sit around a plush hotel room. This place will not disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free parking!”
Reviews.Author: poshmels
Reviews.Content: This is my second time that I've booked at this hotel and I was still not disappointed. It's pretty hard to be disappointed for a well-priced hotel with free parking (parking can be 35$ a day in NYC). The thing is, is that you need to be a quad occ. to make it a good price. A would say that the hotel is basic and nothing was not good. I went to this hotel maybe 6 years ago and got a room that was with an entry outside (the room of the door was outside the main building, around the outside pool which makes the hotel look like a motel sort of. That room was a little damp and older, but maybe since then, they done renovations. I even shipped a parcel to the hotel, and they received it (at first, the person from security didn't remember receiving it, but then confirmed the name of the person who had signed for it, and then remembered...). You also need to book at this hotel in advance and with its 24hr cancellation policy, it's worth booking in advance and just cancelling if you're not leaving to NY finally. Last minute bookings at this hotel must be impossible. I always book directly on their website and get the best rate. This hotel is literally 2-3 blocks from Times Square and maybe a block from the bus terminal. I couldn't ask for better for the same price. To finish, I think it would of costed us the same price to stay in a hostel further so you really get the best price for a greatly located hotel in NY. Nothing luxurious, but the basic (anyways, do you stay in NY for the hotel or to be in the city?!!) Oh and there's a 7eleven and a Duane Right a block away!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently close to Times Sq”
Reviews.Author: clauz
Reviews.Content: We went just before Christmas with a large group of friends and we stayed a full week at the Travel Inn. We all liked the hotel. Surely not a luxury venue, but we found all we needed: clean rooms, good heating, nice staff. The best thing is that the hotel is 5-10 min walking distance to Times Square, close to all transportation. We really enjoyes our stay and definitely would go back - I would recommend to anyone. The fact the hotel doesnt provide breakfast allowed us to discover the renown deli places serving yummy pancakes and delicious cappuccinos. And: room rates are lowest in Manhattan ;)

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about hotel, location great!!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotters
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at the Travel Inn with my son in mid-December. First impressions were great, very welcoming reception area, warm and festive looking, check-in was fast and efficient. Reception staff were helpful but not over friendly. After having read some negative comments regarding staff attitude I was expecting worse but it really was no problem at all. We were directed to the lift and made our way up to our room where we encountered our first problem. I had emailed ahead to ask for a quiet-ish room to find we had been given a room facing 42nd street. It was very noisy and on being in the room for just 5 mins, I realised there was no way we would have had a peaceful sleep so back down to reception we went. Our room was changed with no bother at all and our second room was in the 'older' part of the hotel - motel style rooms that surround the outdoor pool. We found it to be clean, well appointed, great fridge and microwave that we used most days but a very dated bathroom which could really do with updating. Two comfortable double beds and a lovely flat screen TV (could have done with a channel list though!). No real complaints - brilliant maid service too. One thing to note is that you had to run the shower for a good 10 minutes before you got any hot water out of it, might have been the time of year though?? After the first night we started to feel the cold in the room. This was probably down to the fact that the heating in these rooms is pretty ancient looking and that you actually have to exit the main hotel itself to reach your front door so you are not benefitting from the heat in the main hotel. I rang down to reception to be told that the heating was on an automated system and when it dropped below 40 degrees we would get heat!! Not ideal and we spent that evening watching TV under our bedding! Thankfully the following night the temperature dropped and we got heating!! Not ideal in winter but I can imagine that these rooms are lovely during the summer. The next issue that we came across was the paper thin walls as mentioned by others. For the first couple of days we had two ladies who woke me up at 6am chatting. After that a family moved in with a young child who didn't stop talking/shouting from the hours of 7pm to 10pm - we were glad they left after just two nights! During our stay we had need to use a few of the facilities namely the safety deposit box behind reception, the printer to get our attraction tickets and the wi-fi in our room. Absolutely no complaints at all - in fact the wi-fi worked brilliantly in our room and was a really great price, $6 for 24 hours. I can also recommend the little shop in reception which is like a Tardis!! Slightly overpriced but stocks pretty much anything you might need. Most mornings we ate breakfast at the deli next to the hotel. Fantastic service, great prices and lovely food - highly recommended! Within 5 mins walk of the hotel there is also a liquer store and a small but well stocked supermarket if you wish to stock up your fridge - we found this invaluable after a long days sightseeing when all we wanted to do was crash out in our room. Location was simply perfect, 10 mins walk to Times Square and subway. Many restaurants and fast food joints within 10 mins walk in any direction. Could not fault in that aspect. Overall we had a pretty pleasant experience and I would probably recommend if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, free parking”
Reviews.Author: millie516
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 4 times, it is 3 blocks from time square, 3 blocks from Javis Center, easy to get to, and to top it free parking. They have wifi and a pool in the summer. I really love this hotel. the staff if so nice and friendly. one complaint the one elevator didn't work on our last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: newryman
Reviews.Content: Travelled on the 7th to the 12th of December 2011 On arrival at the hotel the check in was smooth, no delay. Our party of seven required two rooms (5 adults and 2 kids), these were allocated on different floors. However on check-in , we requested the two rooms on the same floor, this was not a problem and was done instantly. The porter was very friendly and gave us information on the hotels facilities. There is a diner attached to the hotel that is excellent value and we had breakfast there every morning. The hotel has an arrangement with the Theatre Diner, which is nearby, to provide room service. We availed of this twice and it was excellent value, a portion for one would do two people adequately. Food nice and hot upon delivery. No problem with this hotel would recommend this to anyone and would stay here again. We ate at the Hard Rock Cafe in Times Square twice and this was excellent value, however we had a bad experience at TGI Fridays on 5th Avenue. Very expensive, food not great, and the wait to be seated long for the poor service that we received. Anyone travelling with a large party would be well advised to use the service obtained by the Hotel for airport transfers. The driver took 7 passengers with 8 large cases and 3 hand luggage sized cases with no problem, rate very reasonable - 130 dollars. We went to Central Park for ice skating. It was a great day out, excellent value. There was markets at Central Park, great value and it passed a few hours looking at the produce. We visited the Empire State Building and would advise to avail of the fast track that was being sold by Sales Reps on the street in the surrounding area of the Builiding. It saved us hours of queuing and meant we had more time to visit other tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best (Affordable) Hotel in the Theater District”
Reviews.Author: BilleAxell
Reviews.Content: After we had our horrible experience at the Hotel Carter we found this diamond in the rough. located 3 blocks from Times Square on 42nd street, this place is very affordable (at the right time of year). They have their own parking garage for guests and it doesnâ€™t cost any extra to park with them. The rooms are basic... nothing more then you want, and nothing less then you need. They are big enough to easily fit 4 people and luggage. I have not gone into the pool myself... but I have felt the water and it didnâ€™t give me that gross chlorine feeling... and didnâ€™t smell bad either. I would HIGHLY suggest the Travel Inn Hotel for the budget traveler... if your dates are flexible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clear and clean”
Reviews.Author: FromBelleProvince
Reviews.Content: We spent our Christmas Holiday in New York and reserved at Travel Inn. It's the perfect place to visit the city : on the 42nd st near time square, Port Authority Station and Holy Cross Church. The hotel rooms are clean and large, the parking is free and you can find a deli for breakfeast on the same sidewalk. Staff is eager to help and very friendly. Who could ask for more when you pay such a low rate ? We will undoutedly stay there for our next time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “great value near times square with 2 double beds”
Reviews.Author: WalterFerreira
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in november. The hotel is good as well as the staff, location is good, but the rooms needs some improvement regarding the air condition/heater system (it was really really hot. I had to take a cold/cool bath and lay on the bed without shirt and blanket on, in order to fall sleep). watch out when standing on the bathtub, because it is very slippery (above average). wireless signal is weak. on the other hand, the room is spacy, good tv, and there was a mini refrigerator (I dont remember if there was a microwave). all in all it's a great value, and if you're looking for a place near times square or the port authority terminal requiring 2 double beds, you may want to look for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccably Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with our 2 teenage daughters mid-December. Yes, it s a very basic hotel, but for the price, the location, and the free parking, it cannot be beat! It was absolutely spotless, and larger than most hotel rooms in the price range, and you can walk to Times Square! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who does not insist on the glitz and glamour you can get at some of the hotels in the city!

Reviews.Title: “leave high expectations behind”
Reviews.Author: pbalrina
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed one night prior to boarding a Christmas cruise. pros-good location, clean, inexpensive -loud group smoking around pool area near our room, called front desk and security came right up and kicked them out. cons-walls too thin (heard everything in the room next door), old matresses felt like rocks Due to cons, probably would'nt stay here again

Reviews.Title: “All you need, some of what you want.”
Reviews.Author: Genista71
Reviews.Content: In early Dec I took a school group of teenage boys to NYC from Australia. The Travel Inn was a good choice for a home base whilst there for a week. It's inexpensive, in a great location and the rooms are a decent size. There are no frills but the boys thought it was a cool place. The staff at the front desk consistently looked annoyed whenever you fronted there and paying for wireless was a daily pain in the butt. But really all this wasn't enough for me to not recommend this place when wanting a cheap place to stay. I'd be booked it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: Moms4Bieber
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel the week of Thanksgiving Novemer 21st - 23th. Price was $125 for the Monday and Tuesday and $225 for Wednesday night. This increase was acceptable/understandable since the next morning was the Macy's parade. We, however, were there camping out for the Justin Bieber Concert at the Today Show! **It is VERY important to note that the price of this hotel INCLUDES parking. Absolutely unheard of in NYC! All the other hotels were $350 a night plus anywhere from $25-$50 extra per night for parking! I first was concened a little about the location of the hotel (not knowing the city) but upon arrival found it to be perfectly fine. Actually they are directly across the street from the police station. I took off one star because when we first checked in they did send us to a "back section" of the hotel where the room was sort of like a closet. However, as soon as I called the front desk they immediately had us come back down and gave us a front room. The rooms are nice and clean. Nothing spectacular but perfectly acceptable. Nicest of all were the front desk staff. We had occasion to speak with them at all hours as we were coming back and forth at different times as my husband and I took turns camping in the cold and rain at Rockefeller Plaza. Every staff member was polite, cheerful and accomodating! On our day of check out they even let us leave our car in the garage for the afternoon so that we could go on foot and do a little sightseeing. They are only 3 blocks from Times Square so the location couldnt have been better. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone looking for a decent hotel at a fair price. Or you can go 3 blocks down the road and pay twice as much or more for the same thing!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: shazam10
Reviews.Content: I was expecting it to be average at best but boy was I wrong. From the great location, to the extremely clean room to lovely LCD tv and of course the free parking! It was all good. I asked for a higher floor and facing the pool and the staff complied willingly. The room I got was a double double, room 625. I don't know if they're all the same quality though, but the one I got was just like the pictures on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Great & not so good”
Reviews.Author: tampatom1
Reviews.Content: Retired couple with son/wife to see Christmas season in NYC-4 days- we had a double double room 1) Reservations & front desk- Ailyn did a great and helpful job in helping us choose the right room for our wants. Last day we had a health set back and staff was VERY helpful working on some details. 2) Some food places we tried - Broadway Bagel , deli next door very convenient and economical and good; two blocks going east Theater Row Diner good at night ; Ovest Pizzoteca (see Yelp reviews) we really enjoyed ; Carnegie Deli, good food - not so good- OVER priced, $12 min. per person no credit cards, I would choose Katz hands down; Laguardia airport- Delta food court hamburger and salad bar reasonable and good. 3) Transportation- M-42 bus right outside door of Hotel, it runs East & West. To and from Laguardia to Hotel- > M-60 bus to Astoria Boulevard/31 street- ride N or Q subway to Times Square- M-42 to Hotel. Reverse to airport. We left Hotel on Thursday 3:45p and were at airport about 4:50p with rain. 4) Sight seeing- we did Gray Line hop on-off. Son wanted overview of NYC I went into overload with useless extra details. I would agree with other reviews of touring NYC pick out what you want to see and do your own thing , the MTA Trip Planner is great for it. Personal comment on various reviews- anyone can look for and nitpick almost anything, it boils down to attitude. If you want to have a great time then do it, enjoy the people try to know a little about them, most people want to help out if you don't treat them as a personal slave. Life is too short to always be looking out to something to dog about. tampatom

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: Watertown_NYEmma22
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location and everything you need available. We arrived at ten in the morning and they allowed us to park early. It was a great value, we will definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “"5th stay here"”
Reviews.Author: patrick k
Reviews.Content: About our 5th stay at T.I. By far our best experience,very clean,updated and spacious and the staff was wonderful.free indoor parking,definately return...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Delmiss
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend of dec4 to dec5... It was one of the cheaper hotel in NYC, we got to our hotel the front person was nice. The rooms were small but clean! But it was too hot we turned the heater off but still was hot!!! That's the only thing i didnt like about it. The hotel was close to great restaurant and 8 min walk to time square close to great shopping stores!! Next time I go to NYC again I will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything about the hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and have nothing but good things to say about it. Saleem was at the front desk when we checked in early and gave us a great room and was very curtious. The room was standard but we only needed it to sleep. For the price and the free parking, which we were able to leave our car there after checkout, it was great. The hotel is a very close to the Lincoln Tunnel, Times Square, MSG, Restaurant Row, etc. There is a market, deli, wine/beer store within a 2 minute walk. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here 4 times & satisfied!!!”
Reviews.Author: courtcop
Reviews.Content: I travel to Manhattan as often as I can, roughly 45 trips in the past 5 years...stayed at many hotels in & around Times Square. Once I found this one I've decided this is now my place to stay in NYC, due to location, 3 blocks from Times Square, can't beat the price for the location, great staff & always clean!!! Stayed here 4 times already & am planning trips this New Years, Memorial Day & a week in the Summer, I plan on using this hotel for many more stays!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, comfortable but no luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: We reserved two rooms, both with two double rooms. This was very convenient for us, as a big family was travelling together. Another of the two rooms had a very bad cigarette smell, but we got another room right away. That room was a slightly away, which was uncomfortable but understandable. The hotel is quite basic and it takes some times to walk from the reception to the rooms. I wouldnt want to stay in rooms on the ground floor, facing the pool. The hotel is nicely located, it took us only 10 minutes (maybe 15) to walk to Times Sq. In my experience this hotel was a good value for the money. We didnt use any added service from the hotel and I never got the feeling that they could offer us anything extra. If they had breakfast at the hotel, which I dont know of, my feeling is that I would never have one at the hotel and always seek alternatives. But I am coming back, when on a budget journey.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Down”
Reviews.Author: tcruskall
Reviews.Content: Spent Four nights at this hotel, and it was not the best place to stay, their customer service was rude, they were not helpful and pass along incorrect information to our limo driver, i have also sent an email to them recently due to leaving my braclet behind and never got a reply.. i do not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “If you're driving it's hard to beat . . .”
Reviews.Author: justjaneb
Reviews.Content: I drive up to New York with friends for a long weekend about once a year or so, and we've used this hotel as a base several times. You really can't beat the value for the location if you have a car, since you can park it yourself for no extra charge, right there at the hotel. The rooms are always clean and comfortable; the location is perfect to wander around Times Square and the rest of midtown--you're practically there when you emerge from the Lincoln Tunnel; and the rates are amazing for the part of town the hotel is in. Just returned from Veterans Day weekend and we're already planning to return in January.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but certainly not nice”
Reviews.Author: Izel17
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night while travelling for work. The hotel is fine. The staff was friendly & helpful. Room was clean & decent but by no means was this a nice hotel. One thing that was great was the water pressure in the shower....this was very important to me after a long day. The hotel is only a few blocks from the subway and Times Square so that was helpful. I would recommend you stay here is money is a concern and you are truly only using this place to sleep & shower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nigel C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid November 2011. The hotel staff are very helpful and the rooms are clean and safe. Its NYC so you don't spend much time in your room but this is a great place to stay. Its close to Time Square (just along 42st from the hotel) and has a good deli next door which is great for breakfast. When we return to NYC i would stay here again for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kleopetra
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in November. We got a smoking room without micro and fridge and close to the elevator for the first night. This was the worst hotel room I ever spent a night in. After complaining we were moved to a non smoking room another day. They could not move us earlier as they were full the first night. The second room was much better, but again close to the elevators. The room was quite noisy, we could hear elevators running whole night, but we got used to that. They cleaned the room every day and there were definitelly no bed bugs in our room, which was our main concern. The receptionists were not very friendly, something we are not used to. They should at least pretend their interest in you. All in all the stay was fine, but I do not think we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a coffee maker”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: The bed was comfortable and we had a quite nights sleep. The room was too warm even though we kept the window open all night. I think the heat seeps in from the hallway. I also missed having a coffeemaker in the room. Thank goodnes Starbucks is a block away. We did night have a car. Christian drove us to LaGuardia the next day. That was a delightful highlight and ending to our trip to N.Y. Thank you to Christian and all the staff at the Travel Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Going to New York City in Your Car”
Reviews.Author: Travelhappy31
Reviews.Content: Travel Inn is the cheapest hotel that you can find in Manhattan area where you can park your car upon arriving in their carports after which you can just unload and go to your reserved room..How cool is that instead of parking garages across the streets and after long hours of driving you still have to have to walk..I really recommend this hotel especially for those family travelling with kids in the CAR...because NYC as I've found out has no parking space at all and you run at risk of bumping your car...So while you stay in NYC for couple of days before your next destinations you better relax and enjoy the city like New Yorkers do w/o the hassle of CAR., there's lot of other forms of transportation while in NYC...subways, bus, train..taxis...and after you have visited the places you wanted to see, you can just drive back to your next destination without the HASSLE of transferring your stuff from your hotel room to parking garages across the streets because in Travel Inn you just get your stuff packed and drive you go... I love to stay again in this hotel if we go back driving since everything is accessible .TImes Square is a few blocks away..and that's the heart of New York...need I say more?...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: BarbieChichester
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Travel inn in New York. The location was ideal- close to Times Square, the boat trips, not far to walk to Central Park, Empire State building and close to the shops. The subway station was about a 5 minute walk along 42nd Street. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. Our room- we went for one of the larger rooms and it was very comfortable, including TV, microwave, bathroom, iron, hair dryer etc and a view across the pool (which we didn't use as we stayed in November). Overall it was a very pleasant stay and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel and free parking--- heat/a/c control, not so much!”
Reviews.Author: rotmeister
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and free parking but it was a week after a cold snap and snow storm and the hotel only has 1 control for the whole hotel (two buildings). They had turned the heat on and although it was hot, their was no possibility of turning on air conditioning and we weren't told when we checked in. I finally called the front desk thinking it was something we could control and still wasn't told it wasn't until the maintenance man came up with a FAN that we were told about the lack of control! We slept very poorly and was up by 3:30 am and left the hotel at 4:00 am. No one could help us when we checked out but when I called later and talked to the manager I was given a discount. The hotel was clean and well situated (on 42nd street and 3 blocks from all the fun and only one block from restaurant row! The price without the discount was great especially because of the free parking!!!

Reviews.Title: “New York Marathon weekend”
Reviews.Author: SkinnyJonny
Reviews.Content: The Travel Inn is ideally suited to economy accommodation for the New York Marathon. The hotel was suitable for a group sharing twin rooms, VFM and reasonably priced compared to other NY hotels in the vicinity. However, be warned, as anywhere within a stone throw of Times Square it is very noisy at night especially if you have rooms at the front overlooking 42nd street. The rooms are also very hot and we asked on several occasions for the heating to be reduced or switched off altogether. Although there is a micro wave there are no facilities for making hot drinks. In summary, ideal for sharing with your running mates (not at the front!) but I wouldn't take your partner as you could find better accommodation at a slightly higher rate.

Reviews.Title: “Basic But No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: PilotBoy72
Reviews.Content: Yet again another great Tripadvisor recommendation! The most important thing was the room was clean and functional. Only slightly disconcerting that there was a mouse trap on the floor but I hope this was there as a precaution! The room did seem clean and everything was functional including a nice TV and fridge which was handy to keep drinks in. Nice clean sheets and comfy bed. The room was also surprisingly quiet given we were in the "city that never sleeps" Also great location, lots of restaurants on 8th - 10th Avenue and only 10mins from Times Square! Staff friendly and helpful and a free left luggage room which was very handy. All in all a fairly basic hotel but no complaints and exactly as expected. Great value for New York and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Inn Hotel, New York City”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my first trip to NYC. Stayed 3 nights at the Travel Inn Hotel on 42nd Street. Have to give the hotel an "Average" rating. Location was great...comfortable walking distance to pretty much everything around Times Square, Theater District, Fashion District, etc. Got a decent rate (for NYC standards) from getaroom.com ($200/night). The hotel itself was old with a weird-like musty smell in the lobby. No big deal if you plan to enjoy the city and not the hotel room. I have to say that this is probably the noisiest hotel I've ever stayed in. First night stayed in a room right off the elevator. Bad idea. Heard EVERYTHING...ALL NIGHT. Hotel staff accommodated and gave us another room for our last two nights. Elevator sounds were muffled somewhat, but not sure why we could hear all of the bathroom noises in the next room. Reached under the bed to grab the tv remote, came out with the biggest rat trap I've ever seen. In all fairness, the room itself was visually clean enough for what we needed it for. The hotel staff, although not overly friendly, was accomodating, and the location was good. If you're looking for the Ritz, go there. If you're looking for a place to lay your head after a long day of NYC shennanigans, then I would recommend the Travel Inn on 42nd.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AKGH
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Travel Inn last Sunday and Monday (Oct 23 and 24, 2011). We arrived early (about 4 hours before checking time) and they let us park our car for free so we can enjoy New York City for the first time. The hotel was clean and I felt safe. The parking garage was secure and I felt comfortable leaving my car there. The hotel was also walking distance to most of the major attractions of Manhattan. It was close to Circle Line Cruises (tour to the Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, etc) and the Intreped Air & Space Museum (which had the Concord, the Intreped Aircraft Carrier, Growler Submarine, etc). It was also walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building (a little lenghty walk for the Empire State, but you can do it), etc. The hotel recommended diner (Theater Row Diner) was excellent for breakfast (there is also a Bagle place besides the hotel). I rate this hotel as an excellent for the price, clean rooms, free parking and would definitely stay there again!!.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cobblestone16
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is ideal for Times Square & the Theatre District. I highly recommend it. 3 friends & I shared a quad room that had two double beds, bathroom. It was clean, comfortable & relatively roomy. We had a full size fridge, a microwave and larger flat screen TV than usual (not that we watched it). It was more like a mini apartment than a hotel bedroom. Disappointed there was not a kettle but we got around it by heating water in the microwave for our brews. Maid service daily meant we had clean towels as well as a cleaned room every day. We stayed for 4 nights (Friday to Monday) and had such a great time we all said we would use this hotel when we next visit New York. It was very reasonably priced ($310 each for the 4 nights) - the epitome of 'Cheap and cheerful'.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Free Parking”
Reviews.Author: bongo330
Reviews.Content: Decided about a month ago to visit NYC for the weekend. It was too late to book early and get in on any hotel deals, so I had to search quite a bit to find a hotel with a rate that was affordable for our trip. The Travel Inn gave us that rate and the free parking is what made up our mind to stay there. We had a room with two double beds, which gave us enough space, but the bathroom was quite small and there was no exhaust fan. Overall it was clean and within walking distance to subway, restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for the price being close to subway, grocery, diners and Time Sq.”
Reviews.Author: jasondailey
Reviews.Content: Overall good stay. Most inexpensive we found on the mid west side. Closer to Times Sq than you might think. Was in the theater district and is only a few feet from the Emporium grocery store and a CVS pharmacy. Theater Row diner was a good place for us for breakfast each day. Overall there isnt alot to do at the hotel but we didnt spend alot of time in the room. Room was clean and quiet. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: barbiespice99
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to 42nd Street/Port Authority subway station which connects up with most subway train lines. Comfortable rooms. We stayed in winter, so couldn't utilise the pool. Would be great fun in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “If you want clean......”
Reviews.Author: dandjlang
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Travel Inn for two weekday nights for $175.00 per night, including parking! It is, by far, one of the cleanest hotels we have ever stayed in, when I say clean, I mean shinny clean! Well-appointed rooms and bath, however small, actually the bathroom was very small but the value we received made up for the small size. A deli serves breakfast and lunch. We paid under $20.00 for breakfast each morning. It included eggs (anyway) bacon or sausage, homefries, toast and juice. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - The worst front office staff”
Reviews.Author: CHARLES M
Reviews.Content: Great location and clean room. The worst front office staff you can come across...no greeting, no welcome...they stare at you as to say " what are you doing here "

Reviews.Title: “super stay”
Reviews.Author: tim42746
Reviews.Content: my family and I just returned from new york and after a lot of reviewing decided to try the travel inn hotel. we are so glad we did. a great room , good size, we arrived on sunday the 2nd of oct and were a few hours early for check-inn, the staff locked our luggage in a secure room so that we could go and enjoy new york. very clean rooms and the security was great.great little deli right beside the hotel. very satisfied. when I come back to new york will stay again. also some of the best rates in new york. tim hardyville ky

Reviews.Title: “They make it right”
Reviews.Author: trmustang01
Reviews.Content: In a society of were not responsible, this hotel assumed responsibility. Our car had water damage from a leak in the ceiling, The hotel management addressed the situaion with compensation and a solution to the problem.Truely refreshing experience ,great location aswell. The real NY experience at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: hazelson
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in September. Travel Inn's location was fantastic for Times Square and there was a large grocery store in the next block. Lots of delis and restaurants in the immediate area as well. We had a room overlooking 42nd st, and, with the window closed, traffic noise was minimal. The room was spacious with 2 double beds, and fridge and microwave came in handy. Staff was very nice and handled a problem we encountered within a short time. We would highly recommend the Travel Inn - in fact we already have a friend going to book.

Reviews.Title: “Close walk to times square and free parking garage”
Reviews.Author: Jenny B
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on price, location to attractions and subway, and the free parking garage, as we were visiting NYC on a budget, and we were not disappointed, the Travel Inn lived up to what we hoped it would be. The Travel Inn is a short walk to Times square and lots of other attractions which was great. Rooms were clean and had enough space, nice place to rest after a long day of walking around the city. Bathrooms were nice and clean and we had no problems with the water pressure or temperature. Some staff at the desk were more helpful then others. Had to call the manager (ext number is available in welcome book) as upon check in the lobby staff told us that our request for a smoking room could not be granted. Called manager and within 5 minutes we were moving to our smoking room. Other wise staff helpful, with directions and things to see. One female staff even gave us a map and wrote on it directions and subway stops we needed to get to our destinations. The free parking is great (you will have trouble finding parking at all, let alone a FREE parking garage at any other hotel in Manhattan) and the hotel is only a couple minutes from the Lincoln tunnel so you dont really have to drive into the city traffic. Subway station is a few minute walk away which is great and there is a grocery store and liqour store practicaly right next store to the hotel. Room came with a mini fridge and a microwave. No coffee maker but there is a deli right next store you can get your morning coffee from. The hotel is clean and the neighbourhood feels very safe, there is a police station right across the street. Didnt use the pool because we visited in winter. All in all it was a fantastic trip and the hotel was great. Will definatley go again and have recomended this hotel to our friends who have gone and loved it as well.

Reviews.Title: “WELL LOCATED BAD SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: CitlalliCortez
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great location... My experience was bad since they didnt clean well my room, i even found clothes of the last guest ... The worst wast that THEY CHARGED MY CARD 10 TIMES, so my bank blocked and i could used it while i was there... i didnt found about this til i was on my flight back home , in every single place my card was denied , it didnt make sense for so i used i different one... i dont know why the did it , but i find it very suspicious.

Reviews.Title: “Undecided”
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: My trip from England was for pleasure, depending on your kind of trip will depend what you make of this hotel. Me and my friend were just looking for a base, somewhere to wash and sleep and this is what we got. A slight mix up on the booking found us in a very small dark and dingy room, the staff at reception did move us to the correct room but got the impression they weren't overly pleased about doing this. Location: Pretty good to be honest, just far enough out to be quiet and close enough to walk everywhere, you do have to walk past some dodgy people from TSQ to get back to the hotel though. NYPD right opposite though. Cleanliness: Bed and sheets clean, bathroom clean, fresh towels daily, what more do you want? I'd rather smell air-freshener than any nasty smells. Sleep Quality: After miles and miles of walking each day we were pretty tired each night so slept ok, despite overlooking the main road, we did sleep with the window closed though. We weren't located by the lift but there was a resonable loud droneing sound that may affect some people. Rooms: Double - two double beds, large TV that worked, large fridge which was a bonus! Adequate sized bathroom and good sized wardrobe with iron. Yes it's dated and not very modern would be an understatement! Service: Hmmmm it was ok, staff not overly friendly but they did what they had to and sometimes made you feel awkward when asking for anything. DO NOT book a taxi back to JFK through the hotel, we did it as it was easier but they charge $20 more than a yellow taxi! I was unaware until I came on here that there was air-conditioning in the rooms, I presume it wasn't working, the pool looked ok and clean, the gym had what was needed, there was somewhere to put your luggage if you have a late flight....saying that this was away from reception and unmanned and unlocked when we turned up at 6pm to collect our things!!!! Overal this is an old and outdated building, if your looking for a base to stay this is good, you will save some money to spend on 5th Avenue! However if you will spend any length of time in the hotel I would be inclined to avoid it. Would I stay here again.....if I couldn't find anywhere better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NYC!!”
Reviews.Author: OwladyJ
Reviews.Content: What a treat to have a spacious (by NY standards) room in a great location with FREE PARKING in an adjacent parking garage. The hotel was a few steps away from a deli (Broadway Deli, I believe) where I could pick up morning coffee and eats. There was a fitness center in the hotel, which I used one morning, and a nice outdoor pool in a courtyard--an oasis amidst the busy city. The hotel is a 5-10 minutes walk from the theater district and from Times Square and therefore in a quieter area. My only complaint is that our room was near the elevator, and the noise was a little invasive, but I'll gladly take it when I consider all the positives of staying here. My husband loved it, too, and we hope to stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “If we could have found somewhere else, we would have. Over-priced and below average.”
Reviews.Author: peipod
Reviews.Content: PROS If you want to be right near Times Square this Motel is within walking distance There is also the Port Authority Bus Terminal within walking distance There are plenty of restaurants etc around Housekeeping was good, they made the beds and refilled everything in the morning. CONS We had no hot water for around 12 hours, that's one before bed and one early in the morning before we had to go to the Airport at 6am. On check out i told the guy at the counter there had been no hot water in the room for 12 hours to which he replied "That's ok". Hmmm. It wasn't really. To get to our room (637) we had to get one lift up to the 3rd floor, walk down the corridor and get another lift to the 6th floor. This got a bit tiresome after a while of coming and going throughout the day and night. Our room was located behind the lift wall so we had the noise of the lift coming and going all through the night which got a bit irritating after a while. The room got quite cold at night which, along with the noise of the lift, woke us throughout the night. There was a strange, white stain on on our blanket and strange marks on the wall. There were no extra blankets, and only 2 pillows on the bed with no extras. The lifts were very slow, at one point I thought they might break down, low and behold when we returned one afternoon one of the lifts was 'out of order', although I admit I don't know why. The tv reception was poor and the remote control was tedious, I think it needed new batteries. Internet is not included and costs $6 for 24 hours The reception staff are not overly friendly, you need to call out to them to get their attention-even for checking in despite 3 staff standing there, seemingly ignoring you. We did not realise it was the UN Grand Assembly week which may have been why it was difficult to find alternate accommodation, and perhaps this is why the rate was so high but this was a VERY expensive motel considering the quality of it. I would not stay here again, or recommend to friends. ALSO: Be weary of reception offering to call you a cab to the Airport for a flat rate of $65... you can get a NY cab off the street for a flat rate of $45 (including tolls and a 20% tip it'll cost you $56)

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Achilies_01
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Location (Good neighborhood, minutes from main attractions) - Price - Free Parking This makes it very convenient and unique in Manhattan. Cons: - RUDE and unhelpful staff - Paid wifi, even if you pay it does not work (staff unwilling to resolve the issue) - No fan in the bathroom! - Smelly/poor air-conditioned rooms - TV broken and only two channels available - Early check-in paid! If your budget is tight, get this hotel. Otherwise, get something else. If you are the owner and reading it, do something about the staff please! I'm not paying $250/night to be treated like that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mandotsan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only blocks from Times Square and all the shows..its also VERY close to mant nice restruants an i located on the west side so is close to the Hudson and the Cruise Ship Terminals. My wife and I felt very secure at this hotel..heck the NYPD was right across the street. We drove so we needed a location that offered parking..ahich they did. We parked our car the day we arrived..and never needed it until we left 5 days later. The room we had was GREAT..the shower was walkin..and i do mean walk in..you could have gotten 4 people in it..if your into that sort of thing..great hotel..great trip

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, affordable and close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: volvojack
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I stayed here during the last week of August and were very impressed. The proximity to attractions, mixed with the low rate, clean rooms, and free parking could not be matched by any other hotel in the City. It's a 15 min walk to Times Square, the Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum and boat tours, 10 mins. to the subway and bus tours. There is also a small cafe/restaurant next door to the hotel that offers average meals at a reasonable price. It was perfect for grabbing a quick breakfast and coffee before heading out for the day. We will definitely stay at the Travel Inn again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Maid Stole my MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey D
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed good at first, free parkin was good. BUT i paid for wi-fi it abrely even worked i thik i was on for 30 seconds twice and it didnt work, asked the desk for help NO HELP at all!! The guy at the front desk was so rude and didnt care about anything. And The maid wasnt supposed to clean my room and i had a enveloppe of 150$ with my papers on my bed, went out for half an hour when i got back the maid cleaned the room my papers were in the drawer and MONEY GONE! I then destroyed the room no where to be found called the front desk asked them about it all they could say was same maids for 20 years, call back in the morning to ask and maybe it'll be in the lost and found, lost and found? it was in MY ROOM! the elevator stops at every floor and sometimes won't even come when you press the button! by far horrible hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location! Will return.”
Reviews.Author: kayandjay530
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in NYC, but this one in particular was the best when it comes to value. I was immediately interested in staying here when I saw how reasonable the prices were and where it was located. The first thing I noticed when we arrived was how clean it smelled in the lobby. Once we got to our room we were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. After traveling to NYC quite often, I am used to staying in small rooms, but this room in particular was actually a standard sized room. This hotel also had a swimming pool, which you don't find at many NYC hotels. We didn't swim in it though, because the water was rather cold. The location was just a few short blocks to Times Square and major subway stations. Once our trip came to an end, we told the man at the desk that we needed a taxi to pick us up the next day for the airport. The taxi ended up arriving right on schedule and we couldn't believe it when the 'taxi' turned out to be a stretch limo with no extra cost than a regular yellow cab. It was a great way to end the trip! I recommend this hotel to anyone and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here for the Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Welcomedfeedback
Reviews.Content: If I could assign this a 3.5, I would. I didn't think it was quite there at the "Very Good" level. My 15 yoa daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights, 8, 9, 10 August 2011. The room was a double double and cost me $681 (incl all taxes and fees). Hotels in NYC are the costliest in the U.S., so I tried to find a balance between comfort, cleanliness, location, and cost. This hotel met all my needs, and I would stay here again. My daughter would disagree, but she wasn't the one shelling out the $$ for an amazing trip to NYC. - I used the fitness center once - it was pretty bad (old equipment, no towels, cheaply made life cycle and elliptical machine) but it got the job done. - We didn't use the pool because we didn't have the time. - Nearby (1 1/2 blocks away) there was a full grocery store. - On the hotel property is a great restaurant/deli with good food at a good price. - Located about a 6 - 8 minute walk from the subway station. - Front desk (not a concierge) provided faulty information regarding taxis. The woman told me the cab fare to LaGuardia was a flat rate...not true...the taxis use a meter. For us it cost $36 (tip included) if I remember right. Now the taxis do charge a flat rate from JFK into anywhere in Manhattan - $45; this does not include tolls or tip. -One thing that annoyed me is the A/C was working just fine, but there was no way to control it so I had to have housekeeping bring up some extra blankets. -Microwave and fridge was provided in the room. - There were several fluff and fold laundry centers nearby. I dropped off 10 lbs of laundry and picked it up the next morning (could have picked it up at the end of the day of drop off) and paid $12.00 for clean, folded laundry. Extremely reasonable. - Located in Hell's Kitchen, unfortunately I didn't make it out to the many bars and restaurants in the area. I'll hit the shot glasses and pints next time if visiting with colleagues. - What's holding me back from giving it a better review? Cost is one thing - It is NYC, even so, I'm still expecting a bit more for $200 a night. The other is its an old building - the uncontrollable A/C and dated drapes/bed coverings show it. Get some new gym equipment so I can work off some of that NYC cheese cake and pizza, please. I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, huge rooms.”
Reviews.Author: amp322
Reviews.Content: This was the only hotel under $400 that I could find for the night I needed to stay over in NY. So... I went for it, and was very happy. Free parking!! (in a very tight garage.. but free!) Room was huge. Not fancy. In fact - it was pretty outdated, but it was clean and had great ammenities. Mini fridge, microwave, iron, etc.. Actually a good value, if you add up what they offer. Lobby is small but OK. There are places to eat close by, and the location is good for sightseeing and theater going, etc. Intrepid is right across the street. Theaters are just a few blocks away. I recommend it, if you don't care about stylish/hip decor, and just want a decent place to stay over. They have a pool, too, so it would be a good place for families to stay, in the summer time. With the mini kitchen set up in each room, you could actually save a lot of $ on food, so it is actually a great value for a family on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: travelfamincali
Reviews.Content: Pros Parking Garage Pool Location Microwave & small refrigerator in room Cons The other reviewers were right,,,strange and strong smelling cleaner/deodorizer The rooms could be cleaner Paying extra for wi-fi is ridiculous,,,not the money,,,the point,,,they should just charge more for the room and give free-wi-fi,,,Hate feeling "nickel & dimed"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Clean, Reasonable, and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jacquie10
Reviews.Content: We were staying only for a night in NTC and found the Travel In Hotel a perfect spot. Nearby restaurants, very close to the Javits Center, the riverfront for cruises, and not over-the-top expensive. Fabulous, very inexpensive breakfast/lunch restaurant right next door. A big pool with lounge chairs, and... free parking! Someone was always cleaning and sprucing things up! This does not pretend to be the Plaza, but for a quiet, comfortable, and reasonable night or more in the city, this is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Jim G
Reviews.Content: Rooms a bit tired and bathroom small. However overall excellent value - walking distance to Broadway, Times Square and City Tours. Hotel looked after lugguge after check-out - no charge. Good option for solo traveller and short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Inn Always Great!!”
Reviews.Author: styxchik
Reviews.Content: I have been the NYC trip planner for camp for the past 4 years. We love the Travel Inn for our group!! Robert is the best in helping us out w/ our group travel. The deli downstairs is wonderful in providing our group with a one price breakfast each day. The hotel has a rooftop pool that our teens just love. They stay open late for us and even open the meeting room for us to have a group pizza dinner in. You can't get any better than these guys! The rooms are not the Hilton but they are clean and good for a group of teens looking to have a good time in NYC. Location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Diane L
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in your hotel. The location is great. Our room was spotless. My husband was very pleased with the free parking. The pool could be open until 9 or 10pm. The WiFi should be free. For our next trip to New York, we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: caribqn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on a few occasions when visiting NYC. The hotel is located in a decent spot...short walk to Times Square and Restaurant Row. For NYC, the price is usually quite reasonable. The hotel itself is decent. Nothing outstanding, nothing terrible...mid-range. I would say a 3* by American standards. The staff is sufficient for a hotel of this standard. By that I mean, not incredibly friendly, but they serve the purpose. I've never had an issue. As far as rooms, they are a decent size. Some are louder than others based on the location. So, you may want to request a quiet room if you prefer. For 3 of my 4 visits, my room was clean. One visit, there was hair in the bathroom and even on the sheets. I am certainly not one of those people that takes photos of the cracks on the hotel walls and the toilets...however, hair is unacceptable to me. I called down to the desk, and someone was up in my room in ~15 minutes and cleaned the bathroom and changed the sheets. That's acceptable to me. There is also a small pool which serves the purpose and a pathetic "gym"! haha (it should just be removed) Find your workout elsewhere. You could walk a few blocks to get anywhere or jump on the train. There are numerous things right nearby also. The restaurant downstairs has a good variety of reasonably- priced items. There is also a grocery store and liquor store next door, in addition to numerous restaurants, bars, etc. Overall, I have enjoyed staying here and will likely stay again. (mainly for the price & parking) If you are looking for fancy, don't bother. If you are looking for average, fairly priced and a decent location...this may be perfect. If you don't plan to spend much time @ the hotel, it's sufficient for sleeping and having a cheap breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would return”
Reviews.Author: Tia75
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The rooms were a great size, and hotel was clean. ( Bathroom was a bit tight but this wasn't a concern.). Hotel was in a quiet area, beside the police station. Safe location. Overall, we had a great time in New York and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, nice and big rooms. Perfect value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Lydkaq
Reviews.Content: We were traveling in a group of 8 people. Stayed in New York for four days. Hotel Travel Inn has perfect location near Times Square, just 3 blocks from subway. On your way from subway there are supermarkets, fast foods and pharmacy so you can buy something there. Room was nice, quite big for New York :) and wih charming view to pool area. With TV, small fridge, sofa and bathroom with tub it was everything what you need. Beds were comfy and big, sheets clean. Pool - it looked really nice and clean, but it is open just from 10 to 19. So we missed it :( Elevators - really really slow, we used stairs almost everytime Fitness - there is small fitness, we didnt use it but it was nice, quite old but i think good if you just need to do some excercises I would go back on my next rip to NYC :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Mrsvacation2
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. It was clean and recently updated. Free parking during your stay. Close enough to walk to Time Square. Staff was very kind to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mguerr2
Reviews.Content: My family & I were looking for an inexpensive hotel in New York that would offer FREE parking & were surprised when we actually found one. After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, we decided to go for it. We are really happy we did. The hotel location was absolutly perfect. The hotel is walking distance to Time Square & Grand Central Station. St.Patrick's Cathedral is only 1.5miles (about 13 short blocks) & is a very easy walk. Train & Bus stops were only a block away. The hotel staff was very friendly & the rooms were clean. Now keep in mind this is New York so if you are looking for big rooms, you will most likly have to go to a higher priced hotel. The rooms are a bit small but still comfortable. The bed was clean as was the bathroom. The water pressure was great. My family & I will definitly be back to New York & we will be staying at the Travel Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Tar811
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a stop-gap until my prefered hotel had availability the following night. However, i actually prefered this hotel!! I was basic, but good location and clean and friendly. Wish i would have stayed here all week!!

Reviews.Title: “a good little hotel close to Broadway”
Reviews.Author: Lilpadawanlady
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 adults and one little kid who shared the room . Close to Broadway, the beds were comfy but the bathroom was smallish and they didn't replace the bath stuff the second morning... Having a car, it was really convenient to have a free parking during our stay...

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, GREAT price, NOT luxury.”
Reviews.Author: tajurach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travel Inn for only 1 night while making a quick stop to see the city at the end of a vacation. Pro: GREAT location for the price. Walk everywhere! Was a little concerned about locaiton safety at night but was just fine - even with our kids in tow. FREE parking. We spent a few extra hours in the city on the day of check-out. Made arrangements with night desk to leave our vehicle parked there after check-out which ended up being 3:30pm. No problem- no charge. Con: Room was typical NYC small, but well worn. Although I didn't see any bugs, it had that feel that made me believe they were there somewhere. Sheets and sink were clean. Had a drippy faucet in shower and some signs of mold around tub. Housekeeping was mediocre overall, but again for a short stay- who cares. Front desk staff typical NYC 'not-so-friendly' ... but again, for this price and location- who cares. If you're looking for some personal attention and a pretty bed to lay down in at night, this is not your place. If you are OK with 'probably clean' and want to have easy access to Manhatten ... this is the place for you. Would DEFINITELY stay here again for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK, staff is not”
Reviews.Author: Reiziger_8965
Reviews.Content: Pretty good value for money and some free perks that you would normally have to pay top prices for (parking, swimming pool). Pretty good location, walking distance from Broadway and Times Square, plenty of restaurants nearby on 9th Av. Room was pretty decent, albeit a bit dated, and spacious enough for the 3 of us. Hotel is build right on top of a railroad track,but traffic is very limited on that line so it did not realy bother us to much. The reception staff was hopeless though, there seems to be a bit of a lanuage barrier. Everytime we asked them something they said it was no problem, but a few hours later it all of a sudden was a problem. Few examples: - We extended our stay for a night. The receptionist told me "You are all set", to find us locked out of the room the next day. When we went to the desk the answer was: "You did not follow the proper procedures" , but nobody ever told me wat the procedures were. - They charged my credit card while I wanted to pay cash, told me that they would take care of it at check-out and then told me at check out that it was to late to reverse it. -They forgot our wake-up calls etc. etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of good, but some annoyances to consider”
Reviews.Author: Kat82
Reviews.Content: Someone on TripAdvisor steered me to the free parking at the Travel Inn Hotel for our first ever drive into the city, and what a blessing that was! It also was not that difficult to drive to the hotel, because it was right off of 9A coming from the north, so we didn't have to do much Manhatten driving. Other good things: a full grocery store a block down the street so we could buy bottled water, milk and fresh fruit to keep in the mini-fridge; a CVS across the street; the wonderful little Broadway Diner next door which sold reasonable and delicious breakfast; taxi's were easy to flag down; the outdoor pool which was refreshing for those hot summer days, and no bedbugs. Some annoyances: the internet was $6/day for each device and they required you to get a little access code from the front desk (although upon checkout we only were charged $6 total - not sure why); the internet was very weak and spotty and would drop for no reason; the pool closed at 7 p.m. - too early; room was on the older side and the AC had 2 settings, full blast freezing or off; the bathroom was tiny and we had to use cut off valves under the toilet or the bathtub faucets would run constantly; and no coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Travel Inn”
Reviews.Author: JackieChambly_Quebec
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Travel Inn Hotel near Time Square. This is a great hotel very well located; only 3 blocks from Time Square and the parking is free!
