The room was very clean and best of all no bed bugs! There is an outdoor pool on the roof with lounge chairs and tables for people who want to relax. There is also a small fitness room next to the pool. The only thing I did not like is that there is no free WiFi - you need to pay a fee for it and there is a computer at the reception area but you also have to pay a fee for Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: cindy126
Reviews.Content: After searching for an "affordable" hotel for a quick family weekend getaway, we found the Travel Inn. WHile the price was still sticker shock, it included parking - a tremendous luxury that made it more affordable considering the garages were at least $25-50 per 24 hours. The room was great - 2 double beds, frig, microwave,( no freezer), clean, no bedbugs, and very convenient to times square. Got our bus tour tickets there and the staff was very helpful , Definitley would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “This is a clean, friendly, well located property.”
Reviews.Author: Charlene592
Reviews.Content: I am a tour operator who uses this hotel several times a year for blocks of between 15 and 25 rooms. We have never had a client complaint and we find it to be clean, attractive, comfortable and well located. The breakfast next door at the Broadway Deli is good and reasonable and there are many good restaurants in the neighborhood that are much less expensive than a mere 2 blocks east in Time's Square. The access to the Hudson River and all that it offers is great in the summer and proximity to Time's Square is good all year round. The outdoor pool is a plus in summer. We are particularly pleased with the whole staff and in particular Robert Aaron, sales manager, and his associate, Nurys Perez. It can be rare to be treated so well in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable experience!”
Reviews.Author: kimbi424
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, but felt I had to write about the Travel Inn Hotel. This was my first time traveling alone with my 2 girls age 8 and 11 and needless to say I was a little scared about going to NY alone. The hotel was very nice with an outdoor pool that the girls got to use as it was a hot day. the ladies at the front desk were extremely polite and helpful with getting us to where we needed to go. The rooms were clean and it was relatively quite during the night. We were sightseeing the day of our check out and although we could not get a late check out because they were full, they do have a secure room that we were able to put our luggage in while we were out and about. We went back to get it with no problems! I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reasonably prices fro NY”
Reviews.Author: Luc1942
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located on 42nd street, reasonably priced (book thru getaroom.com for discount) wiht several eateries around. No restaurant though. Swimming pool. WIFi is extra and workswith some dedication to connct..a sustem error on their system troubled me. Bus to UN HQ and Ccentral Station is convemnient, but 42 street can be crowded amd slow down traffic...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome- Def staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: ErinmarieX
Reviews.Content: We had 2 days in NYC and I had booked 2 different Hotels (one for each night). We are early birds so we left the first Hotel off 57th st and Central Park area around 8am. I had called Travel Inn and asked if there was any chance of early check-in, they said it was too early but we could leave our bags in a secured area. We arrived at about 10am and the 2 ladies at the Desk were SO helpful, they checked my name and said the room WAS available so we checked in at 10 for no extra charge! Super bonus! Also, it is literally 3 blocks from the MAJOR Times Square area...you really couldn't get a much better location unless you wanted to spend $500 plus/night! Also, there is a gym 2 blks from the Hotel that offers Crossfit!!! Fruit Carts, Restaurants,/Starbucks 1 blk, Grocery store...just perfect. I will be booking this Hotel again. Also, very close to a few Metro Lines. Good area too - I'm a young, small female and I went to the gym at 5:30am one morning by myself and I felt safe - most street businesses are already open and bust at that time! NYC really is 24 hours :) Only 1 small downside now that I think of it - the walls are very thin and there was a Party in one of the rooms in our hall until the wee hours oft he morning...BUT it is NYC and it it a party town so I think you really just have to deal with that stuff - if you are a light sleeper or get annoyed easily it may be a problem. We had room 519 overlooking the pool area - which was very nice and well kept but we did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Toy Fair in New York”
Reviews.Author: ThierryBMaidenhead
Reviews.Content: Came to the Toy Fair at the Javits centre so was very convenient.. The rooms are OK, maybe a little tired. The daytime staff is friendly, the night time staff are terrible. The Wifi system, or rather the way you have to pay for it is antiquated and needs to be upgraded. I was only there for a few nights so was OK. Location is great for Javits.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience with a capital "C".”
Reviews.Author: creegah
Reviews.Content: Our 5th stay here. Probably would stay even if it cost twice as much. Let me touch on the high points... FREE parking. Unheard of in NYC. What other hotel in midtown even has parking in the same building? 10 minutes to Lincoln Tunnel. POOL. Places for breakfast within walking distance. Walk to BROADWAY SHOWS, SUBWAY, PENN STATION, PORT AUTHORITY BUS TERMINAL, TIMES SQUARE, JAVITS CONVENTION CENTER. HUDSON RIVER. Bus stop right in front of hotel. If you are out-of-towners like us who come in to the Big Apple every now and then by car to see a show or two, Lincoln Center, a ball game, the museums, there is no other hotel as convenient. None. As an added bonus, we have always had a clean, quiet room and we always found the service to be accomodating and friendly. I also appreciate the typical clientel which appears to be European who do not whine as much over minor inconveniences as American travelers are prone to do.

Reviews.Title: “The Needle in The Haystack!!”
Reviews.Author: WeloveNYC08
Reviews.Content: We are form upstate NY (Utica area) and we went to the city over the weekend mainly for a Yankee game. Wanted someplace close to Times Square but certainly did not want to pay over $250 for a place to sleep and then another $50 to park my truck!! Needed a Double Double and got a great room for a great price - and FREE PARKING in NYC!!! We arrived and the everyone from the parking attendant to the front desk were polite, nice and willing to help and answer questions. I was worried about parking at the stadium on our check out day but they allowed me to keep my truck in their parking garage for the day so we could take the subway to the game!!! Just a three and a half block walk to Times Square and we were able to see everything we wanted!! I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE looking for a place to lay your head at night and rest after a long day in the city!!! Absolutely well worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price.”
Reviews.Author: bellesque
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a good place, well located for my purposes (near the Javit Center) and the staff helpful. I'd been told there was free WiFi but once there I found out I had to pay. The staff, though, gave me a chit for free WiFi for 2 of my 4 days for 24 hrs. ea so it worked out. I didn't eat at the adjoining restaurant--too many other great spots nearby in mid-town west, only a block or two away. The pool was closed and being set up while I was there, sadly, because I really wanted to swim and the weather was excruciatingly hot and humid, but that can't be faulted to the hotel--it's an outdoor pool. Everything here was good. All I found weird was the two elevators I had to take to the 4th floor. It seems as if a second building was tacked onto the first, so it was up to 3, then down a hallway, then another elevator up 1 (or the stairs). The room was clean, the maid service excellent, I felt safe and my possession protected. The desk also gave me cards for discounts or free wine at restaurants. For the price, and in NYC, I don't think you can beat this place for what's offered, and the location. I paid under $900 for 4 nights, and my room faced a back street and train track (railroad) so it was quite (for NY, that is). Overall, I'm satisfied and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: JWRM
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how anyone could have a bad experience at this hotel. It was, as many have said, convenient to the Lincoln Tunnel, Times Square and Broadway, yet it is very inexpensive in NYC terms. It was also clean, with large bedrooms. I was worried about the strong cleaners odor that some had mentioned but did not find that at all, except out in the garage area. We also found the ventilation system working fine, though we took along a small desk fan just in case. We were there just for two days and spent most of it outside the hotel-for us it was a place to rest our heads at night and we could certainly do that. I was also worried about having the police station across the road (we had a room on that side) but it was perfectly quiet all night. Having a fridge in the hotel was great--we took along bottled water and it was wonderful to have cold water. Plus leftover cheesecake--we were able to finish our huge pieces over two nights rather than scarf it all down at once. The staff was perfectly nice and let us check in early when we arrived at 1:30. This was very helpful to us as we had things planned for the afternoon. Having the free self-parking was great--we were able to keep things like more bottled water, umbrellas and raincoats in the trunk until we thought we might need them. Our only inconvenience is that the hotel has two towers and we were in the tower that didn't go directly into the garage. We could walk up the ramp from the lobby but I always worry about doing that. However, we found that the two towers connected on the third floor, where the pool is (which looked nice but we didn't have time for it). Once we figured that out it was much easier to get to the car. For those with a longer stay--there is a grocery store just across the street (as well as a drugstore), along 42nd. This was was very good and very reasonably priced hotel and I won't hesitate to go back to it if we ever get back to NYC. I would recommend it to anyone planning a visit to see a play or do sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE STAFF and don't want to deal with problems.”
Reviews.Author: chellpi
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 5 days and we were disappointed by the rude staff. There was a problem with our room charge on day one and the male staff was rude and wouldn't listen to what we were trying to explain to him. He just lied about the bill charge to shut us up. We found out the next day what he told us was wrong. Problem never solved. We booked this room to use the pool which was being repainted and out of use during our stay. They list that the rooms have flat screen tv's, ours did not. The cable was out 2 nights of our stay, we had numerous problems with our wireless internet in our room. Had to deal with the same RUDE male staff about that issue that would just shove new codes to log in with. (which was not the problem) No refunds for their 24 wireless that only worked for about 2 hours for us. ect. If you are senstive to strong smells from cleaning products you might not want to stay here. The ONLY good things about the stay is the maids and the location. I would not stay here again. The stay was cheap but you get what you pay for!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “never”
Reviews.Author: elliescuccimarra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the WORST! I can't believe the reviews on here are actually decent.. and why woud a reviewer give 2 stars to a hotel where you were attacked by bedbugs?! i stayed for business b/c it was close to the work location and my company didn't want to pay a lot. The hotel is in a parking garage.. you have to walk into a parking garage to get to the lobby. The place SMELLS like something bad, covered up by air freshner. My room opened up to the pool-which made extremely nervous (young girl staying in the room alone). The room was outdated, the walls were dirty, and the linens were stained.

Reviews.Title: “Was not expecting such a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SandraMchelle
Reviews.Content: We had a last minute trip and this was the only hotel with vacancy so we had no choice, but to book it. What a great choice! The room was super clean, yes a bit strong with the cleaners, but I'd rather smell that than unpleasant odors. The bathroom was spotless and they were constantly cleaning it. The room is a bit outdated but who cares it was CLEAN. We were kind confused on how to use the heat, but it worked out fine. The staff were very nice and helpful. I was not expecting this from a New York hotel, after hearing horror stories. Oh and let me add this gem. We asked the front desk for a taxi and they got us a limo - for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “A bit outdated but excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kurt_B7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at the junction of 8th Avenue and 42nd street. It's a 10 minute walk to Time Square. The hotel is a bit outdated but spacious for New York standards. It was my thirs visit to NY en was worth the money. Ask for a room with a view on the pool. Yes, this hotel has an outside pool, quite rare in NY. It offers Free Wifi and rooms with two double beds. That the staff is not very friendly is something you should simply accept. You're in NY so you spend little time at the hotel. Plenty of folks around to ask for tours,info etc...

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME location, super cheap, pretty clean”
Reviews.Author: kittiekat27
Reviews.Content: Just like the headline says. Pretty clean not the most glamourous hotel but better/much cleaner than the price would lead me to expect. not far from central park, two blocks from times square. great price for budget minded people and I was able to comfortably sleep 4 nights. Very friendly/ helpful staff . the only drawback i can recall was the temperature of the water fluctuating VERY quickly. You'd be smart to fill your kids baths and shut the faucet off before they get in as the water can go from comfortable to scalding to icy in what seemed like a fraction of a second!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Advisor1047
Reviews.Content: Place is Clean, People Friendly, Free Parking Only complaint I have is the smell from the cleaners they use is too strong.

Reviews.Title: “This place is the absolute pits!”
Reviews.Author: blackers1606
Reviews.Content: On the way to the room all the hallways and floors were covered in cardboard - do not know why. We were put into a room that smelled of fly spray, wasn't particularly clean and the walls were paper thin so that we could here every word that was said next door. When we were leaving to go out for the day it was obvious that the people that were staying were clearly there to doss and we clarified with reception (who were unhelpful and rude) that we had been placed in a quiet part of the hotel as we had small children. We were told we had and on our return at approx 11pm we were surrounded by teenagers who were drunk and screaming across the balconys. We asked reception (who were again unhelpful and rude) to change our room, they said they couldn't so we checked out which is what we should have done as soon as we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Visit, room was like an oven, front desk personnel terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: urnotfunny
Reviews.Content: The main reason for my review is the room was about 85-90 degrees in temperature, I went to the front desk to tell them and they told me it was because the seasons were changing. So, what I have to roast because the seasons are changing? Front desk personnel, were totally unresponsive. I asked for a fan, which I got 3 hours later. The second night same temperature and then there was a gas smell in the hotel, I reported it and got no response. I left, didn't even stay the second night, wasted alot of money and the front desk personnel, worthless.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden budget jewel of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Omtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location! Right on 42nd Street, It is only four blocks away from Times Square, and only two blocks from the subway. Service was friendly, and the hotel has a beautiful rooftop pool. Definitely will stay here again when visiting New York!

Reviews.Title: “Near Times Square and Free Parking!”
Reviews.Author: Tepic007
Reviews.Content: We (two adults and two teenagers) took a chance on this hotel 3 blocks away from Times Square. On a road trip, we needed a hotel that offered affordable or free parking. Most such hotels are located around the three airports serving New York City. The Travel Inn Hotel was the exception. We stayed for four nights. Never took the car out of the parking lot. Between taxis, the subway and the hotel's proximity to Times Square, we had no need for our car. The hotel is somewhat dated but the room was clean, on the bigger side for Manhattan, and equipped with a fridge and microwave. The reception staff was courteous and helpful. They were also proactive. One night, the city carried out repair work to the street immediately in front of the hotel, at 3 a.m.! On account of this inconvenience, without being asked, they waived charges for the wireless internet connection for our whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mavissssss
Reviews.Content: After staying at the travel inn,,I could not believe how lucky we was to have chosen such a nice hotel.It was on the door step of times sq close to every thing you needed all within walking distance..The rooms were very clean and BEDBUG FREE...And the hotel has every thing you need..But one thing that stood out to me the most was front desk staff they were all so very pleasant,Very helpful,Ailyn.Saleem,Nermebn,Ejaz, are just few names of front desk staff,How Veryyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy Niceeeeeeeeeeee they all are.They me and my family very welcome......And thats one of the reason why iam booking to stay again so very soon,,I hope you guys keep the good work up,and all still working their when i return,room 505 x x

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price - friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: White66coupe
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 days at the Travel Inn NYC - no complaints. Room was clean - strong smell when we entered but it was disinfectant; just opened the window for 10 min. and it was fine. TV wasn't working, but staff responded immed. and it was fixed. Great to have parking included - in and out privileges too. Great deli right next door for drinks and breakfast. We enjoyed the balcony over the pool just to sit out after a long day of walking. Felt very safe. Internet $6.00 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bargain!!”
Reviews.Author: khash113
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious, clean, and had a window that opened! We also had a fridge and microwave, which is quite important for a long hotel stay. The rate, free parking, and GREAT location in midtown Manhattan makes this hotel exceptional for the price. We didn't have any problems. It isn't 5 star but it is certainly worth the money. It's clean, friendly, and a really nice place to stay. Deli next door, police dept across the street. I will stay here again when I return to the City!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly workers, rooms were good size, good location”
Reviews.Author: hollid
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two teenage boys and a friend of mine. The room was large for New York. The staff at the desk were very nice and helpful. There was a refrigerator and Microwave in our room. It was very clean as well. Excellent hotel for the price. The only negative is the elevators were slow and needed work. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value -especially if you have a car!”
Reviews.Author: ber5408
Reviews.Content: This hotel might seem a bit out of the way but it is an easy walk to Times Square and the theaters. The rooms were modest and very clean. There are no in room coffee makers which is annoying but there is a deli next door and a Dunkin Donuts across the block. Small lobby area but nicely furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: CillaBang
Reviews.Content: This was booked by a friend and being a fussy hotel stayer I wasn't excited. It was however a really good find. The rooms are traditional but not too small in comparison to some of the 'better' hotels with a 'ton' on the end of their names. Above all it was clean, the service was more than pleaseant, and it was great value for money. The location is a bit wide of the action, but with cabs a plenty available it was a bargain. Free parking too for those of you travelling from out of town by car. There is also an open air pool which is a rarity in the city. Hate the decor, but love the place, if you can get over that this is a gem. Get an room at the back to avoid street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Phoebusgirl
Reviews.Content: The room was big enough for three of us without anyone bumping into the other. The only problem I had, which I did not report, was a pubic hair in the tub. Also no one told us there were two different elevators. The price was right for a clean place to sleep and it has not shown up on the Bed Bug Registry.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyBabyBean
Reviews.Content: We checked in and got our room key to a room by the outdoor pool area. We got to the room to find a do not disturb sign and someone already sleeping in the room. After walking back to reception with all of our bags, got a new key to a room that smelled of moth balls and had no working air conditioning. After maintenance could not figure out what was wrong and advise us to have the window open (In NY with all the street noise!!) and we complaint a few more times, they changed us to an average room where we spent 3 horrible nights as everything was already paid for. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best, got a good deal but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: amycat73
Reviews.Content: We traveled MLK weekend 2011 from Thursday - Tuesday and got an incedible 5 night deal on flight/hotel from Cleveland, Oh for $500/pp. I had been to NYC a few times so I thought this hotel would be decent even for the cheap price, but in retrospect we should have shelled out a few more dollars - the Chelsea HOSTEL I stayed in a few yars ago was much nicer! The service was outstandingly BAD from the staff - they didn't seem concerned that the rooms were 100 degrees and the only way to ventilate was to open the window 24/7 overlooking the busy street with a fire/police station directly adjacent. They moved us to a different room and then surrounded us with a high school field trip where we got to experience 17 year old boys yelling and wrestling until 2am (not restful after 12 hours of sightseeing). We were moved to a third room that was finally quieter and a little nicer. The rooms seemed a dirty there was a smell that I couldn't quite place in the entire hotel...musty? mold? No idea. I would NOT recommend this spot for anyone unless cheap motels (not hotels) are your thing - if yes, then it's probably not half bad. We had a great time in the city but I should have listened to the Expedia hotel rating this time.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel but needs some improvement”
Reviews.Author: LisaMSacramentoCA
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its proximity to the Signature Theatre down the street. I had a great rate for the 2 nights I was there. The front desk, although not exuberant, had helpful staff who gave me directions to restaurants and transportation spots. The room was clean if small but had everything I needed EXCEPT a coffeemaker, a must when I travel. Had a fridge and microwave, fridge used gratefully, not so the microwave but handy to have anyway. The elevators were iffy making them an adventure to ride. Need updating! Pool was large which would be nice in summer. There is no restaurant in the hotel but the deli next door had great breakfast and lunches, closed rather early. My ham and cheese omelet with fried potatoes and toast cost a mere $5.00. They have anything you could possibly want to drink plus fruit bowls, pastries, and other snacks. The room was hot as others have said, but I turned off the heat button and it cooled although it took the whole day. Short walk to Times Square, smaller theatres, and eateries. Port Authority was about 3 or 4 blocks to catch subway, buses, etc... I would recommend this hotel but if you can afford it, get the King room.

Reviews.Title: “Another good experience”
Reviews.Author: daisypat1
Reviews.Content: My daughter, my granddaughter (10), and I stayed here over Christmas. Not the best hotel in the world, but definitely worth the money. Inexpensive, well located to Train Station, Times Square, Restaurant Row, Theaters, etc. If you can walk a mile and want to keep hotel expenses to minimum, this is the place. A little noisy, a little run down, bathroom VERY small, but clean. Some of the front desk front folks were more helpful than others, but overall we didn't need much so that didn't really matter. Has Wi-Fi, but had to request a new access code every day "in person". Don't understand that practice at all and why it couldn't be given over the phone from the room. But, it was nice to have it even with the extra effort. This was my second experience and the room was in the adjoining part of the building that required an additional elevator trip. It wasn't as nice as the room on my first stay--it seemed a lot noisier (noise from neighboring room). Finally, the hot water in the shower sort of pulsated from well regulated to very hot to cold. I don't recall that happening on my first trip when we stayed in the main building. It was an inconvenience, but since I take short showers it was not a major problem. I did worry about running out of hot water, but that never happened. Although it doesn't have any restaurant or coffee maker in the room, we did have a microwave and little refrigerator and there is a coffee shop just out the side door and a really nice diner about 1 block away. They have an arrangement with the diner to provide room service for the hotel guests. We never took advantage of that, but we did eat breakfast at the diner and it was very good. All in all a good deal and as long as the price stays low, worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: travelperson24
Reviews.Content: The travel inn was located at an amazing location. It was right around the corner from times square. The hotel was excptionaly clean and that's including the lobby and room . But the service was alright, every day the cleaning lady would come in and try and get in when we were still in bed so this is pretty early in the morning. And I wouldn't say the lobby staff were chirpy. The room wasn't very spacious but it had a nice clean bathroom, but the tv had many channels but was very fuzzy at times. Overall I'd say it would be a comfortable stay over a long stay especially considering it location which I believe is the big seller.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: didinyc
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be very clean, great location, 10 minute walk to Times Square, we felt very safe, 3 females. The room was basic but clean, very warm, could not control temp. (room 374, overlooking pool so quiet). We found the staff to be unfriendly, very short with any questions or requests, could work on being friendlier and show an interest. At times a young gentleman stood by the door but he never opened the door and appeared bored and unfriendly ?? Potential here but need to work on service. The deli next door was wonderful, friendly, fast and efficient, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pacdmp1210
Reviews.Content: First trip to NYC. Found this hotel on-line. Great value. Close to everything. Very quiet. Even with widows open. Staff was helpful but not overly friendly. Rooms were good size. Very clean. Bathroom small but clean. Room had microwave and fridge. Room service was quick and reasonably priced. Wish we could have enjoyed the pool but a little too cold. Had to check out at noon and security held our bags until our train left at 5:00. Great not to drag our bags around. Next time in NYC I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great value”
Reviews.Author: Babystar
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at the Travel Inn. We had a double double room overlooking the pool. Room was cleaned every day and we could not fault it. Location was amazing only minutes from Times Sq, restaurants and clubbing. Staff were friendly enough and diner next door was fantastic. No bed bugs that we could find! The only downside was that we did NOT have a microwave or fridge in our room. As we did not really need either we did not mention this to reception, however it may be worth requesting confirmation beforehand if these are things you will need on your visit. The value cannot be beaten as we paid $150 US per night + tax and that was for 3 adults. I will definitely return again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately use again”
Reviews.Author: Deucalion
Reviews.Content: I failed to find fault with this hotel. Reception were efficient, but not over friendly. Room (614) was clean and tidy as was the bathroom. Television reception was useless, but we did not come to watch the TV. Good size fridge in room also a microwave was supplied. The Broadway Diner next door was very good in both quality of food and service

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Saltysally
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying in this hotel. It is the perfect spot for regular everyday people visiting the city. The location can't be beat, 2 blocks from the Lincoln tunnel, Jacob Javits & Time Square a few blocks away. There is an outdoor pool, that must be awesome in the summer. FREE PARKING garage! I love this hotel ! The ONLY negative is that the street noise can be a little loud...but hello? It's NYC ! All in all...don't come here expecting The Plaza...but you will have a clean, affordable, & safe place to stay with a friendly staff. Oh and you can't go wrong at the deli next door..Mmmm

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: dazaSussex
Reviews.Content: very good location,rooms a bit dated but spotless ! clean bathroom and beds,staff were all helpfull,would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: grnydi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, bedbug free, our room was quiet and the management was very friendly and helpful!!! It was a prime location to go to visit everything too!! The deli next door was GREAT!!!! The only thing the hotel could improve on is to put a coffee pot in every room!! I would encourage anyone to book there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fuelinkin822
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel last week for a few days. When we first walked into our room, it was burning up! My husband tried to turn the air on but it wasnt working. I called down to the front desk and told them we couldnt get the air to work and the guy said "Oh we dont have air condition. We only have heat and it only turns on when the weather is like below 42 degrees"... awesome... So if you stay here in the summer, you're screwed.. So we opened the window which didnt seem to help at all. We would leave the window open all day and come back and it still not be much cooler and it was pretty cold outside. There is one setting on the unit, so we figured out that would blow the outside air inside so we did that and left it on, so one night we came back and had forgotten that.. uh.. the heat comes on when its 42 degrees or lower outside so the heat had turned on while we were gone and it was stifling when we got in! It was just miserable. The other things about this hotel.. when my husband emailed them before making reservations, he asked if the rooms had a fridge and they said yes (we didnt have a fridge). There is also no safe box so you cant put your electronics or extra money or anything in it while you're gone. Also, no continental breakfast is provided and lastly, if you have a room above the 3rd floor, you have to go to the 3rd floor elevator from the lobby. You have to wait for that elevator for 5 years. . . and the hotel isnt that busy so it's not like people are on it and thats why your'e waiting. It just takes forever and you're standing there.. waiting.. Worst hotel I've ever been to. Other than that, it's average in its cleanliness and very close to the square and has a bus stop right out front.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: julieef
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good location,about 10 mins walk from Times square. The hotel itself lovely comfy beds,rooms very dated but ok as you don't spend a lot of time in your room.Had a large fridge and randomly a microwave but no kettle which I do expect in a hotel room. Hotel reception staff COULD NOT be more UNFRIENDLY if they tried, which was a shame because I would not stay here again because of this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here !!”
Reviews.Author: belindaPlymouth
Reviews.Content: We had reservations about this hotel after reading the reviews, but we were assured by our travel company that everything would be fine. It was to be the highlight of our holiday which started in Boston. After checking in we quickly checked out the linen and the mattress in the room and it looked fine.. so off we went to explore New York. On our way to the lift one of our group told us that she was just about to check out her THIRD room !! The first had a mouse in it and the second was dirty. I freaked out on hearing this as I am petrified of mice & rats ! Management didn't seem very bothered about the complaint, there were no apologies. I asked my husband to check there were no mice in our room so to pacify me he said all was good. On our way to the airport to go home a couple of days later he told me that there were THREE mousetraps under our bed !!!!! How disgusting. I'm so glad i didn't know because no way would I have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “great value BUT....”
Reviews.Author: festus43
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before and like the location, free parking that often lets you keep your car there the last day so you get an extra day in the city, the ease of getting breakfast next door, the police station across the street, the ease to get to this hotel from West Side Drive and the relative lack of craziness on the street outside the building. BUT be warned - they have a heating/air conditionning system that can only be in 1 mode or the other and they control that. Thus during in-between seasons in Spring and Fall they experience of few periods where you suffer! We were there in November and they had a few cold nights before we came so they switched off the air and the heat system was on. It was 80 degrees (at least) in the room for the 3 days and nights and the whole building was like this. No one could sleep as we all were in our underwear with wet towels over our heads! We tried opening the windows but it was too loud to sleep and that didn't cool things down unless we slept with the front door open to create a draft. That wasn't an option as they warned us not to sl;eep in NYC with unlocked doors! We were told all this at the front desk that it gets too hot sometimes and tough luck basically...It pretty much ruined our trip as the kids were miserable and we couldn't do much. We'll go back but we'll make sure it isn't during a heat spell in November and that we bring either ear plugs or a few portable fans...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: slbrc
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel the front desk staff were very helpful and polite, the room itself was very spacious and clean compared to some better class hotels that ive stayed in nyc, been 4 times before. There was no BED BUGS! only slight problem was that the beds were a little bit small could be a problem if your tall. The bathroom was very clean. We had maids in everyday, changing towels etc. The location was excellent approximately 5 minute walk to times square and the nearest subway station. All in all a very good hotel in a great location I would and will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Johansen1163
Reviews.Content: Travel Inn offers really good value for money. My husband and I stayed in a double-double room with two teenagers and it was perfect and cheap for a New York hotel. The room was spacious and clean and so was the bathroom. The location is perfect - very close to Times Square, 5th Avenue and Broadway and yet away from the worst hustle & bustle, but consider bringing ear plugs - this is after all New York City. The staff is friendly and helpfull, and even arranged a stretch Limo from the hotel to JFK for $65! Just around the corner at 11th you'll find the Diner Market - the perfect place to enjoy a great breakfast or a real US-burger.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful, good location”
Reviews.Author: Kai2k
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, and were more interested in location than facilites. The hotel is not far from times square, including the bus terminal, which is handy for airport transfers. The room was clean and basic, but with everything you need, like coffee machine, TV etc. The beds were comfy and clean, and the bathroom was clean and powerful. There were NO bed bugs! The reception staff were not very helpful: if you book on line, print off the booking and take it with you. They invoiced me a higher price but quickly backed down when I showed them proof. Overall, a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel offers good value for a low price in NY.”
Reviews.Author: steuer31
Reviews.Content: The room and bath were of adequate size and spotless. They had all the usual amenities expected in a hotel, such as toiletries, hair dryers, information about what is going on in NY. There was no sign of the dreaded bedbugs. The bed was comfortable. The location is excellent and safe, and there is a deli next door that has good and inexpensive breakfasts and meals. Staff at the desk is not overly friendly but responds to requests.

Reviews.Title: “You might get sent to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: pnobscot
Reviews.Content: If you happen to reserve a room at this hotel from a web site other than their own, and do it for a lower price, they may upon arrival tell you that they had some problems with rooms and you have to be moved to another one of their properties like the Riverside Hotel up on 88th and Broadway. They will put $20 in your hand and tell you to take a cab up there. That's so they can rent out the room at a higher rate if they are sold out or feel that they can sell out the hotel. Be aware of this because it happened to me and it was a great inconvenience since I chose this place due to the proximity to appointments I had already made. Mattresses are rock hard so if you have a bad back, remember that you were warned. If you get the room as you reserved it, then a hard mattress is something you can live with I guess for a few nights. but they can make up any excuse and move you into another property, so if you book this on another site other than newyorkhotel.com, be aware that theye may pull the old fast one on you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Small rooms/beds, Arrogance at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: Volle1953
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good, and the price reasonable (NYC Prices). We booked 2 rooms for 6 people. The rooms are very small, and the beds very small. We asked to change room to a larger one, but the hotel only offers the same small room with small beds. When we asked to get towels etc. in accordance with our booking (4 persons in one room) the front desk clerk got rude and showed arrogance that I did not understand. Next time in NYC I'll find another hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: mummerz
Reviews.Content: Our first time staying in the Theatre District. Very nice room, not modern but clean and free of smells. Staff extremely courteous and parking at the premises huge plus. We would stay here again, it is close to Times Square, lots of shops and restaurants and you can take a walk along the Hudson River.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: theranna
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that cost less than $140 a room, parking included this hotel was everything I expected. Not a great chain but not bad either. Close to a police station, a grocery store and a CVS and very close to the heart of the city. We walked to and from Times Square, the Nokia Theater and the Empire State Building from this hotel and frankly, I'd recommend it to anyone looking to enjoy time in New York. You might want to bring your own sheets... and be ready to use the stairs if funky elevators freak you out.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time here, Great Hotel, Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: courtcop
Reviews.Content: the first time I stayed here was June '10. everything was fantasic!!, very clean, Good A/C, great staff!! room was always very clean!! & can't beat location or the price. The elevators are slow, no big deal, the pool was refreshing after a day of walking around. Now I just stayed for a week Oct. 17-22 2010 & still say the place is GREAT!!, I even got the same room I had in June...LOL once again, staff, service, room was very good. The only thing I noticed is that the room heater must be controlled by timer or the front desk??...heat never came on til 9pm every night, it blew cool air until then??? I'm sure they adjust it as the colder weather nears. MOST IMPORTANTLY......NO BEDBUGS!!!!! I will continue to use thishotel for all future trips...very happy with both stays!!!

Reviews.Title: “What's wrong with this place?”
Reviews.Author: kleone2u
Reviews.Content: Well I read the reviews before I booked. I happen to work in a 4-star hotel & casino, so I know some folks just like to complain. There is nothing wrong with this hotel! I'd read complaints about rude staff...I was checked in by Saleem. No he didn't throw a party when we arrived but he was efficient and got us checked in quickly. He wasn't RUDE at all. Went to our room and it was just fine. Clean No bugs. I remembered someone even complained here about the size of the soap...it's just a standard little soap bar for heavens sake. How much soap do ya need!? But really...it's the location of this place that is the kicker...it's close to everything! Convenient little deli next door. Police station and CVS across the street. Just a couple of blocks from Times Square. Really you can't ask for a better deal. We didn't find it noisy...but we didn't stay in the room much either! The elevators ARE sorta funky...I'll give ya that...but we just found it kinda funny. Nothing we'd let ruin our trip...that's for sure! I was more concerned in the elevator in the Empire State building honestly. eep! We will definitely stay here again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but no heating ?”
Reviews.Author: AdolfoB
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good value - it is cheap (considering NYC prices), well located (walking distance to Times Square, metro station and Bus Authority Terminal), has free parking. Service from front desk is good, not so much in the check-in, but was ok. The rooms are not big, but normally you don't plan to go to New York to stay at your hotel room ! But they are clean and no bugs were found. Wireless internet is available, but you have to pay it. Some of the rooms (including ours) in the 3rd floor and above must be accessed using 2 elevators - one from front desk to 3rd floor, then you walk across the pool and get the another one to other floors. One thing disappointed us during the stay - the room was pretty cold during the evening and no heating system in the room. There was such a air conditioning system, but only for cooling. By asking the front desk, we got the answer - no heating ! I can imagine the rooms during winter. Maybe the exchange the air conditioning fluid into heating oil, maybe. But in overall is a very good choice for NYC, you really get a good hotel, well located, clean, not luxurious, but cheap and FREE parking (saves you about $60 per day).

Reviews.Title: “Nice location with pool and free packing great value”
Reviews.Author: washington_10
Reviews.Content: Really close to Time Square and many attractions, cheaper than other hotel nearby, room is not small if choose the double double room, nice pool, best of all, free parking. Grocery store and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, great value, would stay again considering the location/price”
Reviews.Author: mudman10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special in terms of style, comfort or luxery. It was however a great value. FREE parking was what pushed me to take a chance on this hotel. It also offered a clean place to sleep, close location to subway station and Times Sq. Some problems are the heating system. We were there in April when the heat was blaring! Our room had no way to control the temprature. We slept with the window open. I would suggest you ask for a room facing the pool where you could open the window and still avoid the street noise since the police station is across the street. We would defintily stay again based upon the value though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Girls50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Travel Inn this week. The rooms were clean and there were no bed bugs! The location is convenient - within walking distance to theaters, restaurants and Time Square. It is also easy to drive to and the parking is a plus. I have stayed here several times and it is great for a weekend or overnight visit.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: iowa-sarah
Reviews.Content: This is actually a good hotel , the room that we stayed in was simple yet comfortable. its location was perfect for us. we were very close to so many ammenities. i would definitely stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Stinkypinkypig
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, and it's in a great location-short walking distance to Times Square, and Penn Station; we even walked to Central Park and Chelsea from the Hotel (about 1/2 hour walk-not bad!). We only stayed overnight because we had tickets to the Martha Stewart show in the morning, and didn't trust the trains being on time in the morning. The price was reasonable considering you were in NYC (we paid $200; EVERYWHERE else was $400+!!!). As far as we could see, no bedbugs!!! It served our purpose quite well. I read the previous good reviews before I left about the deli next door; we went there to eat lunch before we checked in, and it was great! I don't know if I would want to stay a whole week there, but for overnight, or even a couple of nights, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel and the price was just right and no bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: williac13
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cleanest Hotel I have ever stayed in. Clean, smell good, and the service was outstanding. No Bed bugs. I would stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel for your next stay in New York. Keep up the good work Travel Inn.

Reviews.Title: “quiet”
Reviews.Author: louisevie
Reviews.Content: As a middleaged woman on a business trip. I can recommend this hotel. It is close to the Port Authority for early morning journeys, and this saved me a fortune on taxis. There is a bus stop for crossing town, just outside. It had everything I needed - large peaceful room overlooking the pool, with a fridge and microwave. It was handy for making a good healthy breakfast, and for making snacks in the evening. There were two good supermarkets, a deli, a pharmacy and an off licence just outside the hotel. There was also a Police Station across the road The downside of my stay was that when you wanted a hot drink you had to get dressed and go to the Deli next door, and they closed at 5pm. Also the linens and towels were not up to the mark. I would advise anyone who drives to New York and wants to stay there to take a kettle or coffee maker Also if you are large, you may not be able to access the tiny bath/shower which is awkward and badly designed. There are rooms that offer a walk in shower and this could be requested at time of booking. Room was kept very clean and the staff were exceptionally helpful, esp Mary and Michele.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Jessie7707
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Travel Inn in the beginning of September for 5 nights. I was happy with the room, it was a bit old but clean and spacious. I also liked the location, by 42nd & 10th Avenue. About 10 min walk from Times Square, the area was good and I was not afraid to come back in the evenings. Also easy to reach coming to and going from Newark airport. We paid 15usd single way with the bus which took about 40 minutes. We went by http://www.coachusa.com/olympia/ from Port Authority bus station, about 10 min walk to the hotel. The receptionist at the hotel told us that the bus would take close to 2 hours so they wanted to book us a shuttle for 70 usd, I guess they got commission out of that.. We used the pool in the afternoons and it was ok. The fitness center wasn't quite what I expected, a tiny room with a few weights, a tredmill and some other machines.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: karima49
Reviews.Content: This place was definitely worth the money! Excellent location, walk right into times sqaure, yet away enough from all the craziness. Had no problems with parking. FREE! Awesome! Great deli located right next door with good sandwiches. No noise from the police station right across the street. The pool was very handy considering it was 94 degrees! Kept clean and towels provided. All in all very nice hotel for the money. They almost tried to get us at checkout saying we owed mmore than we did but we had our confirmation so there was no problem. Not sure what that was all about. This will prob be the hotel I stay at everytime I vist NYC!

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!!”
Reviews.Author: Mistorico
Reviews.Content: Except for the extremely small TV in our room, I have no complaints about this hotel. After almost cancelling our reservation upon reading a certain review, I am glad that I didn't. Althought the hotel decor is dated, the room was very clean and the staff was great, especially housekeeping and the security guy in the parking lot. The hotel is convenient to Times Square, the subway, theaters and Restaurant Row. Because it was a very hot week, we really enjoyed the pool late in the day after touring the city. The best thing about this hotel is the FREE parking!! All this for a room rate of $140!!!! This is a great hotel for families, especially during the summer. We will definately be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: catbat59
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Manhattan several times before but have never found such great value for our dollar. A fancy hotel is completely lost with us because we spend so little time in our room. I found the hotel staff to be completely friendly & professional. The location couldn't have been better. Very close to theaters,Times Square & subways. Yet far enough away to feel removed from the crowds when needed. One thing I noticed that I find rather ironic, is that being directly across the street from the police station was wonderfully quiet. In the past (at other hotels) I have been fully aware of sirens all night long. Also with a smaller sized hotel, we found ourselves in our room within a minute or two of entering the front door of the hotel. I have stayed at hotels that almost require a map to navigate our way to our room & they have also been much to long a walk after entering the building. After a long day of sight seeing, sometimes that walk is too much. The pool was great with the temperatures in New York this past weekend. Access to our car within the hotel garage throughout our stay was an added bonus as was the Free Parking ! Unheard of in NYC. The rooms were clean & the beds were more than comfortable. Having read an earlier bad review, I felt the need to express my appreciation for the value I found in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Large Very clean rooms .. great location .. great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Princessmummy
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel .. true it's outdated in terms of decor .. and the beds are a little on the hard side .. BUT... it has free parking, the rooms are large for NYC .. we had a microwave & fridge in the room .. the room and bathroom are super clean ... and the Air Conditioning was great .. it can be a little noisy .. we were over the train lines .. but no more or less noisy than anywhere else in NYC .. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again .. the staff were super nice to us .. and even kept the car for us until 3pm on our last day so we could carry on sightseeing after we'd checked out .. Also has an outdoor pool that's partially covered !!!! what a bonus ! There is a great deli .. serving breakfast literally next door to the hotel .. with reasonable prices that we got coffee and bagels at every morning !!! Great find .. book in advance is my tip we got fabulous prices when we did . $140 a night !!! such a bargin as free parking !!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: PoloRalphLauren
Reviews.Content: I almost hesitate to recommend this hotel, as others will discover its value and charms, and then it might be booked the next time we want to go! But I will anyway... What first attracted us to the Travel Inn were its great rates and that free parking. The parking alone (self-parking, your car is always available to you, in/ out privileges) is worth booking a room here! Our room (4th floor overlooking the pool and patio) was perfect-- large (a king room), spotlessly clean, with fridge, microwave and a very comfortable bed. Although air-conditioned, it was such a pleasure also being able to open the window and let in the cool night air (I won't say "fresh air", since this is, after all, New York City!). The bed offered a delightful night's sleep and the bathroom was also just fine (don't know what some people are doing complaining about its size-- not huge by any means, but more than adequate) and the toiletries provided were great. Although we didn't make that much use of it, the pool and the patio in downtown Manhattan were a delight. The hotel's location is excellent: walking anywhere in Manhattan is a breeze, and the Times Square and theatre district are a very easy walk. Starbuck's is just around the corner, a CVS pharmacy across the street, The Food Emporium (great supermarket) a block away and a 24 hr 7-11 just down the street. The police station across from the hotel gives a nice sense of security and the neighborhood felt completely safe and secure no matter what time of day or night we were outside. Many many great restaurants within a ten minute walk (check out Restaurant Row along 9th Avenue!) and we found the Theatre Row Diner diagonally across the street (at Dyer Avenue) a great value with excellent food and service (we breakfasted there every day). We found some of the negative reviews on TripAdvisor totally bizarre--- who ARE these people? Do they expect five star ambiance and service at these prices? If so, they are delusional. The Travel Inn offers excellent value and very comfortable surroundings; if you want plush bathrobes and chocolates on your pillow, then go pay $500 a night elsewhere! No, the front desk service isn't the friendliest (who cares?), but our chambermaid's friendliness and efficiency more than made up for that. City noise at night? Get real, people--- this is Manhattan! In summary, we LOVED the Travel Inn and we WILL be back on our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families!”
Reviews.Author: KBuffo
Reviews.Content: My family just got a great deal at the Travel Inn in NYC. We paid about $165/night including taxes and parking. That is an amazing deal in this town. Luxurious? Swank? No. But the room and bathroom were no smaller than in any hotel Iâ€™ve stayed in, and super clean. Iâ€™m sensitive to hard beds and I slept like a baby. And the location was tough to beat... not in the middle of everything, but plenty close enough. Then thereâ€™s the pool, a huge highlight for my kids, and an otherwise impossible get in NYC for under $350/night. Everyone was very nice and helpful... the parking attendant most especially. Seeing that I was parking under a drippy AC unit that I hadnâ€™t noticed, he gave me extra direction so my stuff wouldnâ€™t get wet as we unloaded. He also called up to our room when he noticed that my 7 year old had left a cabin light on. Small things that showed he really cared about people. Reading a previous posterâ€™s comments about bugs we almost canceled. Iâ€™m so glad we didnâ€™t! Following the advice of this link http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/11877871 upon arrival we positively tossed the room (beds, furniture, pictures, everything!) and far from finding the implied infestation, we found ONE long-dead unidentifiable bug. Period. Wish I could say the same about my own home in the summer. While it wouldnâ€™t be my pick for a romantic getaway to the city, weâ€™ll take the kids here every time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location, clean, safe.”
Reviews.Author: msmith0207
Reviews.Content: I just got back from an 8 night stay and my wife and I could not ask for anything more. The only knock on this hotel that I saw in some of the reviews prior to our stay was that the beds were hard. On the contrary, my wife and I found that the beds were extremley comfortable. In fact, our big plans to get an early start every day turned out to be a joke because we could not pry ourselves out of bed before 10am on any of the days. We did have a king room, so I cannot vouch for the doubles. We were suprised that the rooms were normal size rooms and the A/C worked just fine. My wife and I had heard about how small NY hotel rooms typically are and how bad the A/C units are hot NY summertime. The room was great and we actually were cold most of the time and had to turn the air down. The room also had a good sized fridge and a microwave. This was great as there is a grocery store right down the street and a 24 hr CVS right across the street. We thought the location was great. Close enough to walk to all of the action in Times Square or catch the subwy or bus to a different location, and just far enough away that you don't get all of the noise at night. If your looking for a "Trump Towers" type of experience this is not the place for you. If you want a great place to stay without going broke, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal around for free parking, location and extras”
Reviews.Author: wendanny
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the fact that it had free parking, which is a huge money-saver in New York City, and it was fairly close to Times Square. Also appreciated the fact that once we parked, we kept our keys and could get our car if we needed to without waiting for a valet. Although we knew it had a pool, and a microwave and fridge in the room, we were pleasantly surprised with these features. The fridge and microwave were much appreciated for snacks and to keep cold water bottles. The pool was very nice, clean, perfect temperature, lots of chairs - very refreshing after walking around the city all day. My only wish is that it was open later in the evening - think it closed at 7 pm. The room was very nice and comfortable, VERY small bathroom, but very nice and clean. Not much of a view, but who cares, we were here to walk through the city, not look at it from our window. It was only a few blocks to Times Square, very convenient. It was very easy to get to from the Lincoln Tunnel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out was very easy and expedient. Nice supermarket right around the corner. I would definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Bugs”
Reviews.Author: travelingmercies1
Reviews.Content: Hotel room numbers 388, 387 and 380 3 other rooms as well. We had a family reunion scheduled there the weekend of July 30th. We checked in but did not physically go to the room until after midnight. Because of the talk about bedbugs in NY we decided to check the beds. There it was in plain site under the sheet attached to the mattress cover. I called down to manager on duty and told him there were bedbugs. He did not question it he said I could switch rooms. TRAVEL INN HOTEL I went to knock on another family members door (they were sleeping) to alert them. As they turned on the lights a bedbug was crawling on their sleeping daughter. The hotel security guard confirmed to myself and husband that they have bedbugs. His exact comment to my husband was "What do you want this is NY". Needless to say we checked right out of this disgusting hotel. DO NOT STAY. We had to wait until morning to inform several other family members but it was too late they already had bites on their faces and bodies. Disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Very Affordable, Clean and Free Parking”
Reviews.Author: Doreenc21
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the ease of getting to the hotel and into the parking garage coming off the Lincoln Tunnel. Everything about the hotel is small but very clean and very affordable. Accross from the Police Station so a few early morning sirens but nothing of great annoyance. Great stay. For the money, you can't beat it. About 5 blocks to Times Square and one block from where the action begins. VERY FUN TIMES!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: JLDP65
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights a Sunday and Monday nite. Great location, clean room. Bathroom was small (no problem). Pool looked good but was only open from 10am to 7pm. Free parking was a big plus for me. Told the person at the front desk when we left that I would give them a positive recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Value, value, value”
Reviews.Author: Audioquest
Reviews.Content: Like just about every other review posted here, the free parking for those who are travelling to NYC by vehicle is an absolute godsend. The parking garage is clean, well lit and there is a security person there at all time. It was tight and overcrowded when we arrived, but soon enough, I was able to park in a good spot. Also, this hotel is right off the Lincoln Tunnel entry/exit so you have no more that two blocks of driving in crazy NYC traffic - another plus. As far as the hotel is concerned, it is nothing fancy at all. The room was fairly clean (there was heavy dust behind the furniture and the a/c unit was dirty). But, how much time do you plan on spending in your room? There is a pool (didn't use it). The exercise room is a bit of a joke, and the elevators were a bit shaky. Again, it all comes down to value. Decent rates, free parking, close to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Best for Foreigners”
Reviews.Author: sonhyun1
Reviews.Content: Actually I stayed here in August 2007. During my stay, I lost my cell phone and I recognized it at midnight. I talked to front desk and an Indian man (I guess so) called my phone. He said " A young lady(^^) answered. Will you go there right now?" I answered "Of course!" The man gave me a note of 'the meeting place'(Columbus St., I think,) and 'her number' I took a taxi and arrived at 'the place'. I called the number and an attractive young lady appeared with my phone! I tried paying her but, she said "No thank you, I'm glad you found your phone." I thought it would be good if I have a midnight date' with her. However, she said "Good bye" and disappeared. Maybe she was an angel of New York. :D Also, Thank you Mr...... Travel Inn :D

Reviews.Title: “No frills, value for money”
Reviews.Author: redbeech1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double double, the size of the room was ok, everything was very standard but acceptable, except perhaps the bathroom. The view from the room was rather appalling so we kept the curtains closed and avoided looking there. The location is very good and you can walk to Broadway and Times Square. Breakfast can be had just outside the hotel in a deli where staff are friendly and very efficient, service is very speedy. The staff at the front desk were not very friendly but efficient. This is an absolutely no frills hotel, good value for money but nothing more. Perfect if that's what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only good point...”
Reviews.Author: JMfever
Reviews.Content: I'm coming back from my third trip to NYC. Everytime, I was staying at the Travel Inn. This time was the last. The rooms are the same the first time I was there, 15 years ago. For this trip, the AC was working on and off... The man at the front desk don't seem to care at all to the consumers. The rooms are small, the bed is really hard, you can ear people talking in the other rooms and the gym is really small. The good point is the location. You are near Time Square and you have free parking. The hotel is near the Lincoln Tunnel so you don't really have to drive in Mannathan.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rew345
Reviews.Content: We used to go to this hotel already 15 years ago â€¦ Things have changed a lot the last 5 years. 42nd has been revived and a lot of new business opened in the area. The furniture and the entire hotel is the same as 15 years ago but it is well maintained and rooms are very clean. It compares to a 3 star average but clean hotel on the highway. If you stay in one of the rooms on 42nd street it will be very very noisy and you will hate the hotel. Rooms giving inside, over the pool are the most quite. The parking is included for guests that have a car so it is very big plus since parking rate can be as high as $35 per day ! The internet is cost only $6 per day compared to other hotels that charge $15 per day â€¦ Regarding quality, location and price you wonâ€™t find any better place in New York. There is a Deli just beside the entrance. The breakfast is fabulous and very cheap. Donâ€™t hesitate to drop in either the morning or the afternoon for a sandwich., donâ€™t make the mistake to go somewhere else. There are a lot of good local restaurants on the 9th avenue. Just walk down south and you will find some great hidden places. On 42nd street I have tried two restaurants: You get what you pay for â€¦ At the Texas BBQ the food is good but the ambiance is so so. For $17 you can eat some very decent steak. I had a pulled pork sandwich which was really good. The chicken sandwich for $5 is really a waist of time â€¦ Then we tried the Japanese fast food restaurant it was also decent but on 9th Avenue you will find better food.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: DenPgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Travel Inn with my friend and our teenage daughters. I had read the reviews so I felt comfortable to stay there. Yes, a little noisy on the 42nd street side but tolerable. Staff was very nice and quickly responded to our request for more towels and pillows. Clean and fairly roomy for NYC. Beds were hard but by the second night we were exhausted by heat and walking so it didn't matter so much. It wasn't the Ritz but the price was right and close to Times square. Also a few blocks up on 7th there were great neighborhood places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in NYC!!”
Reviews.Author: 2mygirl2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 4 nights at Travel Inn. I always read Tripadvisor before booking my rooms. I was a little hesitant about booking after reading some reviews of noise and no air conditioning, but I went ahead because the price was so good when booking with Priceline. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The hotel is extremely clean. The air worked very well. You could not adjust it, but it was comfortable the whole time. Good location, about 15 min walk to Times Square where there is a subway station. There is a bus station closer, but we did not use it. We were across from the police station right on 42nd street. The noise did not bother us much. I was only awakened twice, once by a loud car and once by a siren during the whole stay, and I am a very light sleeper. I would not hesitate to book this room again. Staff was helpful and friendly whenever I encountered them. My two teenagers did go out one night to CVS and return a few minutes later. They said front desk staff gave them bad looks but did not stop them or anything. We only had towels for 3 in our room each day, despite there being 4 of us. I had to call and request extra towels. They arrived shortly and this got us through the week. They consistently left towels for 3...not sure why??? Minor inconvenience for us. Also, pool hours are from 11-7. We were out each day during those hours each day enjoying the city. Daughter would have liked to have swam at night. At least 9pm would have been good to stay open to... All in all excellent value! Huge room! Clean! Will return! Last hotel I stayed in NYC was double the price (4 yrs ago!) and was OLD, OLD, OLD and SMALL in a much worse location! FREE PARKING- SUPER VALUE! DELI next door is worth visiting! inexpensive and super friendly! Gave us free bananas each morning for kids! :)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, basic hotel, high price.”
Reviews.Author: StephieL
Reviews.Content: We booked a "Double Double" (ie. two double beds to sleep 4 persons) room for five nights (Thurs - Mon) online and contacted the hotel to inform them that 3 of us would be staying but arriving seperately. Once my mother and I arrived we found that my brother had not been allowed into the room and had been sat in reception for over an hour despite being able to provide id as to who he was. The staff on the reception desk had been rude and unhelpful. This set the pattern for our whole stay. The staff never said so much as a Good Morning or a Thank You when we dealt with them, they didn't even look round when we walked through reception but carried on their own conversation. When I phoned reception to book a taxi they said they "didn't do that"...if we wanted a taxi to the airport we were to come down to the gift shop on the ground floor and arrange it ourselves. They were consistently rude. Our bathroom was extremely small for what seemed a pretty expensive hotel ($370 on Saturday night for 3 people sharing), the bath was small and very old and the shower was non-adjustable, stuck to the wall with a very meagre water pressure. Certainly not a refreshing shower. The hotel was extrememly ungenerous with soaps and towels etc as mentioned by the previous reviewer...pretty gauling as they cost next to nothing and is just a sign of cutting corners and bad service on the part of the hotel managment. Internet access costs $1 for 5 minutes which we found very mean considering our $370p/n bill and the fact that free Wifi is available all over New York when you buy as little as a coffee. This hotel did everything it could to squeeze more money out of its guests at every opportunity. The pool is lovely, but it should be noted only open between 11am and 7pm so no early morning or evening swims. Beds are very comfortable and although the rooms are dated in their style of decor they are comfortable enough with good air conditiononing. The deli opposite is also excellent for inexpensive, good quality bagels for breakfast...the service THERE is efficient and friendly. The location is reasonable but not outstanding...it is a ten minute walk to the nearest subway and the section of 42nd street where the hotel is situated is not particularly attractive or interesting, although we always felt safe. Free parking is a bonus I guess, but we didn't make use of it and I question how many people will take advantage of driving a car into New York. The final straw came when the swipe cards they issued us with failed to open our door 3 days in a row. Each time we had to travel back along the corridors and down three floors to reception. We never once received an apology or even an acknowledgement they were at fault, they just reswiped it and handed it back without so much as a word. The reception staff at this hotel really could not care less once they have got you into their hotel. They say that the US is the most competitive for offering high levels of customer service, based on our experience at this Travel Inn, that couldn't be further from the truth.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest place I have seen for this money!!”
Reviews.Author: jbxs
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice and efficient, they know what they are doing. Free parking is a big plus for this hotel, even more because it's not valet parking, so you can get your car whenever you want. Actually, I really didn't need it because the hotel is so well situated. Times Square and Central Park are 15 and 25 minutes by foot. Everything in the hotel was very clean: reception, elevators, hallway, room, bathroom, linens, towels and so on. Have seen much worse at 3 and 4 star hotels. Only real downside is a dated shower system, it doesn't keep its temperature, so be sure you can escape boiling hot water whenever you need to. It can also get very cold suddenly. The room was not so quiet because of the airconditioning running all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: somniare
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few days a couple of years back and it would be the first place I looked into if we ever return. The free parking was great - we had no problems with our brand new car. It was nice having the police station across the street, and we were able to walk everywhere during our stay. We felt very safe and well-located to everything. We also appreciated the mini-fridge in the room. The beds were a little uncomfortable, the room had a rather strong odor of cheap perfume, and I'd hardly rank it up there with the best night's sleep I've ever had. But it was clean, safe, and a good value - those were the criterion that really mattered to us.

Reviews.Title: “BEST DEAL FOR THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: jnkin05
Reviews.Content: First of all, onsite parking is a big plus. Wife felt very safe with police precinct across street. Its also a plus to have an onsite cafe/deli. The staff was extremely helpfull and the rooms were very clean and spacefull. Amazed to see a full size pool with patio seating. Close to Times Square and on a bus route. The room rates were reasonable and included parking. We will definitely be staying here again. Thanks very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Super location ... only downer were thin walls ...”
Reviews.Author: Henfam
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay as a family with three kids. The room was clean, spacious and the fridge came in super handy. The parking was convenient and hassle free and the location can't be beat. The only down side was that we were able to hear all the happenings in the room beside us ... when they came back to their room after partying till 3:00 am. The kids slept through it though ... earplugs come in handy. Otherwise our room facing the pool courtyard was great.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: nsolis
Reviews.Content: This is the best location you could possible hope for. It is on the same cross street as Times Square, but off to the side enough that you don't get the noise you might in some of the downtown hotels. We slept very well, the staff were friendly, the rooms clean and overall it was a very memorable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for NYC--- free garage parking is a huge bonus !”
Reviews.Author: pmac031845
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here, and were pleasantly surprised that it looked just like the pictures. One minor negative: our room faced 42nd street was noisy at times for a light sleeper. Next time we will request a room facing the pool. The staff was very accommodating in every way... from the front desk to security/garage to gift shop. They were always ready to help and made a very professional appearance. We would highly recommend purchasing a ticket for the Gray Line double-decker tour bus.... great value at $54 for 2 day pass...hop on/off. We purchased our tickets at the gift shop in the hotel. Overall, we highly recommend this hotel... $ 127 through hotels.com

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient, affordable”
Reviews.Author: gretchen81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a 3-night trip to NYC for spring break with my husband and two sons, ages 16 and 14. We had stayed here 2 years ago and were happy with our choice so decided to return. We really like the location - it is close to the subway, Times Square, and restaurants. Although it adds noise if you are on the street side, I liked having a police station across the street. (Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper.) I also appreciated the mini-fridge and microwave in the room. The room was clean and plenty large enough for us. (I have stayed at the Hilton near Times Square and this room was definitely bigger.) The bathroom is small, but serviceable. We also really liked the free on-site parking, which would add considerably to the cost at another hotel. If you are coming to the city through the Lincoln Tunnel, it is very easy to get to. The only minor problem we had was getting the staff to leave 4 bath towels instead of 3 in the bathroom. We had to ask for an extra towel twice. Also. the fitness room is not really much, but we did not have time or the need to use it, after a full day of activities in the city. If you want a reasonably priced, convenient, clean hotel for a family trip, this is a good choice. If you want luxury, romance, or pampering, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “great for a family”
Reviews.Author: imustsee
Reviews.Content: Were in New York City for long weekend. We had stayed at this property a long time ago and had been disappointed. This time was different as we were very happy with the accomodations. Our room was large ( for NY hotel standards), clean and in well maintained. Front desk staff was courteous and helpfull. Restaurant next door was fine for our needs. Close to Hudson river attractions like the Intrepid museum and harbour cruise ships. You'll have to walk a bit to get to Times square but the savings is worthwile. Too bad the pool was not yet open for the season. Recommended for families with moderate budget ( again for NY hotel price standards).

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Peppi
Reviews.Content: Just like to say we enjoyed our stay at travel inn 42st. Nice clean room friendly staff. Good location. 25/3/10-31/3/10

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: likesthebigcities
Reviews.Content: We purchased this hotel on Expedia for $99 a night, which is an excellent value in NYC as it comes with free parking. The room was small but clean and served our needs as we were not planning on spending a lot of time there. Location is great, just a few blocks from Times Square.
