The negatives were the room was facing 42nd Street and we had to have the window open, so it was very loud. The window had to be opened because the room was so doggone hot as it faces the west and it was a beautiful week weather-wise. After inquiry, we were told that there was only central air available and this was not running as it was only March. There is not separate room control, even though they advertise there is. I suppose I would suggest next time I wouldn't get the rooms that face 42nd Street, I'd get the north rooms by the pool. Other than that, I'd stay here again for the rate I got.

Reviews.Title: “If you didn't have to deal with the desk staff it would be great”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0nRunner
Reviews.Content: First time in NY and got off to a bad start when confronted by the very rude Saleem on the front desk. Seemed to ignore me and just brush me off. Felt awful and couldn't believe the rudeness exuding off of him. Two of his other male colleagues are no better. Wifi is strong but at $6 a day is expensive for convenience, given that local restaurants give it free, and even Times Square does (when it works!). Loved the rest of my time in the city so don't let it affect you if you sadly stay here. Room I had was large, kept clean by the housekeepers and I slept well. Location is not bad at all due to Times Square being nearby. I will not return here due to the desk staff - looking forward to going to the Holiday Inn up the road at a cheaper cost.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for money if not interested in customer service or too clean”
Reviews.Author: mds19761
Reviews.Content: The Location for the money is great, but the hotel staff is rude, website is misleading, and the rooms are semi clean. we were told we could NOT have any more towels or pillows. The rooms are half way clean, bathrooms are soooo small, and the walls are paper thin. The noise outside is expected since the location is so close to so many great things. So it is a crap shoot on your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: irwish__jc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a convention booking agency. It was clsoe to Javits Center and within our price range. The review on read about the hotel went from bad to good so we knew it was a crap shoot to say the least. Our rooms were in the main building, they were clean, comfortable, and outside of not having a coffee maker they were great. A nice ref and microwave added to the amenities. We spent six nights there, so this was not a one night in and out. My impression of the front desk personnel was "they had no idea how to smile", but they were somewhat helpful. Understand we had no issues with the hotel so we did not get to see how they would have handled a real problem. Lots of places to eat in this mostly residential are. Cabs are easy to get but costly if you are going to the East Side.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: isaruya05
Reviews.Content: Just fair customer service. The cleanliness of the room was questionnable: we found a hair on our pillowcase, the icebucket was soiled with grease and bring slippers because the carpet floor felt dirty. The best part: FREE PARKING!!!!!! Its located about 5-10 min walking distance to Time Square!!!

Reviews.Title: “10-min walk from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: DivaScubaDiver
Reviews.Content: Great location, within 5 minutes to Madame Thussaud, 10 min to Times Square, while enjoying the quiet location of 515 West. Great plus : guarded free carpark on site, outdoor swimming pool and gym, large family room with no traffic noise overlooking the pool on the backyard. Downsides : poor/no wifi from my room (although available in the small hotel libby). Breakfast is from the Deli next door to the lobby, which you share with the local policemen who come and grab their coffee there (police station opposite), just like in the american movies ! My colleague overlooked the street and had good wifi connection, but could hear/feel the underground. Simple hotel, room OK, small bathroom but great value for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: honestjon28
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a visit to NYC. To say it is disgusting is an understatement. We had an outdoors room along a verandah. The noise from outside is hell. The walls are paperfin - you here noise from everywhere inside too - got no sleep. The room was filthy and dated. So scared of catching somerhing from the bedclothes/linen, that we slept in our own clothes. The only plus side is the free parking. I still feel sick a month later.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean, but not a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: FritzNipple
Reviews.Content: The Good: I've stayed at the The Travel Inn a number of times over the last few years. It is pretty cheap compared to other Manhattan hotels. The free parking is great. The rooms are clean. The Bad: As mentioned by others, the air freshener is over the top. HOLY STINK! Staff isn't very pleasant. Big upcharge for wifi. Most importantly, I rarely get a good night's sleep here. The beds aren't super comfortable. The walls are PAPER thin, and the hallway noise is especially loud. If you want a cheap room, this place fits the bill. If you want to sleep well, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: pmcWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Location is ideal, but you have to put up with a heavily perfumed lobby (air deodorizer? who knows but it was almost toxic) rude staff, and undoubtedly the most uncomfortable bed I've ever slept in. I travel regularly for work, min of 2x/month and have tried many different hotel beds. This one was truly awful, small, hard and not much bedding provided. First 2 nights we froze, and the remaining 5 nights we had to sleep with the window open to the hallway across from the pool... thank god for that NY night air otherwise we would never have been able to sleep. Not worth the price, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, and great value for money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrslawsonUk
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stay in this hotel for five nights over christmas.I was determimed not to blow my budget on accommodation and after a long hours searching I finally found this great hotel for Â£78.00. Ideally located on 42nd street 5 minutes walk from the nearest subway station( 42nd street port authority) 5 more to time square, with a 24hrs CVS pharmacy across the road and a more than adequat deli right nextdoor. The hotel is clean, the rooms are clean and warm the view was not brilliant but we didnt travel all that way for the view. We had two double beds a tv , a fridge and microwave oven. The only missingthing may have been tea and coffee facilities but I only needed to go down to the deli or walk to the 7 eleven 2 mins away. I was a very safe area and at no point did we feel worried or scared. the same goes for the all of the city really. So unless money is no object why should anyone pay more than the travel inn night rate for a hotel you would not spend time in anyway. We left at 9 am in the morning and did come back till later just to fall asleep exhausted at the end of a long day anyway. Well done travel inn. Mrs Lawson UK

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay at the travel inn hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikimi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travel Inn in september 2009. Driving in was easy as the hotel is next to the Lincoln tunnel. Also we requested a quiet room, wich was pool side. The hotel was clean and simple. Also an easy walk to Times Square. There is a supermarket right next to the hotel, so we would buy food for breakfast and eat in the room. Small refrigirator in room. Free parking was great.

Reviews.Title: “They charged my credit card for a higher amount and tried to get away with it!”
Reviews.Author: SOBETraveler1981
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located around the hells kitchen area of NYC Around 42th and 10th, aprox 15 min walking distance from Times Square and they have parking; these are the only good things I can say about the Travel Inn. Other than that, the rooms are very small, the bathroom is very little and the beds are hard and uncomfortable. The furniture is old and the elevators are very little and don't work some times, scary! I stayed here with my family and I booked two rooms using my debit card. The day I checked out I signed my final statement for both rooms and everything seemed to be ok, the next day when I checked my bank account I noticed that they were charging me over $200 more than what I had signed for at checkout. I immediately contacted them and their staff was beyond rude, first I spoke to a guy by the name of Broto who was very rude and dared to tell me that according to the information he saw on the computer, they had changed the rate for my rooms at the last minute without prior notice and that there was nothing he could do about it! He advised me to contact the hotel manager Mr. Hardy the next day. I keep calling and leaving messages for him and finally I received an email from Nancy Gonzalez who told me he was on vacation and that they had not made any mistake on the charges they had made to my credit card (I had my bank statement right in front of me!) I called her on the phone and she was EXTREMELY RUDE, she has NO idea what customer service means, she would not let me speak, she raised her voice at me and on top of everything had no idea how to do her job! She kept giving me lame excuses telling me that that my bank was the one charging me a $200 fee for using a debit card or that perhaps the $200 was money taken by the hotel as deposit for incidentals, she really had no clue of anything and could not handle the situation and ended up transferring me to Nurys. Nurys seems to be the only nice person at this hotel; she was the only member of the staff who actually offered to help me, contacted my bank and ended up fixing the situation so that I got reimbursed by the hotel for the additional charges they had made! No further explanation was given to me as of why they had tried to charge me over $200 extra but at least the issue was fixed by Nurys at the end. To anyone out there who still wants to stay at this hotel I would advice you not to have high expectations about the hotel accommodations, pay cash and in case of any issues just deal with Nurys directly, stay as far as you can from Nancy Gonzalez and the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: BostonIrishWolfhound
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading many favorable reviews (and some not so favorable) Travelled to NYC to see the show at RadioCity and rest of the sights NYC has to offer. GPS brought us directly to hotel which was directly off 9A West Side Highway, and very easy to check in and FREE PARKING. Not to mention we were able to check in 3 HOURS EARLY. The room was large enough for our family of five. Two full size beds for 13 and 12 yr old in one bed and wife and I in the other. Sure the 10yr old son had sleeping bag on the floor but isnt that what 10yr old boys want. The beds were comfy and the bathroom was clean. Linens were all freshly laundred and spotless. I read some reviews complaining about the room being cold. Actually we though it was qiote warm and opened the window. This is NYC you will hear street noise unless you're in a highrise 10+ floors up.. We were on the 6th floor and room faced 42nd street but certainly nothing that kept us up at night. Location on 42nd street was close to everyting we needed. Felt very safe walking through the neighborhood. We were fortunate enough to have great weather. The staff was courteous and pleasant. We will absolutely make a return trip to The Travel Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Don't have expectations and don't need hot water you'll be fine.”
Reviews.Author: iBike
Reviews.Content: Had I been left to book my own room for this trip, rather than an office assistant this never would've happened. Lesson learned. Rooms are dated, bathrooms are tight and hot water in this hotel flucuates from cold to tepid. Told front desk about water, very nice man asked "How long did you let it run? / "15 minutes." / "You need to let it run for twenty... (all with a smile... and he was serious.). Everytime I washed my face I hit my head on the shelf above the extremely small sink. Toilet, small. The room was loud and echoy. You could easily hear people talking in the adjacent rooms. Close to a subway you can hear at odd times. Room is dingy. Front desk guys are really nice... But because you're nice does not mean I sleep better at night. Anyways, I hate complaining. It's a drag, but I don't want you to learn the hard way.

Reviews.Title: “Only good location and false advertisement for the rooms”
Reviews.Author: fendimicia
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. Like they were advertising over the internet there was no flat screen tv and no refrigerators. The worst part is the heating....WE WERE TOTALLY FREEZING... The front-desk said that they put the heating only when it goes below 55...the room was so humid that we had to sleep with 2 additional covers and the second night I had to sleep all dressed up with socks and a sweather. Forget about being sexy and wearing a baby doll to impress your partner....not in november anyway!!! On the reservation we asked for a non smoking room and we got a smoking room. A good thing was that there was indoor parking. 3 light bulbs were burned too...!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent base for visitors who want easy access to NY top attractions”
Reviews.Author: StourbridgeNettyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good value for money. The rooms were large and clean with very comfortable beds. We had a room opening onto the pool area (this was closed during our visit) and friends had one overlooking the street. Our room was quiet but a little dark, the other one was brighter but slightly noisier. Easy walking distance to Times Square, Theatres, circle cruises, bus station, underground etc. Unlike some reviewers, we found the staff helpful and generally friendly. The Deli next door was a great place for breakfast, late night pharmacy on corner was convenient and NYPD station ensured security!!!! Will certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “new york fantantastic.TravelInn, 42nd street.”
Reviews.Author: ingrid18
Reviews.Content: stayed at travelinn 42nd street.5mins from times square. grea t location.travelinn very good indeed. clean rooms ample size.me my husband and son were there in september 2009. hotelstaff very friendly and helpful, and again clean hotel great value for money. next door deli was great for breakfast. next time i go again to new york i will certainly stay at the travelinn. 10 out of10

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Peppermint4
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised how nice the Travel Inn was. The rooms were a decent size, but clean and modern. We had a room with a view of the pool, away from the street, very quiet for New York City. All employees were very nice. You just can't beat this location, 2 blocks from the Port Authority where we took the shuttle from the airport. Very convenient. Water pressure was great. We would definitely stay here again when in New York for such a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal.”
Reviews.Author: AnnieMagee
Reviews.Content: Hotels in midtown Manhattan are outrageously expensive. The Travel Inn has one of the best rates in midtown PLUS parking is included. This is incredibly rare in Manhattan and saves you a minimum of $30 per day. It's not a luxury hotel, but during our stay we found it to be very clean and quiet and the staff to be quite efficient and helpful. I'm perplexed by all the people complaining about noise in their reviews. This is Manhattan. I never go there without good ear plugs. It's a big, noisy city. I didn't think the pool would matter much to us, but as it turned out it was quite hot while we were there and a late afternoon dip in the pool after hours of walking around the city was heavenly. I think for price, free parking and location the Travel Inn cannot be beat in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in NYC”
Reviews.Author: chazza747
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on the fairly good ratings for this hotel and the location. We requested a quiet room a couple of months before our stay and on arrival were given a room which had the train line running underneath the room (see picture). Not much sleep that night. The next morning we moved to another room. The walls are paper thin so you get 360 degrees noise all night and in the morning - noise from the cooler in the room, the cooler outside the room, from next door guests, upstairs guests, guests in/out of lifts, cleaner trolleys, no sleep 2nd or 3rd nights. Yes this hotel may be cheaper than others and is in a fairly good location to time square and transport. However it nearly ruined my first time visit to NYC because you get no sleep so you're too tired the next day to do anything!! Also the front reception staff are very very arrogant, unhelpful and go out of their way to be nasty. I understand the hotel is old, not much you can do there, but good customer service goes a long way to making guests stay more comfortable. Travel Inn management should review their staff, their attitude and how they treat guests staying at their hotel. If you can afford it, stay somewhere else, otherwise this hotel is only for people who don't need any sleep at all and don't mind being treated badly.

Reviews.Title: “Do not try to find sleep there.”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a couple and had no less than 2 room changes, after which we'd given up. On one side of the floor, you cannot open the windows as the subway runs under the hotel. If you have a room on level 3 overlooking the inside pool, be ready for sleepless nights. The swimming pool pump is a 24hour noise nuisance and resonates on the floor. It is just impossible to ignore the 24hr constant sound and vibrations in the walls. The in-room air conditioning is worse. You have to choose between which noise you prefer better. Do not plan to sleep in the morning either as the cleaning people start rolling their heavy laundry trolleys in the corridors, rattling walls, opening and closing room doors, chatting well before 8am. The counter staff are not friendly, not professional and will not tell you that they will really overcharge your credit card by US$150 and hold the amount for at least 2 weeks before releasing the hold. Definitely check your billed card upon check-in. We recommend you pay more elsewhere if you plan to sleep at night but definitely look elsewhere if you should.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MNBETTY
Reviews.Content: Room was nice. We requested two beds and the room they first sent us to only had one, the did honor the request and give us a different room. It is farther from the subway than stated - 3 avenues and NYC avenues are much longer than a standard block.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: cookiepieuk
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests, the only good thing about this hotel is its location. We stayed in a 2 double bed room overlooking the swimming pool which sounds lovely at first but read on to see what it was really like... - The hotel is like a maze. Not good if you have alot of luggage to drag around with you. - If you are (un)lucky to get a room overlooking the pool, be aware of the a/c unit attached to the outside of the hotel. It is so noisy, the only way to block it out is to blast the tv volume..but that doesn't really help when you want to sleep! - Room was cold and bathroom was dirty. We found toe nail clippings, dust and hair scattered around. Totally gross. - Staff are unfriendly. - The hotel is close to Times Square but is overpriced and dirty. Don't stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and price”
Reviews.Author: Elver_8
Reviews.Content: It was difficult to make a choise of hotel because hotels in New York are expencive for what you get. A few year ago I have stayed in hotel Pennsylvania which was really bad. So I wanted to find a better hotel this time. I have found it. The Travel Inn was a nice hotel, not to big, clean, at a very good location and for a very good price. The room was nice although the bathroom was a little small. I will stay again at my next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - clean, great location - we're going back!”
Reviews.Author: tlccar1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Travel Inn for a long weekend stay. I was very impressed with all of the staff - friendly, outgoing and cordial. Our room was spotless and although some of the decor was rather old it still looked fresh and inviting. We noticed that all of the hotel had a fresh clean smell, unlike that musty, old odor you can find in older hotels. Our room not only had a flat screen TV, but also a microwave and refrigerator that were extremely convenient. We even struck up a conversation with the maid, and she stated how they changed the linens every day unless you request otherwise. Many hotels use the same sheets over and over until you leave unless you ask them to change them. Not here. We also found the location to be safe and convenient, across the street from a police station. Times Square/subway access were a five minute walk away. And lastly, where else can you get FREE parking in NYC? We literally drove in, stayed our three days and drove out. We couldn't have asked for a better deal. Is it a five star luxury hotel? No. Is it a great place to stay in NYC for a reasonable price and total convenience? Yes. We HIGHLY recommend the Travel Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy night at the Travel Inn, NYC”
Reviews.Author: CriticInOntario
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I overnighted at the Travel Inn, New York City, after getting off our cruise ship. While we were able to leave our luggage with their concierge service both before we actually got our room and after we checked out, we weren't able to check-in early. Front desk service was basic, though the staff was not particularly friendly on both morning and night shifts--certainly adequate. The room itself was basic but clean. Main complaint--our room was near the indoor enclosed pool area, so acoustics amplified any noises in the uncarpeted hall just outside our room, so it wasn't a restful night. The location of this hotel was great as was the price--within walking distance to Time's Square and the waterfront. Internet service is available in the lobby for a fee, and car service is offered to the airport for a flat rate. Would recommend the place for a short stay, but be sure to ask for a room far from the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “good location and value”
Reviews.Author: ehoolihan
Reviews.Content: I went for a conference at the Javits conference center and this hotel was great for this purpose. It was only three blocks away from the conference center. It is also vey closed to the marina ( circle line and world yatch cruises) and to time square. The hotel was clean , and the staff were vey helpful. It also has free parking and a deli next door. There is a police station, just in front of it, so I felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: AmyamyMaine
Reviews.Content: Spotless hotel with very friendly staff. A diner right next door and only two blocks from times square and subway. Very affordable and great location.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here gain, no issue's”
Reviews.Author: DenAmy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 3 nights. The location is great. The rates were awesome. The hotel is clean and the staff friendly. Free parking in a garage. We were very very happy with our stay. This will be the place I go back too, easy access to everything. If you want a "luxury" hotel, this is not for you. if you would like a nice, clean, safe place to stay while your there at a affordable price, this is it !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: hayesEhideaway
Reviews.Content: Stayed the end of July for a long weekend. $125 per night with pool and free parking with in/out privledges. Good location, clean rooms, comfortable, perfect for families.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: SJCPR
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the reviews on trip advisor and were pretty disappointed. The location is good in Manhattan, 5 minutes away from time square and the subway. Room was clean but outdated. The main problem for us was the noise. it was very noisy even though we were not facing the street (we were on the pool side) because of this big A/C unit outside the hotel that was making this huge noise all the time (I had to sleep with hear plugs). Staff was not very friendly (not sure if it is a "new york" thing or simply linked to the hotel) Price was OK but a friend of mine got a better deal in a nicer hotel in the same time period, so not best in class.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel for New York visit!”
Reviews.Author: Polly0
Reviews.Content: Travel Inn is not a fancy hotel but great value for money. The location is great, walking distance to time square and the Hudson river. The staff were not so friendly, sometimes even asleep. You have to pay for the internet. Other than that, the room is big enough, bathroom is not so big but you have everything you need. Fridge and microwave provide possiblities of keeping food in the room and heating it. The swimming pool and fitness room are basic but a luxury in NYC. Definiately recommended, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Best combination of location and value”
Reviews.Author: WanderingTwo
Reviews.Content: We chose TI for its location and free parking. We had a tiny room near the pool - a plus this visit, as the last time we visited was in winter. Easy walk to subways, restaurants, theatre, midtown, as well as easy access to the route home. We always travel with earplugs - and they were a help as our room was next to the elevator and on a busy corridor. But otherwise, the TI provided us with all the essentials - a clean room, clean towels, hot water, and a responsive front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: AJHStratford_Ontario
Reviews.Content: Great 42nd St. Location. Friendly, accommodating staff. It was great to have a fridge and microwave in our room. The third floor outdoor pool was great - our only issue was that the hours were from 10am until 7 pm. For most of the people sightseeing during the day, these hours are not very accommodating. One day we were there at 7pm and the deck/pool area was packed, however, this was closed promptly at 7pm. It would have been nice to be able to return after a day of sightseeing and relax in the pool - even if it was only open until 10pm. As mentioned in other reviews, we felt very safe in the area. Another bonus was that the hotel is located only a couple of blocks from the Lincoln Tunnel, allowing easy access both arriving and leaving Manhattan. It is also a very short walk (less than 5 min.), to the Circle Line Cruises. We did have an issue with our shower pressure and our air conditioning unit - we made a phone call each time and the problems were quickly dealt with - we were quite impressed. As this was our first trip to New York, we weren't sure what to expect, or if this would be a good location. We would definitely return to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but perfect for a family stay for a few days”
Reviews.Author: gggal
Reviews.Content: The Good - cheap --$160 a night including parking in attached garage - conveniently located blocks from Times Square - deli, liquor store, CVS and other stores near by - Clean - Pool (outside and with not convenient hours (11-7) - fridge and microwave in room - Deli next store delivered The Not good (really nothing that bad) - Beds are not that comfortable - Rooms are small, two adults and 2 children will be on top of each other - WiFi -- they charge $6 a day and it sketchy (although I never got charged) If you are looking for decent inexpensive place to stay with a family this is a good choice. If your kids are very small think twice as it is a bit of a walk to get to things 5 and up should be okay. I would recommend for short stays. We were there four days and it was getting claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid room 622”
Reviews.Author: inflatabill
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before, and came back because of the central location, friendly service, swimming pool, and free parking. The rooms are clean, and quite large for Manhattan. The wifi was sketchy, and I never really got a solid connection. Luckily, I could do most all of my online business via my iphone. My only problem was the noisy cooling tower that sits directly atop room 622. It sounded like a semi truck was running outside my window all night. I immediately noticed the noise, and when I inquired about its source, and if there was another room available, I was basically blown off. They kept telling me to come back the next day. I never got a new room and ended up sleeping with earplugs for 3 nights. I have attached a photo of the offending machine. I will certainly stay there again, as long as I can get a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel----excellent value”
Reviews.Author: WuestFamily
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed from 8/4-8/7 and had a very positive experience. We booked it online for $160/night which is an excellent value with the free parking. We had a room on the 5th floor with two doubles. We were very pleased to find both a fridge and microwave in the room. The third floor pool was large and a nice bonus in the summer. The deli next door was excellent to bring a quick breakfast back to the room. There is also a liquor store, supermarket and CVS on the same block. A police station is across the street and so is the Port Authority bus terminal. The waterfront including the Intrepid is two blocks away. The front desk staff was very friendly and gave us specific directions to get places on the subway. It is an easy walk to Times Square and the metro is only two blocks away. We bought the New York Pass and that saved so much money. We traveled with our 12 & 10 year old boys who had never been to NYC. We concentrated this trip on all the "touristy" things like Empire State Bldg, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Madame Toussauds, Natl History Museum, Met Museum of Art, Bronx Zoo, boat ride around Manhattan with view of Statue of Liberty etc. I bought the NY Pass online and saved a couple of hundred dollars on admission prices to all these "touristy" places. We packed alot of sightseeing in 3 days and would highly recommend the NY Pass!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, price and location!”
Reviews.Author: TheMontrealTravelers
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great value, we will stay there every time we go to NYC. Free indoor parking, clean and spacious rooms, great location only a couple of blocks to Times Square, nice size pool on the third floor and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “No frills”
Reviews.Author: davidccp
Reviews.Content: This is a very old hotel with no frills. Room was small and had a smell probably due to poor ventilation. Plumbing problem on first day flooded the entire toilet and overflowed into the bedroom. Had to demand to be moved to another room which tells you about service. Price is decent by manhattan standards with free parking. Good location, few blocks from times square, subway and bus terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but we still had some problems...”
Reviews.Author: Supac
Reviews.Content: There are many good things about this Hotel but unfortunately our stay had a couple of bad experiences. I'll start with the good: - The hotel is in an excellent location for exploring Manhattan. Very close to Time Square and well within walking distance of many of the major NY landmarks - The hotel itself is very clean and well kept. The room was clean, comfortable and more than large enough for three adults - Swimming pool was great at the end of a long day sightseeing Now the bad: - We flew in from London and had a late arrival into NY. I called the Hotel the night before we checked in to confirm our booking and let them know that we wouldn't be checking in until after 11pm. When we arrived we were told that they didn't have a room for us so they sent us to one of their other hotels for the night (Hotel Riverside). Had we know the quality of this hotel I would not have stayed there. The hotel smelt terrible (I'm still unable to describe the smell), the first room they checked us into hadn't been made up, the second had mouldy food in the fridge. The air-conditioning made a huge amount of noise without cooling the room and all night we could hear what sounded like mice in the walls. If you have a booking with the Travel Inn and they offer you Hotel Riverside, even for just one night, DO NOT ACCEPT IT!! - On the first night we actually stayed in the Travel Inn a group of incredibly noisy guests came back from a night out at 3 45am and decided to sit directly outside our room window, drinking and making a lot of noise (not really the hotels fault, granted, but still irritating). - One of our bags was lost by the airline and was to be delivered to the hotel when it turned up. We kept asking at reception and were told it hadn't arrived only to find it in the security room. Later that night (at 12 30am to be precise) we received a call from reception telling us that the bag had arrived and could now be picked up. Maybe I'm just getting a little old but for me 12 30am is sleep time and I would have thought anyone with a small amount of common sense would have called us at breakfast time, not the middle of the night... Anyway, good to get that off my chest. Like I say in the title, this is a good hotel, but with three bad nights sleep out of a five night stay I can only really give this hotel 2 out of 5 stars. At the end of the day, everyones experience will be different but it is still good to be aware of this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Free Parking”
Reviews.Author: CalliTraveller
Reviews.Content: I came for an overnight stay with my elderly mother for the 4th of July. Very accomodating staff. Love the free parking and the location was great. We walked to Times Square to purchase theatre tickets, walked to the show, walked to dinner. Nice restaurants all along the way. Rooms are not plush, but nice. I gave the room a rating of 4, because they are a bit dark. It was difficult to read. Other than that, we had no noise and slept comfortably. A note for purchases through Expedia: The booking will not provide two double beds. If the hotel has them available, they will do their best to accomodate. In my case, the hotel was booked for the 4th and a double bed room was not available. The hotel did offer to waive the fee for a rollaway. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Helloman2000
Reviews.Content: Situation is amazing (midtown, very close to Times square) Price is good Parking included (only one in Manhattan) Staff is great !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LilLou25
Reviews.Content: Ample room space, the perfect location just minutes walk from Times Square. The deli next door was perfect for breakfast every morning. Not too noisy considering the police station is across the road, but the train line that ran outside our window created a bit - once your used to it though it was fine. And besides, you have to expect some noise in NYC dont you!? I certainly wouldnt let it put me off staying again. The staff could have been better, but i couldnt complain.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT price. Good location. Friendly staff. Clean.”
Reviews.Author: LBCD
Reviews.Content: When in NYC, we were only in the hotel long enough to shower and sleep, so this hotel was perfect. The rooms aren't huge and plush, but as I said, it served the purpose we needed it to and at an excellent rate. Everything was clean. The staff was very helpful with directions, suggestions for traveling to certain places, info on the quickest way, the cheapest way, calling a driver for us, getting us extra towels, pretty much anything. We arrived early on the first day, and on the last day, our flight was a while after our check out time, and on both days, they kept our bags for us in security. The deli next door is a great place to eat a tasty but inexpensive breakfast. The location is only a couple blocks from Times Square one way, and close to the Hudson river the other way (which was handy for the Circle Line boat tour). Also, the police station was just across the road. At night, it was quiet and dark, and we all slept well. I would definitely stay here again if I were to go back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Deal”
Reviews.Author: shoppergirl059
Reviews.Content: Great location! We walked everywhere and were always close to the hotel. Very friendly staff, very clean, and the free parking was a bonus. The price was excellent considering the location.. We can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “good place for the price”
Reviews.Author: boblNashvilleTn_
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here for two nights while attending a lighting show at the Javits. This is the third or forth time we have stayed here. The location is great for the show. You walk three blocks and you're there. We walked to several resturants by Times Square without a problem. I wouldn't want to take my wife there for a romantic weekend, but if we were looking to take in a couple of shows, and price was a factor, I wouldn't hesitate to book a room here. My biggest complaint is most European bathrooms are huge compared to the ones at the Travel Inn. This is a business hotel that I think is worth looking at.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: uniqe9433
Reviews.Content: I was truely disappointed with this hotel - I expected better! + there was blue tape on the room door ( which should of been removed before I arrived ) - I checked in after 2 pm - but did not get to the room until 11 pm - why wasn't the tape removed. +The TV gave horrible reception. +Saturday morning the cleaning person knocked on the door - very annoying - they should know if someone is in the room or not! +Room needed to be remodeled I should of known better - but on the internet looks can be deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced, well located Manhattan hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller489
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent deal on this hotel and booked on the basis of the good reviews as I was unsure of the area. No concerns however, the surrounding area was fine, 3 blocks from Times Square and we felt fine walking back at night. The M42 bus stopped right outside the hotel which was extremely handy as the nearest Sub was 2 blocks away. Plenty of eating choices in the surrounding area away from the main tourist areas too - the Deli next to the hotel was excellent value for breakfast and the staff very friendly. Our room was better than expected - plenty of space, 2 double beds, fridge, microwave and a view of the Empire State Building. Very clean and fresh. The shower is a bit of a puzzle, other than that room perfect. The maids were friendly, as were the handy men in the hotel however the front desk staff could do with some customer service training. Got the impresson our very existence was a nuisance to them. Our key cards took shots each at failing to work and had to get them reset every couple of days which was a pain. This is my only complaint though, aside from their front desk staff the hotel itself was a great choice and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a little disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: walkaboutpaulo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Travel Inn for five nights and I expected a little better after reading so many positive reviews. Our room had one very small double bed (had asked for two when booking), no fridge/mini bar or any other appliances. The cleaning maid knocked the door each morning at about 8:30 which was a little annoying. Fitness centre was very dated with very limited exercising equipment and doors to the pool were locked. Staff were generally cold and unwelcoming. Best thing about the hotel was the typical NY diner next door. Staff here were far more friendly and the breakfast was good!

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jo-travel-alot
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Travel Inn three times now and each time it has been clean and we have had no problems. The location is good. I short walk to Times Square. The free parking is great also. We have never used the pool, but it always appears to look clean. We did get warm in our room and there was no way to turn on the air, so we just opened the window. The price we got was pretty good for the city, but I priced our upcoming stay in October and the price was almost three times as much. Not worth that much to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: statement96
Reviews.Content: As stated in previous posts; good central location, free parking, great deli downstairs, inviting outdoor pool, large rooms, got a great winter rate for less than $100 a nite...only negative would be the cleaning sanitizer spray used in the elevators - hotel needs to switch to a cleaning product that is not so strong...

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: portlandORJan
Reviews.Content: Family of 3 traveling with exchange student from Japan. The room was LARGE enough for a roll away bed. Room came with microwave and refrigerator. It is a walk to Time Square about 10-15 minutes. We felt safe--due to Police Station across street. They offer bath amenities. The room was clean. Negatives as others have mentioned the heating system..The room is warm. The gift shop is open limited hours 7- 1 pm, but you can get a 24% discount on their items. Location to a deli/ supermarket/bus depot subway is great. We ate at Westway Diner on 43rd and 44th Street..It was voted Best Diner in Manhattan by NY Daily News...IT is very good!!!! Huge menu and open 24 hours and nice service.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: RobotBacon
Reviews.Content: This was a very comfortable hotel, and in a great location. The staff was very nice, and I fell in love with the deli right next to the hotel - so much that I hunted it down again the following week. I would have preferred a room with a window, but the only window was facing the main hallway, into the pool area, and afforded no air circulation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay- found a super deal on rates, included parking.”
Reviews.Author: myjunque
Reviews.Content: Made a 2 day visit to NYC MLK weekend. Stayed here Sunday PM with 2 teenage grandchildren. Very surprised at how pleasant the staff was, how clean the room was. Special soaps and lotions .. not the usual cheap samples. Biggest surprise was free indoor parking. They even let us keep the car in garage till 5PM several hours after our checkout. All for a super deal price of less than $100. Discounts for AAA or AARP. There was an outdoor pool.. but this was in January...Neighborhood was better than anticipated, W 42nd and 10th ave..

Reviews.Title: “Travel Inn was all around great!”
Reviews.Author: jordan26_me
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Travel Inn on Jan 16th-21st. We were wary b/c some of the reviews were not so great, but we chanced it anyway b/c of 3 reasons: 1) FREE GARAGE LOCKED PARKING! To find free parking in New York is a shock and it was secured inside the warmth and safety of a locked garage. 2) LOCATION--We needed something close to the theater district and the Colbert Report--our 2 main reasons for making the trip. It was conveniently located so that we could walk to both, and was only 3 blocks from Times Square. The added bonus is that it was across the street from the police station. 3)PRICE--this was the one that really made us wary b/c it just seemed too cheap--116.00 a night. We were extremely satisfied with our choice. We arrived earlier than check in time, but they let us go ahead and check in. We were by the pool so it was very quiet. We slept quite soundly. We needed extra towels b/c we had showered when we arrived due to our drive, and again in the morning. When I went to ask for them, they were very nice...even let me go w/ them to the laundry to get them. Desk staff was always friendly and helpful. Cleaning ladies were also. The only problems were the water pressure, which is always bad in hotels...the t.v., which only had 2 stations that came in, but we really weren't there long enough to do more than shower and sleep....and the elevator doors; they were quick and you had to hurry, but you got used to that quickly. The ice machine was good too...we were on the same floor. Even the vending machines were normally priced. I just wanted to make sure that they got a good review. They were great for those on a budget who want to make the most of their time in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: damien
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights from January 5-8. I had checked out many reviews and found that this hotel suited all our needs and also got good reviews. We arrived by shuttle bus from La Guardia around 1 pm. Our room was ready as we had asked for an early check in. Our room was on the top floor (6th ) end room. As we were at the back of the hotel overlooking the pool we never heard a sound. The 2 young ladies at the Reception were very helpful and gave us a map pointing out the various places that we wanted to visit. The room had 2 double beds which were very comfortable, a nice black fridge and microwave, a small wardrobe , small washroom. TV with lots if channels and a dresser. They suppied a hair dryer, shampoo and body lotion. There was a small gift shop in the hotel. The gentleman there phoned to confirm our shuttle bus reservation. The deli next door had good sandwiches. There was a Food Emporium supermarket very close to the hotel when you turned left out the front door. We found everbody that we spoke to in Manhatten to be so helpful. The subway was very convenient . We picked up our tickets for the Opera by getting off at the Lincoln Centre. We walked to Broadway the next day to see "Equis". We walked to St Patrick's Cathedral and some museums. Some were to far so we had to take a taxi but they were very reasonable. We found an excellent high class Chinese restaurant acoss from the Lincoln Centre. Also a fantastic Japanese Seafood Buffet Restaurant at 32 nd Street and 5th Ave. It was a very pleasant walk to the hotel. I would have no hesitation in recomending this hotel to anybody who wants a good clean hotel with pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Inn - NYC”
Reviews.Author: oliver2616
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just spent the weekend (12/6 -12/7) in NYC; we stayed at the Travel Inn at 515 West 42nd Street and were very happy with the hotel. The room was very nice and had a microwave and refrigerator. The only thing we didn't like was that you cannot regulate the temperature in the room; we opened the window and it was fine (I bought earplugs and had no trouble sleeping). The area is fine; there are several apartment buildings in the area so there are many local people walking around. The police station is directly across the street and the area is well lighted. There is a deli right next door to the hotel and you don't even have to go outside to get there; you can walk through the parking garage which is only a few steps. On the other side of the hotel is a liquor store. About a block and a half up the street there is a Food Emporium (a large grocery store) and a little further on the other side of the street is the "Theater Row" diner. The food was good and the prices reasonable. The hotel is two blocks from Port Authority so you don't have to take a cab. The hotel has free parking in their garage if you want to drive into the city. The staff were very nice and helpful. There is a great outside pool; of course we didn't get to use it since it was in the thirties. It was a very pleasant expeience and we will probably stay there next year. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, worst and most discourteous hotel reception I ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: LIVEVAC
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with no boundary on this terrible hotel. One of the worst hotels I have ever come across during my 20 years of travel. Cold and unfriendly reception staff except for one lady who was on morning duty. The male receptionists or maybe owners??? just stared at you, never even bother to smile or greet their guests, just sat at their seats and gave unfriendly looks! Location OK nothing great for the price you pay. Will definitely NOT recommend to anyone to stay there as the looks of the staff simply spoil your holiday moods. Room OK but definitely have to remove/retrain these reception staff if they are not owners of the hotel as the first impression of hotel is BAD because of their unfriendlines. If they are the owners, then they better not to be in Service industry!

Reviews.Title: “loving N.Y.”
Reviews.Author: tmdl48
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, affordable, conveniently located hotel. Parking is off-street as you enter a garage that is under the hotel. The lobby is right there as you enter . The rooms are average with a fridge and tv and again, clean. We realized after unpacking that train tracks ran under our room and we'd hear them. We asked for another room and were given one without any problem. There's an outdoor pool. At first I was worried that we had a rear door directly off the pool but then I felt secure that we had a second exit if needed in an emergency. Not sure if there was an indoor pool. The location is a plus with shopping nearby and a coffee shop next door. Internet access in the lobby. We'd definitely stay here again for a short visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Quite alright for the family trip”
Reviews.Author: ilovenydk
Reviews.Content: After visiting New York twice, I finally had my mom and two sisters with me. I know they have quite high expectations so I wanted to find a nice, clean, quiet hotel with a great location! I thought the hotel was the best ever. But the tough judges (my sister and my mom) had one complain: The streetnoise! It's hard to avoid it when you stay in central Manhattan. The room was clean and we had a maid giving us clean towels and soaps everyday. The room we had was a two doublebeds. We had a fridge, a microwave and a television. A table and a chair. The bathroom was clean, with a traditional tub/shower combination. Lots of lights and a big mirror. The closet was quite large also and had mirrors on the doors so you could make sure your clothes is alright before leaving the room. There is a nice diner just across the street and another one a block away. A supermarket within 5 minutes walk. And only 13 minutes walk to Times Sq. The bus is right outside the hotel and goes crosstown. I would absolutely recommend it to families. If you are single and travelling I would say thats its a bit pricy .. 2100 dollars for one week - 4 persons.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeilandBarbara
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to run the New York Marathon and arrived on Halloween, which was great - a buzzing city. We went as part of a package with Sports Tours UK. The Travel Inn is not a lodge type hotel and is not connected to the Travel Inn group. It is part of the Empire Hotels group. The hotel is located in Manhatten on 42nd Atreet, between 9th and 10th Ave. A few min walk to Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue etc. The location is very good for getting around. Our rooms on the 7th and 8th floors were adequate, with all required amenities but faded and rather small, but I suppose a fair size for a major city centre hotel.Bathroom adequate, but again small and faded. There is no bar or restaurant, but there are numerous places to eat within 2 min walk. The outdoor pool looked nice, but we did not check the temperature. Large supermarket on the same block. Police station opposite, which can give some siren noise, but no more than any other hotel in New York - it's not a quiet city. Our only problem was that the 2 small lifts seemed to be in permanant use and we had to wait ages all of the time. A fairly non discript hotel, but in a good location for a few nights. Cannot comment on the value, as it was part of a package with flights, race entry etc. Sports Tours use it every year. N&B

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Kbrey
Reviews.Content: Family of four (two daughters 8 and 5) stayed at the Travel Inn from Nov 11- Nov 14. The location is great. It is a few blocks away from Times Square. We had an inside room facing the pool. The room was quite warm so we opened the window and left it open the entire time (except 5 am - we awoke. There was street noise with it open so we shut it and it was pretty quiet.) The room was small, typical chain hotel size with two double beds. The beds were a bit hard, sheets were clean and soft. The bathroom was clean, but the shower was stained and old. It needed to be refinished. We placed a towel on the floor of the tub and showered standing on it. Having a refrigerator and microwave was a great value. We bought milk and instant oatmeal and ate breakfast in the room. It was a bit tricky without a table and young kids, but worth the effort to save $20-$40 on breakfast. I would stay here again. The location is really great. The price was good ($160/night). I orignally booked the hotel room for $200/night. I went back to website and found that the rate dropped to $175 a night, the hotel changed it for me. I went back to the webisite the night before we arrived and the rate was $160/night. The hotel again changed my rate with no problems. The Veterans Day Parade was the day we arrived and the hotel street was closed. It would have been great if the hotel would have informed us that the parade would be starting at 11 causing streets to close and traffic to be much worse. Parking is free at the hotel. We only had a car for a few hours, so I am not sure how easy it was to get in and out of the garage. There were no bugs, no roaches, no rats! Overall, a good value for very pricey New York. Again, the location was great!! Accessible to Port Authority to get on Subways and walking distance to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly front desk and Moneyface limo”
Reviews.Author: noboundary
Reviews.Content: location was ok BUT service is Terrible. The front desk staff do not want to stand up but rather sit at their desk behind the counter to response to your query. unfriendly response and attitude. we asked the front desk if we should take the taxi or limo. they said hotel Limo is best choice US$50 as taxi will be limited. in the morning of leaving, we see many taxi outside and reckon its cost US$35 by taxi to LGA airport. while leaving hotel, we were 10mins late for the limo service, at the airport the driver demanded U$15 more for us being late. we do not want to pick up argurement so paid for it. its ok to pay $15 as I have shared this experience with dozen of friends who are always travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good price.”
Reviews.Author: brownbear250
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel many months prior to my visit and because of the excellent price I got I decided to stick with it despite the mixed reviews.Overall I am glad I did. Things did not get off to an auspicious start when the the receptionist couldn't find my booking although he did promise me a room.When I returned he was 'busy' and then (I quote)'forgot about me'.When I could eventually check-in I was very pleased with the size of the room (2 king size beds)and all the facilities.Fridge,microwave,iron etc etc.I was on a balcony overlooking the pool which was much quieter, I imagine, than the outer rooms.Everything was clean but all a bit tired,the bathroom in particular could have done with some refurbishment. The location is good, not far from Times Square and a subway station.There was also a very good Food Emporium (supermarket) about a block away which was very handy. One thing that threw me a bit was the fact that there was no in-room heating facility-the management decide when it's cold.Fortunately their idea of cold and mine seemed to tally. I would recomend this hotel for anyone looking for location and price over luxurious living.It's not the Ritz but you are not paying Ritz prices

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, and a pool!”
Reviews.Author: FunFamilyVancouverBC
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we really wanted to be able to swim while in Manhattan to catch US Open tennis. The pool is quite large, clean, and was a great bonus. The rooms were very large for NY. Staff helpful and pleasant. Not a fancy place, but perfectly clean and safe. About 4 long blocks along 42nd St. to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rxmommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 3 children had the pleasure of staying at the Travel Inn this summer. We picked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reccomendations. What a great choice. It is not fancy, there is no bar or restaurant. There is no one to take your bags. It was very clean and it had a parking garage with free parking. You could access your car whenever you wanted. They allowed us to check in early and place our luggage in the room even though the room wasn't ready yet. The room was really clean. The air conditioning worked great. The rrom had a microwave and a refrigerator which was handy with kids We asked for pool side rooms which is a plus, no noise and close to the pool for the kids. This hotel is so convenient, right off the Lincoln Tunnel. We parked and never drove our car again until we left for home. Also we asked to leave our car in the garage after we checked out as we were spending the day in NYC. They said no problem and no charge. I was worried that the car would be towed when we got back, but it wasn't. Next door to the hotel is this great NYC style Deli. Great food and very cheap for NYC. There is a police station accross the street. The closest subway is 2 blocks away..that is the only downside. Times Square and Broadway are about 4 blocks away. Long walk for kids, but not adults. We generally took the subway or a cab because of the kids. We always felt safe. We had no problems. If you're going to ride the subway get a pass card. Don't get a per ride card..too much of a hassle. Get one card you can keep swiping. Only problem is with multiple family members, you have to swipe for each member. Makes it difficult when New Yorkers are trying to exit where you are trying to enter and swipe the card 4 times for each family member. After a few rides we got to be experts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LdnRnr
Reviews.Content: Convenient, reasonably priced and the staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “The Travel Inn New York - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Pathcalmalyron
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (me, husband & daughters, 12 & 15) stayed in a double double room for 3 nights from 25 July at The Travel Inn 515 West 42nd Street, NY and couldn't recommend it enough for a 'smaller' budget hotel. The rooms were spotlessly clean, the reception desk helpful and the location great. I am a very fussy person when it comes to hotels and I couldn't fault this place. If I had to it would only be that the shower wasn't that powerful - but does that really matter?? We even had a fridge & microwave in our room! A 5-minute walk from the Metro & Bus, 8-minute walk to Times Square. Didn't have time to use the swimming pool but it looked nice - for guests access only. The rate was very reasonable - ring them direct and you 'may' be offered something even better. The 2 diners we ate at close-by were great. Recommend the "See New York in 1-day tour" - I booked it through Viator - excellent way to see the city- better because it's not a hop-on, hop-off tour, the guide stays with you all day and tells you all sorts of things you wouldn't otherwise know. You MUST walk the Brooklyn Bridge. Do the Empire State Building at night - we went just after midnight, no queues - spectacular - far better than seeing the views in daylight (which I have also done about 20-years ago). With 2 x teenagers we had to do Abercrombie & Fitch (of course). Go to the one at South St, Seaport - you don't have to queue to get in but do allow plenty of time - it's popular! Shop in Canal Street for your fake bargains - don't be put off by the pushy people - they're OK - enjoy the bartering! I want to go back & do it all again........... ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Good value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TTBo
Reviews.Content: Great location and good room. A bit on the small side, perhaps, but it's New York City. What do you expect? Three of us had adequate room to move around, and the pool and parking were great extras. Hotel was clean, and staff was helpful. Parking is a bit tight, but we managed to park a Toyota RAV4 -- and take it in and out a few times -- with no serious problems. You're within a half mile to Times Square and even closer to the subway (Port Authority station). There's also a large supermarket on the corner. Oddly, it's sort of hidden, but you'll see the sign for Food Warehouse(?) or some such thing. Police station is directly across the street from the hotel. Overall, a solid value.

Reviews.Title: “Needs TLC”
Reviews.Author: pgmiller
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 16-20, 2008. The location is great. However, next time I would spend more and stay in an updated, nicer hotel. Our bathroom was dirty and not cleaned each day (toothpaste in sink). Also the hot water is very difficult to control. Do not let a child or elderly person shower without assistance. The TV was almost not worth watching. Few channels and VERY POOR picture quality. The pool is outdated and needs a good cleaning. Front desk staff were unpleasant and not helpful at any time. We requested a taxi at the end of our stay to get to LaGuardia. They said they would have a town car ready for $50. Our taxi from the airport to the hotel was only $24. We told them not to reserve the town car and we would obtain our own taxi. We did not have any problems with the air conditioning as other reviews have.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: USny-visitor
Reviews.Content: I got a double double rooom for a good price (207 with tax). The room was clean, decent. The staff was helpful. The awesome features are the free parking (one spot per room) and the walkable access to Times Square. It was a decent place and excellent location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Ola_E
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week at Travel In on 42:nd Street. Our family is me, my wife and 2 boys 14 and 16. Travel In was well worth the money. After reading earlier reviews here on Tripadvisor we ask to get a room not facing the street. A smart choice since right opposite the hotel lies a police station. Next to the Police station you find a drugstore. A block down towards 11:av. you find the local Starbucks for the morning coffee. The hotel was clean and the room was as expected. We had a double/double with 2 kingsize beds. Not much place for romance ;-) The beds where ok but a litte bit hard. The room had a fridge and a micro so we made our own breakfast before leaving the hotel exploring New York. Half a block up 42:nd between 10 and 9:th av we found a very good assorted grossery store called The Food Emporium where we did most of the shopping for breakfast. Half a block further to Time Square lies a nice pasta restaurant called The Theater grill that also serves breakfast. When you are in New York you must see all the obvious, Brooklyn Bridge, Empire State, Central park... but also take a tripp to B&H Photo on 9:te ave / 33:street. ItÂ´s a fantastic Photostore. The owners are orthodox jews so the store i closed on saturdays. If you are looking for shopping go to 47:th street "Diamond street" for jewelery. On 48:th / 5 th av you find music shops. On 14:th / 5 th av you find Guitar center A nice sporting goods store is Paragon on 18:t / Broadway For clothes you can go to Macys on 34:th street or start your walk on 10:th street going north up to 18:th street on Broadway The further north you get the higher the price Avoid the stores around Time Square if you are looking for low prices. All and all we had a fantastic week in New York and the kids are already planning their next trip back

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms are worn down”
Reviews.Author: Tira_20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a 5 minute walk from Times Square. There's a pool and a small fitness room. There's no a/c and the windows in our room couldn't open, so it can be very hot! Our room was ok but worn down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Convention Attendees”
Reviews.Author: Starbrax
Reviews.Content: I attended the Book Expo last year in New York. I spent months searching on the Net for a good hotel to stay that was near the Jacob Javits Convention Center. Luckily I chanced upon the Travel Inn website and got in touch with them right away. It was a good choice since it was very near the convention venue. I didn't have any difficulty checking in as the staff were expecting my early arrival. After that long haul flight from Manila, Philppines to LA then to New, York, all I wanted was a soft comfy bed to lay down on. I got my wish! I had a spacious room with a clean bath room on the back part of the hotel so it was really quiet. I felt refreshed the next day as I walked down to the Convention Center which was just a 10-15 minute walk away. At the end of the day, I just dropped in my room to change and refreshen up then it was NY after dark for me! It was lovely to note that right outside my door was a great view of the Empire State Building! Times Square and Broadway were just minutes away. There were good delis nearby in case I got hungry. With an NYPD station right across and a Catholic Church nearby, who wouldn't feel safe, even in NY! I love NY, sounds corny but I really do! PS. The hotel shop keeper was very nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Ladies Weekend Away in New York”
Reviews.Author: TerrySaultSte.Marie
Reviews.Content: 6 girls met in New York for a wonderful few days away over the Memorial Day weekend. Friendly staff, clean rooms, and the air conditioning kicked in just in time for the heat that added to our trip. Great restaurant next door - short walk to Time Square, very safe neighbourhood - located across the street from a cop shop. Very informed staff - extremely friendly. I would definitely recommend this to anyone, but not for a romantic get-away. Family oriented, not too noisy, very comfortable beds. Only problem - pillows not fluffy enough.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front Desk Staff and Thin Walls!”
Reviews.Author: mailbroad
Reviews.Content: My mother, teenage niece and I stayed at the Travel Inn in the first part of April. I decided to go with the more positive reviews at Trip Advisor instead of the more negative when I booked our room. The price was lower than many other places and it was very clean but the walls are paper thin and the desk people were the most unfriendly I have ever encountered at any hotel/motel I have stayed at. They should try saying, "hello!" or act like they are interested in answering guests' questions. The people that worked in the little gift shop were nice, however. It is a two block walk from Times Square so the location is fine. I must mention a plus for the Travel Inn. I left a tote bag there (duh!, I know!) and they were happy and helpful in returning it to me. Of course I had to pay to have it shipped but they kept me updated with e-mails and it arrived in perfect condition!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hockeymom19
Reviews.Content: No air conditioning, rooms were hot. Our room faced the street which was quite loud. We would definitely stay here again but would ask for a room away from the street. Good location. Police station across the street. Clean rooms. Great price!

Reviews.Title: “HIt the spot”
Reviews.Author: Kilkcat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April. The hotel is very reasonably priced in comparison to others in the area. It is only a 10minute walk from Times Square and very convenient to Broadway, nice restaurants and the Port Authority bus station. The room was more than adequate - two queen beds and lots of space. The bathroom was small but everything was really really clean, which means a lot. If you are a light sleeper request a room at the back of the hotel. We were at the front and with the police station across the way, it was a little bit noisy. The staff weren't exactly friendly but check-in and check-out were efficient and we didn't need to talk to them other than that, so we didn't mind. We would highly recommend the hotel and the diner next door is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: EyeDocBrazil
Reviews.Content: The hotel has absolutely renewed property, presenting new carpets,paintings,faucets,courtains and etecetera. It is not a great decoration but very honest and clean. It is located three blocks from Times Square, and seems somewhat desert at night, but it is located just in front of the Police station, so very safe. The lower floors that face 43th Street are pretty noisy, so better stay in the back rooms. It is not a plushy place but offers good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: fishon101
Reviews.Content: Wow, I would not come back. My work made me stay here as they were trying to save a couple bucks since this place was a touch cheaper than the Marriott--BAD IDEA. 1) My room was right next to the elevator, which was RIDICULOUSLY loud. You could hear it clearly every time someone used it--ALL NIGHT LONG 2) Stains on the sheets. They were washed, but they had some nasty stains nonetheless. 3) It was a small room, as I could barely walk by the bed to get to the other side of the room 4) They use way too much pledge. Everything in the room had a heavy coat of it, and the smell was overbearing 5) The staff wasn't friendly 6) No free Wifi, AND, mine wouldn't even work in my room after I paid for it; I had to go to the lobby (where you can't even drink a soda because there is no food and beverages allowed--lame) to do all my after hours work. Go Marriott or somewhere else is my advice!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: ftsuperstar
Reviews.Content: After hours of endless searching and reading reviews my best friend and I decided that we would take a chance and book here. And we are thrilled that we did! We drove in and the ease of getting to the hotel was great! Two block up from the West Side Highway meant that we didn't have to fight traffic in the heart of the city. We pulled in and were greated by a very nice parking attendant who directed us to check in. They were more than accomodating to us when we said we would like a quiet room. *note: always ask for a room overlooking the pool* it's very quiet and it's a nice view of the Empire State Building. After check in we drove the car to a nice clean secured parking garage (on the hotel property,something you NEVER FIND IN NYC) and went right from the garage to our room. Also I might mention that you are able to enjoy in and out services with your car,meaning you can take your car out for the day and return, this again is something you never find in NYC. Our room was clean quiet and very comfortable. A mini fridge and a micro made it all the better. I will say the room is a bit warm but if you leave the window open a nice breeze blows in. * Note,it's NYC folks. Close and lock your window before you leave for the day. Times Square was a few short (3) blocks away as well a a great Irish pub, right around the corner (Landsdowne). There is a great deli on site as well as a liquor store and grocery store within 2 walking minutes. Also a excellent flea market on 39th and 10th (again,a short 3 blocks away). We stayed for 2 nights and upon check out they let us leave our car so we could walk around a bit more. I can't say enough good things about the place. As for other reviews about the staff being rude,while they aren't very personable,they are quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: tuckqueen
Reviews.Content: I loved the place. It is three blocks from time square. The staff was friendly enough. My sister and I stay from Mar 30- apr 1. The room was clean and very affordable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed in our own hotel room!!”
Reviews.Author: JDIdaho
Reviews.Content: I would not suggest staying at this hotel due to security. Myself and 3 others girls stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and on the 2nd night our hotel was broken into. They stole a laptop and mp3 player. We contacted the night manager right away. He did nothing to make us feel safe. Didn't suggest to change rooms or anything. The night manager advised us not to contact the police until the manager talked to us in the morning. He advised he would have them call us between 7:30 and 8am. The manager never contacted us. We went down to the lobby the next morning and they knew nothing about it. We filed a police report and were informed to contact the manager after we received our case # so that we could file a claim through the hotel insurance. We have tried to contact them 4 times and they haven't returned our phone calls once. They don't have safe's in the rooms. I would suggest that you stay somewhere else for your safety.

Reviews.Title: “recommend this hotel +++”
Reviews.Author: montreal008
Reviews.Content: Went to New York for Easter stayed 3 nights. Requested special room via email received and answer from them and got the room requested at no extra cost. Very clean room , can ear the neighbor next door but overall quiet. Very good and cheap restaurant for breakfast beside the hotel, staff very pleasant.10 mins walks to Time Square and the Bus Terminal.Will return. Recommend this hotel for anyone who are looking for a budget hotel with fairly cheap price for New York.Found cheaper prices when I booked directly with the Hotel on their Web site.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Tuft
Reviews.Content: We were 4 person(2adult + 2 boys) stay at this exelent hotel for 5 days i february. We share a quad(2 dbl. beds) on 6 floor. A big room clean and nice with good big TV, a fridge and a microoven. The bathroom was small but good equipted. The reception was friendly and help us when we ask. The only minus was when we checked out we should pay extra because our small boy have played a game on the TV. There was no places said that this service was not free. The hotel have free wireless internet - for security reasons you must pick a new code in the reception each 24 hour. The location is perfect 800 meter from Time Square and neer the big bus therminal which can take you anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cant fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: amyt23
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews left on here, we were apprehensive about staying in this hotel but we needn't have worried. We were greeted by a lovely lobby decorated with decorations and a Christmas tree. The staff were absolutely fine, they were not rude like some reviews have said. The hotel was extremely clean too. Our room was lovely, clean and the beds were made every day. The location was great too, it did get a little tedious walking the stretch of road to times square every day but walking is what you should expect to do when you visit New York City. I would highly recommend this hotel, it was great value for money and when I visit New York again, I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and cheap”
Reviews.Author: JoandJoe2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the travel inn over the new year period. We were a little worried from reading the other reviews on this site however we were very pleasantly surprised. The location is simply great...a ten minute walk and you are at Times Square..three blocks along 42nd street, thats all. On the walk, you'll pass madam tussards, theatres, diners etc... we used the subway too, to get from one end of manhattan to the other (i.e to get to the southern part and go to Liberty island) The hotel is clean, frindly, and ven at new year when i guess thehy would rather be elsewhere - they were helpful. the concierge in the shop was a bit useless - advising ervryone that all places were clsoed on new years day - -when we went and found the natural history museum to be open. don't bother eating at the hotel - across the street, one block towards times square, gp to the Theatre row diner - excellent french toast. other eateries - again, don't bother with the expense at Times Square...try anywhere along 9th and 10th avenues, walking north towards central park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelPara
Reviews.Content: I must say that this hotel was in a good location for Times Square. We walked everywhere (and we're still feeling it). It was a good price for the location, but it was nothing spectacular. I was, however, disgusted with the hotel staff. Every day the access code for the internet changed and they made us get the code in the lobby. Three of the four nights we were there, the code did not work and they said they have never had this problem before. It became a bit of a joke with us b/c they all said those exact words: "we have never had this problem before. Bring your computer down and we will see what's wrong with it." The first few nights we just had to try and try until it finally worked. The second night we were told by the hotel staff the next morning that we were given the wrong code the night before. The third time, we just went to bed and gave up. The night staff was very, very rude at all times. When we would come in through the lobby of the hotel to go to the elevator, we were stared at the whole way through. Not even a hello or smile was given throughout our entire stay there. We were treated this way throughout NYC, but I would expect more courtesy at a hotel. I would possibly stay there again, but not before I searched long and hard for a more courteous hotel. A few words of caution: Don;t allow your children to search under the beds for anything, as they may find a mouse trap as mine did. Try not to take a shower in the evening, as you will find lukewarm water at best. Also, do not take your film to the 1-hour photo at CVS across the street. I spent $66 there and had to throw my pics away when I got home, as my $500 camera shots looked like disposable camera shots. The color was horrible!!! I cried like a baby...

Reviews.Title: “Great place - Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: truesaint
Reviews.Content: After spending several hours pouring over reviews of hotels in Manhattan, we decided to stay at the Travel Inn, on the corner of 10th & 42nd. The location is excellent, just a ten minute walk will get you right into the heart of Times Square. Although this Travel Inn is not the same company as the Travel Inn in the UK it is to the same standard (if not better). The rooms are well maintained and the staff are friendly and helpful. You might want to take a set of earplugs with you. Our Room overlooked the police station and every now and again you get woken up to the sound of the NYPD.
