I would definately stay here again and have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shazjak
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 5 night break. Upon arrival check in was a breeze and the staff were friendly. The room was a fair size with 2 double beds that were very comfy, fridge and microwave also good additions (a kettle would have been nice also) this hotel is not the ritz but if you want cheap and clean I would recommend. The location is great just a couple of blocks from Broadway and Times Square. If you are planning a trip to Liberty Island I would try to go on the earliest ferry as the later ferries have horrendous queues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - great staff!”
Reviews.Author: ShockingpinkCumbria
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed here for our first trip to New York - my mum, me, my sister and a friend. We booked 2 double-doubles and were pleasantly surprised, having heard how small hotel rooms in NY can be. Our rooms were a good size, with really comfortable beds, TV, microwave, fridge, iron and ironing board... in fact, everything except a kettle! Luckily, I'd brought a travel kettle as we Brits love our morning cuppa. The view from the rooms (of the railway tracks) was a bit disappointing, but we weren't planning on looking out of the window much! The staff at the hotel were fantastic - nothing was too much trouble for them and any small needs were attended to immediately. Also the luggage store on our last day was a real boon - it meant we were able to enjoy our holiday right up to the last minute (and we did - arriving to pick up our bags 2 minutes before the shuttle bus collected us!). As others have said, the deli next door was great for breakfast - but I must recommend the Westway deli on 9th avenue - near 43rd st. Even better value than the one next door, and they do hot oatmeal which is brill when it's cold! Also unlimited coffee. A really substantial breakfast for 4 came to $27 including taxes. Fantastic. We ended up getting Citysights bus tour as they accosted us on the first day. Can't recommend them over Grayline as the frequency is much less. The guides were hilarious, though! Proper NY sarcasm.

Reviews.Title: “great choice for great price”
Reviews.Author: AberdeenKaren
Reviews.Content: For first time visitors to new York, 2 adults (mum,sister )and a13 year daughter we were concerned about location, safety and cost. Travel Inn was ideal on all counts. Room had a great view of Empire State Building, great deli next door for breakfast and lady in the little gift shop a mine of useful information. She also arranged our transfer back to JFK . Hotel rooms aren't luxurious but were very clean and believe me after shopping and sightseeing 13 hours a day a firm matress was just what was needed. Only complaint the shower temperature control was very erratic. Young children should use bath. Out the hotel door turn left walk 2 blocks Time Square. Grey Line sightseeing tours stops for Down town and Uptown in Times Square(tour guides excellent!) . Subway station block before Time Square direct line to South Ferry for Statue of Liberty- get in the first five coaches though! Turn right from hotel door two/three blocks to a new waterfront development also terminal for river cruises. We loved New York and we thought the Travel Inn represented great value for money in a great location where we felt perfectly safe walking to and fro even late in the evening. PS If the Blue Man Group are still on in Astor Place Theatre definitely worth a visit- great show!

Reviews.Title: “Broadway on Broadway”
Reviews.Author: MrGus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in NYC (my first time) for the second half of a nine day vacation. The first four and a half days we spent in Washington D.C. In NYC we stayed at the Travel Inn Hotel, 42nd and 10th ave. I can recommend the Travel Inn for being way above average in every catagory, from location, to front desk, to being extremely clean, and large room. ( After hearring how small hotel rooms were in NYC) our room was the same size as any hotel or motel room we have stayed at anywhere. We walked almost everywhere, except for sight seeing bus (Greyline) and one cab from train station (We took the train from D.C. to NYC) to Travel Inn and van from hotel to Laguardia airport. My wife and I (I am 63 she is 54) walked from Empire State Building to Central Park and then back to Travel Inn.Anyway while we were in NYC they had Broadway on Broadway ( Times Square ) every Broadway show had one number song dance whatever. Then at the very end confetti fell from the roof tops just like New Years Eve.WOW

Reviews.Title: “Not A Budget Hotel... Much Better”
Reviews.Author: Y0rky
Reviews.Content: I booked the Travel Inn direct by telephone as I needed 2 rooms for 5 people for a 6 night stay. I had searched the web for a budget hotel and the Travel Inn fell into that catagory. I would not class this place as a budget hotel. We had a fab stay there. From my first contact by telephone to the reservation staff, various e-mails as I had to change the dates and room requests, to arriving and having a great welcome by the desk staff. Our double double rooms overlooked the pool and were clean and fresh. The rooms inc a TV, fridge and a microwave, an ironing board and an iron and a hairdryer. The maid had her hand full with 3 lads in one of the rooms but the room was cleaned every day no matter what time they emerged. The pool was a great place to relax after a day out and before a change for a night on the town. The manager arranged a Limo to take us all the the airport ... at a good price. The hotel is located on West 42nd Street and has plenty of delis and bars around. The "Theater Diner" across the way will deliver to your room and the Deli next door to the hotel is ideal to nip down and grab a coffee. A great location with easy walking to Times Sq and all sights. This was the 1st trip to New York for the lads as they were waiting until they were all 21 .... and they loved it and was made a Fab holiday by the stay at the Travel Inn. I will rec. to friends and family and def stay they again on my next trip. ps .. my last stay in New York was at the Crown Plazza on Times Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: Masscouple
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just spent one night at the travel inn to go to Rachael Ray and Hairspray. The hotel was great for the price we found on expedia. We had stayed there years ago and new it was a safe choice. The first room we got was literally over the train tracks. The fridge and micro were missing (which I wouldn't know unless I had read reviews prior). I immediately asked for another room. Good thing as the train came and blew the horn twice before going under our room!! Our second room wasn't clean yet, but WE asked the housekeeper to clean it. She did, so we knew it was clean (saw the old sheet taken out, etc). We tipped her for being so quick. The room was pretty and clean. The TV was extremely small, but we didn't need it. It was right next to the elevator and pool, but we stuffed our ears to steep! The beds and pillows were fine (little hard, but not too hard). There were no extra pillows, and the towels were SUPER small. Water pressure was fine. We mostly walked, which is why I would say the location isn't stellar, Yes it is on 42nd street, but very close to the hudson. You can take the M42 cross town bus though right by the hotel. We couldn't because we didn't have $2 in coins each. That was a real pain!!! There was a taxi strike too, so we mostly walked. I love walking in NY, but my mom just had knee replacement surgery. I would recommend this hotel if you want the free parking (which is why we chose it). otherwise, try to stay a little closer to broadway or so if that's where you are headed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ucstefi
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 stayed at the Travel Inn 8/31-9/2 2007. I have been reading all of the reviews here religiously trying to decide what to expect of this hotel. Based on the mixed reviews, it seemed like a 50/50 chance that I would have either a positive or negative experience. We arrived at 9am Friday morning. Our check-in wasn't until 2pm, so I was hoping to just be able to park our car at the hotel until we could check-in later. When I walked into the lobby, the desk staff was friendly & there was another staff washing the windows. Not only could we park at 9am, but they said our room was vacant & they let us go right up!!! That was a huge plus for me - an 8hr drive & to have a bed right away was fantastic. Our check-in literally took 30 seconds - completely hassle-free. Parking was a bit tight for our Crown Victoria, but my husband pulled it off without much effort whatsoever. We were on the 7th floor, room 733 just outside the elevator. Pretty standard room as far as size & furnishings go. The bathroom was Tight. We made it work, but compared to the room space, the bathroom was disproportionately small. Our room overlooked train tracks & a smaller side street without as much traffic. I actually requested a street view - I should have specified the street I wanted to view was 42nd! Nonetheless, the view was lovely & perhaps the most amazing & unexpected bonus was the breeze that came through. While in our room, aside from when sleeping, we left our hotel door open the entire time & the cross breeze was incredible. The occassional trains & little street traffic were welcome sounds that did not disturb - we enjoy the sounds of the city. The beds were like concrete - very hard, but that mattered none. Each night when we came in after a very long day of sightseeing, etc. we all slept like rocks (no pun intended). I typically wake in my own bed at least 1x per night. I never stirred in these beds. Housekeeping was fine & everything was clean. To be honest, I don't pay attention to many details while in NY. I love the city & that's why I'm there, so I'd be just as happy staying at a hostile or on a bench in the park. But, mom, brother, & husband preferred a hotel. We did eat at the Theater Row Diner. Very close by, quite lovely on the inside, a strong contrast to it's outside appearance. We also ate at the Broadway Diner next door - also very good. The hotel's location is good, pretty central to everything you'd want. A short walk & you're at Times Square - definitely on the way I recommend Pax Whole Foods (a chain deli w/ delicious sandwiches that you can also get uptown at 2 other locations) & Madame Tussaud.'s wax museum - very entertaining. If you plan on making repeated trips to the city, I recommend avoiding the tourist traps around the bus terminals & Times Square. Head to the upper west side where you will find The Buttercup Bake Shop on W.72nd just before Amsterdam. Or, head to the village to eat at The Magnolia Bakery. Both of these bakeries make the same basic cupcake (the 2 ladies used to be friends & when their cupcakes created instant mania & booming business, they fought & split up, thus there are now 2 different stores) which is the most delicious baked good you will ever put inside your mouth - get them - $1.98 each - terribly underpriced!!! Just know that you can only get a maximum of 12 per person/party at the Magnolia Bakery - so if you plan on getting lots - go to the one on 72nd. Upon checkout, which also took about 30 seconds, we were allowed to leave our car in the garage until 5pm at the latest. Overall it was a fantastic stay, no real complaints about the hotel other than the bathroom being tight. Although, I was impressed that toiletries were vegetable based, rather than animal based, something that is important to my husband & I. The early check-in, fantastic breeze, location, & late parking were what pleased us all the most about the Traveler Inn

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: roxydogTielt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 23 till 26 of August! It was our second stay in NYC, we stayed in NYC once in 2005 in a Hotel in the same price catagory. So upon our arrival we expected the hotel to be similar, but we could not be more wrong! Although we payed approx. the same price it was nothing comparred to our previous, I would even say this was a luxurious hotel, considered being in NY and paying a cheap price! the staff was friendly and the rooms were very spacious and clean! Also a big advantage was the noise, so close to all the action and barely no noise! In our first hotel we had no sleep for the 3 days we stayed there! I would recommend Travel Inn hotel to all the first timers going to the city that never sleeps!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for anything more.”
Reviews.Author: WFCCecil
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all of our expectations and more ( for the price). Yes, we have stayed in fancier hotels but we also paid much more. Our room was clean, the staff was excellent. The lady working in the boutique was very pleasant and helpful. As like most guest, we felt very safe walking back to the hotel in the evening. The deli next door was great as well as the grocery store one block away. We also had a vehicle and parked it in the garage for the week. I really don't know what people expect. If you want a 5 star hotel then you should stay at a five star hotel. Keep in mind, this is a budget hotel. To sum up our perspective of the hotel: Clean room, large room, fridge, microwave, pleasant staff ( lobby, chamber maids, boutique, maintenance staff), pool, deli next door, close to Times Square, supermarket one block away, secured parking(no extra charge), police station across the street. Yes, the walls are thin and having a room facing 42 street there is traffic noise, but hey this is New York after all! I know where we are staying the next visit back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great ! A better deal than I expect!”
Reviews.Author: MsMomScott
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at this hotel. There is a fridge and microwave in the room -- surprised to see NO coffee pot. Little restaurant next door with great food, great service. Police station across the street. Rooms clean, people friendly. Got an amazingly great deal! Enjoyed our stay very much. Wish we had made time to go to pool-- it looked fun. Was 2 long blocks from subway, but very close to other food places and a grocery. Probably a better deal than I'll ever find again. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: kellyg_20
Reviews.Content: 8 of us stayed here in June '07 and no one had any complaints! It was a great hotel, staff was fantastic and free parking, how can you go wrong?! The beds were clean, a little small and not so comfortable but who stays in their hotel room for too long in NYC?! The cleaning staff were very friendly and accomodating. It's about 10 min walk to Times Square and there are great little restuaurants down some of the strees to explore. I would encourage anyone who wants a deal and doesn't mind being a little out of Times Square to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: dannh78
Reviews.Content: My work arranged a short trip through our social club to travel to New York from 19t April - 23rd April. I was sharing with a male colleague who is a good friend although not my partner. On booking the trip we requested a twin room. On arrival at the hotel we checked in and was given our room key. This is where the nightmare begins! once at the room we noticed we had one double bed. I went down to reception on my way out to dinner to asked for my room to be moved. I was asked if i could "do them a favour" and stay where i was as they were very busy! i did explain i didn't want to sleep with my friend as he was male and not my partner but they didnt seem to work under the rule of "the customer is always right!". I went out to dinner and on my return i called from my room and insisted i was moved. The receptionist advised me to go and collect another key. When i got to reception i was advised how difficult my behaviour was and that i was making the their lives difficult as i had requested the incorrect room at the time of booking!!!!!!!!!! By this stage i was very tired and became quite upset. I was given another room and thought finally my awful day was over, but on arrival to the new room it seemed one of beds hadn't even had the sheets changed since the last guests used it. The sheets were crumpled and had pubic hair on them (very inviting.....not!) by this time i had just had enough so ended up sharing with my male colleague because the stress of dealing with the reception staff was just too much. My trip in general was fab and i loved New York as much as i always thought i would but the staff at the hotel put a dark cloud over my stay in such an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good deal”
Reviews.Author: ohjoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the Travel Inn and found it to be a good value. To be sure, it's not luxurious, but our room was fine for three people (two adults and a teenager.) We stayed in a room facing 42nd St, so there was some street noise. You might want to ask for one of the rooms that overlook the pool -- they seemed more peaceful. The location is pretty good -- three long blocks to Times Square and near the incredible collection of restaurants that line 9th Avenue from 42nd Street north for many blocks. Also, there's a nice little deli right next door and a grocery store a block or so away. Parking is free -- such a deal -- in the attached garage, but it's tight. We struggled to jam the car into a space. Of course, we never had to move it again, so that really wasn't a big problem. I'd stay at the Travel Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow-Loved it-Why the neg. posts-What do you expect its NEW YORK”
Reviews.Author: mckinney2
Reviews.Content: We, a family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids 19yoa and 12yoa) loved this hotel. As I read the reviews I cant figure out what people expect from a budget hotel in New York City. This was wife and mine third time to New York City and kids first. We needed a place that would fit four in two beds, most budget hotels only sleep two and the cost is way high (200/400$ nightly) This is a excellent budget hotel (we paid $150.00), the room was always clean and the maids went the extra mile by replenishing the soap, shampoo and conditioner daily they always spoke to us in the halls. The hotel lobby was always being cleaned, there was always a doorman or security in the lobby no matter what time we came in even if it was the parking garage security. Our 12 yo daughter was always going to get ice and â€œsee whoâ€™s at the poolâ€� she even went to the deli, we always felt safe. The pool was clean and an extra-added bonus in New York cause most hotels donâ€™t have them. The location could not be beat, on 42nd st a three block walk right (west) out the front door and youâ€™re at the river, where they have a nice marina, where several â€œgo fastâ€� and â€œtour boatsâ€� operate from, nice restaurants and outdoor concerts. Turn left out the front door (east) and itâ€™s a three-block walk to the bus station/subway. The next block over on 9th ave, a full grocery store. Next door to the hotel is a nice little WINE only store on the other side attached but not owned by the hotel is a Deli/Coffee shop opened for breakfast and lunch, no dinner. The up side is that itâ€™s a safe area the police station is right across the street and its only 4 blocks from Time Square. We took a train in from white plains to Grand Central ten walked the 9 looong blocks to the hotel, I would not suggest this unless your in good shape. Now down side- the front rooms that face 42nd are noisy, the walls are extremely thin all conversations can be heard, there are vents in the bathrooms that lead the bathroom in the room next door, I am not joking I could talk to the people in there just like they were standing next to me. Also there are only three temp settings on the air in the front rooms, high, low and off. We kept ours on high all the time for the â€œwhite noiseâ€� because of loud, obnoxious neighbors. â€“ A LITTLE SIDE NOTE â€“ travel off the tourist path, we took the subway every where or walked, I suggest that after you see time square once avoid it the rest of your trip. Go to Coney Island and Queens. My son and I walked the whole width of the city to the UN, while the ladies went to the pool. One block from the hotel we spotted a man talking on his cell phone, the voice sounded familiar then we noticed who it was, I tried to sneak a picture when he noticed us. He motioned us over, my first thought was that he was going to be angry and demand the film, but instead he stuck up a conversation with us and ASKED US could he take a picture with us. (Yes thatâ€™s Martin Sheen) So be observant, we also saw Robin Williams, Kelly Preston and her daughter making a movie in Central Park. Oh back to the hotel, every hotel has problems; donâ€™t let the negative comments from some posters keep you from trying this hotel. It fit us perfect. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of positives...”
Reviews.Author: jmpatrick63
Reviews.Content: We took a chance and chose the Travel Inn based mainly on 2 things: price and free parking. We lucked out as the whole experience was a good one. We were leary of driving in NYC, but getting in and out of this hotel couldn't have been much easier. From the Lincoln Tunnel, it's 2 left turns, 2 blocks and you're there. The parking lot attendant was very helpful in getting our van in to what can only be described as a very tight parking garage. But hey, free parking is free parking, and we weren't planning to do any driving while in town. Check-in was a breeze, the staff was "New York" courteous. Our room was high enough to not hear the traffic below, and the view was of the train tracks snaking under the building (my 3-year old son loves trains and ran to the window every time one passed). You could definitely hear the trains when they passed, but it was no where near what I would call too loud. The hotel's location was fine for us. We had 2 kids and the 10-minute walk to the Times Square area was fine. The Subway is right there, but I should mention that the closest station to The Travel Inn does not sell MetroCards. You will need to walk a little bit closer to Times Square. 2 extra minutes, no big deal. We felt safe walking the streets, even late in to the night. The streets were always fairly active. Our room was clean and well maintained. My wife was concerned when we first entered our room, as there was an open Coke bottle and a used soap in the otherwise clean bathroom. We checked in a bit early and I imagine we got a room that was quickly prepared by the cleaning staff. We never had a problem with the cleanliness of the room for the rest of our 3-night stay. The pool is half indoors and half outdoors. The water was a bit chilly, but the kids didn't mind too much. The pool was clean and towels were provided. The fitness room was tight. The room is rather small, and there's quite few pieces of equipment. However, the equipment worked fine, and the TV was appreciated. We loved the small diner right next to the lobby of the hotel. The food and service was excellent, and we ate there more than once. My only complaint is minor: the WiFi was $6.95 per day and you had to walk back to the lobby and get a new code every day. Codes were not distributed over the phone. These days, charging extra for WiFi is a bit greedy. We stayed at several hotels on this vacation, and most offered free WiFi. They don't charge for TV, why internet? I imagine a couple years down the road everyone will offer it for free. Bottom line: we would most definitely book The Travel Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again - price and location”
Reviews.Author: GoGators2
Reviews.Content: The location of this motor inn is near the theatre district and restaurant row, as well as the ferry lines and quite close to Times Square. We are used to staying in better hotels but wanted a reasonable stay with parking for just a couple of nights mid-week. The Travel Inn was $225 including parking while the better hotels were easily over $400-500 a night. The room was clean and simply decorated. The area seemed safe, next to police station and grocery store. Downsides on the location - cars exiting the police station across the street sometimes had sirens going (not constant but the intermittent start up kind) and perhaps the ugliest view of an old building and construction site you could imagine. The bed was short (6' husband and son had to sleep a little side-ways)and so hard it was like sleeping on stone covered with a mattress cover and sheet. Overall, we'd go back for short vacations where we want to economize on the hotel to splurge on shoppiong, shows and food.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at travel inn”
Reviews.Author: angelv88
Reviews.Content: we were in new york the first week of june. we stayed here at the travel inn . I picked the hotel because it had parking the garage was great and it had a security guard. the rooms were great it was very clean. the beds were very comfortable. and it is only 3 blocks from times square. we were out till midnight and I felt very safe walking back to the hotel. I would definately recommend this hotel. for the price with parking it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the price”
Reviews.Author: beav
Reviews.Content: There was something about June 6th that made it impossible to find a room in NYC for under $500. Or how about $700? Or maybe $1,000?? I consider myself fairly adept at finding good room prices, even in NY, but this one pushed me to the limit! I finally decided to book with the Travel Inn, even though it seemed iffy. At $250 plus taxes, it was the best deal out there. The fact that other Trip Advisor members said it was clean helped me decide to give it a try. While it's not your typical mid-town, large lobby NY hotel, it is perfectly serviceable. The Travel Inn is part of a chain of budget-minded hotels in NY called the Empire Group. You can go more or less expensive with them. The room was large and clean, the shower had plenty of hot water and good pressure, and the bath products were actually qutie nice, called Essential Elements, from a company in Australia. We were lucky and got an inside room (off the street, pool view) - my husband said he'd never had a quieter hotel in NY. Free parking (yes, FREE) and a good front desk manager - what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “I agree with the poster below”
Reviews.Author: New-To-This-Forum
Reviews.Content: Following on from the review below, we stayed there for 4 nights in February 07. I agree with a number of the posters comments. What struck me to write though was the taxi back to JFK. The same thing happened to us. Except we got stung for $70. I really dont know what is going on between the reception staff and the cab company. But it left a bitter taste to a fantastic holiday. We are returning in Feb 08, but not to the Travel Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: BonnieMax
Reviews.Content: We sayed here for 4 nights in May 2007. The hotel is located 5 minutes walk to the bus station where the buses to Newark Airport leave and arrive at, 5 minutes walk to the subway, 5 minute walk to the pier to catch a ferry and a 10 minute walk to Times Square The font desk staff were fine and helpfull. The room was large, clean and out dated. The beds seemed small maybe only doubles. The pool had no water in it but it was far too cold to swim. We paid about US $300 a night so I don't think it was that cheap, but I am sure I could have got it cheaper on the net instead of my travel agent. The location was great and I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Dawn100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with friends for 5 nights in December 2006. The room was spacious and clean. We were fortunate to have a room overlooking the pool, these rooms are quiet and removed from the sounds of 42nd street. The hotel is in a wonderful location less then 10 minutes walk away from Times Square, and 5 minutes from the nearest subway station (take a subway map as routes are poorly marked). We had breakfast at the Diner next door to the hotel, and as I was on holiday I was able to order the banana pancakes without the usual guilt. We also enjoyed some meals at the Theatre Row Diner conveniently located close to the hotel (across the road and left). For a drink head to the Lansdowne Road (from the hotel - left down 10th Avenue between 43rd and 44th Streets), a friendly pub, with fabulous staff, only minutes from the hotel. Enjoy your trip to New York. Though I think it will be difficult not to.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...Overpriced like all NYC hotels”
Reviews.Author: ywtchr
Reviews.Content: I think that the location is great...about 3 LONG blocks to Times Square...no business center if you need to use internet for more than 5 minutes. there's a bus that stops right in front on 42nd and on 10th....that was great. Rooms were decent...2 beds, fridge, table, tv, small, but decent bathroom, but what ruined it was the last night when I saw a huge roach go from behind the fridge to tv area! That clinched it.... So, provided that they do some major extermination this year, i recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the Price”
Reviews.Author: ronanna
Reviews.Content: Our family of four drove up to NYC from Florida in Summer of 2005. We chose this hotel due to reviews like the one I am writing now. NYC can be a very expensive trip but Travel Inn made it far more affordable than we could have expected. The FREE PARKING is definately a major plus for this hotel. We pulled into Manhatten at 10 pm, the garage door was open and there was a parking spot right there in front by the side entrance door. We parked and never drove again using the city transportation and walking the whole trip. Our vehicle was right there and we were able to see it every day as we went in and out. The staff was very nice and the room was clean and basic. Nothing special, but we only slept in it and as long as it was clean and roomy enough, it met our needs. The location was very convenient and within walking distance to Times Square and the Hudson where we took one of the night time cruises (just BEAUTIFUL). When we go back to NYC Travel Inn will be home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base Hotel near the Action of Times Sq.”
Reviews.Author: Buff_G
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in December last year. This was our 1st trip to NYC and we loved it. The hotel was nice and clean and the beds made for us every day. The reception staff had reasonable local knowledge and we ate at the Theatre Row Diner every morning for Breakfast which is just across the road. My boyfriend and I walked almost everywhere from this hotel, it took us about 10 minutes to get to the heart of times sqaure, 15 minutes to get to the Minskoff Theatre (where the Lion King was showing), 30 minutes to 5th Avenue and 25 minutes to Macy's. (we do walk quite fast however!). We also ate at a little Chinese take away which is down the side of the hotel and serves good food at reasonable prices. Also there is a great CVS Pharmacy right across the road that seemed to be open at all hours and has everything from drink, food, make-up, magaznes and medical supplies. I would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to NY”
Reviews.Author: fpg
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 days at The Holiday Inn New York. Like others we wanted a reasonable hotel near Time Square - this was ideal. The people were agreeable but not intrusive. We had a double double room for 3 people - this was plenty big enough. We were disappointed that there was no drink making facility in the rooom but soon learned to get them from the diner joined to the hotel. Time Square is only a matter of minutes away and the short walk feels totally safe at night. The walk is ideal after a meal. Our stay was really good all round - apart from a long wait at the Empire State Building. Go very early even if you have bought tickets online etc. The main feature of the Travel Inn is its great value - which releases more money for shops and sights etc

Reviews.Title: “Great place to see New York”
Reviews.Author: lrich255
Reviews.Content: Wanted a hotel that was safe, clean and somewhat near Times Square. This place fit the bill perfectly. About 6 blocks from TS and across the street from a police substation, the walk was great and we felt safe even at night. The room was clean and plenty large enough for our family of 4. Nothing fancy but perfect as a base to venture out and explore. The FREE parking, unheard of in NYC, is quite a plus. The property let us check out and leave our car there for the day while we did our last day sightseeing. Staff was polite. I will definitely stay here on the next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: glorydays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travel Inn for 5 nights in late March, 2007. This was our first trip to NYC, so we really wanted to be downtown close to the action. We chose this hotel based on the good reviews at TripAdvisor and the cost compared to other NY hotels. The location is excellent and within an easy walk to Times Square and most Broadway shows. There are several good restaurants nearby. The Theater Row restaurant a block away was really good, and the hotel gives guests free drink coupons good for a soda or glass of wine. We ate breakfast at the little deli next door. The food and service were excellent, and the prices were very reasonable. The hotel itself was clean and well-kept. We saw people cleaning in the elevators and hallways every day. One guy was even wiping down the ledges in the parking garage. The lobby is small but comfortable and the little shop was well-stocked. The shop could have had longer hours, however. A computer with Internet service is available in the lobby for $1 per 5 minutes. They also offer wireless access in the rooms for $6 per 24 hours. Our room was clean and had a small refrigerator and microwave. The beds were very hard and the pillows were small. We were so tired each night that we didn't even notice though, and we did ask for extra pillows which were delivered within ten minutes. We didn't notice any traffic noise since we had asked for an inside room. The walls are somewhat thin though, so we did hear the elevators and people in the hallways. My only complaints about the room were that the bathroom was very tiny with little room for shampoo, brushes, etc. and that the toilets flushed loudly. The hotel staff was efficient and professional. They were not overly friendly, but were helpful whenever we needed advice or directions. We will definitely stay at this hotel again if we get to go back to NYC, and I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great.”
Reviews.Author: matqcca
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and the room was clean. Nothing special in room decoration. Our units has a refrigerator and a microwave. The hotel is very well located. It is a short walk from Times Square (10 minutes). It isn't too much further to the Empire State building (we walked). You've also got the subway station and the Bus Port 3 blocks away. I recommand it.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: biffsontour
Reviews.Content: Travel Inn, New York city. Feb 2007 What a fantastic place, cant wait to go back next year. Travel inn is clean and ideally located. Only down fall is no tea and coffe facilities in the rooms. Had to wait until we got to the diner before we had a cuppa. Would highly recommend the Theatre Diner located 1 block from hotel. Excellent place to visit loved everything about New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget option”
Reviews.Author: GirlAb0utT0wn
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent little hotel for travellers on a budget. It's about a 10-minute walk to Time Square and the subway station, from which every conceivable tourist attraction is easily accessible. The hotel itself, though located in a slightly less salubrious part of town, was perfect for our girly weekend in New York. The police station opposite made us feel very safe, even when returning late at night. Our room, which overlooked the swiming pool, was clean, comfortable and perfectly adequate. The bathroom was a little small and could have done with slightly better lighting (for your make-up!), but I cannot fault this hotel at all. We were looking for somewhere that was centrally located, inexpensive, but clean and comfortable, and the Travel Inn fitted the bill. Top tips: We fell in love with the Theatre Diner just across the street. Perfect perfect perfect, and reason enough to stay at this hotel. Fly into Newark rather than JFK -- it's nearer the hotel and you won't get stuck in traffic trying to fight your way across the city.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted!!”
Reviews.Author: JD1177
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Travel Inn Hotel, Feb. 21-23. After finalizing our decision to stay there based on reading some of the reviews on here, I felt I should offer my positive experience as well, to help other future travellers make a decision. My girlfriend and I were making our first trip to NYC so I did a lot of homework comparing hotels/location/prices online before we chose the Travel Inn. Our criteria for selecting it was based on location, reasonable price, and it included free parking (which was in the building and was a big help in comparison to third-party parking garages that charge at least $30 per 24 hrs, which most of the other hotels in that area of the city use.) We were pleasantly surprised!! If you want to be close (within 10 mins walking) to Times Square and the Theatre / Restaurant district, and want a price that is a fraction of many of the others in that area, this is the place for you. Even if you want to take a cab to other parts of the city, being in Midtown Manhattan means you're in the middle of it all, so it's a good central location to start from. We drove from Maine and being first-timers to the city we weren't sure how easy it would be to drive to the hotel and exit the city when we left. It could not have been easier!!! To get to the Travel Inn from the north is simple, since you can bypass all of busy streets in the middle of the city, all you have to do is drive down the west side (Henry Hudson Pkwy) and make a left on 42nd street and you're there!! To leave it was just as simple since it was just a reverse of that. When you get there, just find a place to park on 42nd street while you check in, then drive into the parkade. Our room location was great (7th floor) with a perfect view of the Empire State Building. In that part of the hotel you just have to go up in the elevator to the 3rd floor, walk down the hall to the other set of elevators and continue up the rest of the levels to get to your floor (if you're on a floor higher than 3). To get to our room we just had to walk down a covered outside balcony which kind of reminded me of a Motel rather than a Hotel, but it was still great! Our room was a double (2-double beds), which were a bit on the firm side, but we weren't there to do much sleeping anyway. We didn't have a remote for the TV in our room for some reason, but when I called the front desk they were very helpful and said he would get me one within 5 minutes and sure enough they brought it to our room in 5 minutes. The heater was controllable and pumped out a lot of heat quickly, but you could shut if off if you wanted, which was good. The only thing that could have been better was the water temperature in our shower. It kind of had a mind of it's own, a few seconds it would be very hot, then it would get very cold, and keep alternating like that. We just had to try to adjust the faucet a bit while showering, but not big deal it still did what we needed it to do. We had a laptop and wanted to access the internet to check on some things about the city while we were there, so to get connected to wireless, all you have to do is call the front desk and ask for it and they will give you an access code that is good for 24 hrs (which we got twice since we were there for 48 hrs). It only costs $6.50 for 24 hrs, so well worth it if you want it. The lobby of the hotel has a section with many brochures and pamphlets about everything to do with the city that may come in handy if you're looking for something in particular. Check out is 12:00, but the front desk attendant told me if you want a late check out you can ask for a 1:00 check out instead. If the reason you want a late check-out is because you want to go somewhere and leave your vehicle in their parkade it's not even a problem and you don't even have to tell them. He told me we could leave it there even a few hours after check-out if we wanted, no questions asked, which is a big help if you have things you want to do before you want to leave the city. There are plenty of good places to eat very close by, so I won't even begin to list them, but I will say that we had some excellent Asian food from Ollie's, which is just one block from the Travel Inn towards Times Square on West 42nd street. We plan on going to NYC again in a few months to do and see some more of the things we didn't get to do this time and we will definitely be staying at the Travel Inn Hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: RylandsFolk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great - we booked it after looking at reviews on trip advisor. We stayed for 3 nights and the room was smart and clean throughout. The reception staff were OK and we made use of the safebox facility they had. We drove into New York and I would espcially recommend this hotel to drivers as they have a well sized secure car park. Also, when we drove into New York (through the Lincoln tunnel), we came out the other side and it was only two blocks to the hotel - very convenient. The hotel is very well located as it is a short walk from Times Square and theatre district (10 mins) and it isn't too much further to the Empire State building. You've also got the subway station nearby along with plenty of places to eat - I can recommend the breakfasts at McDonalds! All in all a great place - can thoroughly recommend it and will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for First Timers”
Reviews.Author: alm20
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 5 day trip to NYC. We booked with TravelScope which were absolutely superb. We were originally set to be staying in the SkyLine Hotel up on 47th but due to refurbishment were placed in the Travel Inn Hotel on 42nd instead. The hotel was clean and quiet and the staff were reasonable and polite. We stayed in a large room with 2 double beds, which had ample storage space and a clean shower/bathroom. Unfortunately the room was on the back and overlooked the railway line which ran under the hotel itself, but to be honest we were not there to sit and look out the window all day so this wasn't a big concern. The main selling point about this hotel is the location. It's only about 10 minutes from Times Square and only another 10 more minutes or so to the other big "attractions" like ESB, Rockefella Plaza, 5th Avanue and much more. If you are happy to walk everywhere, as we were, it's just perfect. It took approximately 90 minutes (with a brief coffee stop) to walk from Battery Park back up to Midtown, so you can really walk anywhere on Manhattan if your legs are up to it. This is a budget hotel though so don't expect loads of facilities. The one thing it really did miss was a bar for a late night drink before bed, but for the room sizes, price and perfect location it's spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag at The Travel Inn New York”
Reviews.Author: stug97
Reviews.Content: Hmmm!... It was quite expensive in line with all other New York hotels. The room was very, very noisy, with the lifts wirring away next door and the open "motel" style corridors outside. This of course lets in all the noise from traffic/outside too!. The toilet was blocked and the telephone didnt work when we first checked in, to which we were told "we will get it sorted, but we wont give you a better room" - jeez, I hadnt asked for one! It was sorted within the hour. We could see from our bathroom, thru an airvent into next doors! (if you so chose!). The walls were very thin, we could hear all conversations and dunken bed banging!!. Oooo Yuck! But, but!,.....You are staying on THE 42nd Street! Its location is superb - 10minutes walk to Times Square, Subway Stn, Port Authority Bus Stn, 5th Ave, Helicopter tours etc!!. Cant beat it for that. But no, never again, sorry!.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - what more could you ask for??”
Reviews.Author: id2020
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend on a surprise trip to New York for her birthday, from the UK. I was quite worried about booking hotels on a budget - with only descriptions on Expedia to go on. Luckily however I found TripAdvisor.com and based on the reviews here I picked this hotel. What an excellent choice! As we walked into the hotel after 8 hours of travelling we were greeted by very friendly reception staff who checked us in with the minimum of fuss. The standard double room I'd paid for, ridiculously cheap compared to all the other hotels I'd looked at that were even vaguely near Manhatten, turned out to contain two double beds and was HUGE. The bathroom too was very spacious, with a piping hot and powerful shower which compensated well for the subzero temperatures and icy winds in New York at that time of year! The room was always kept very clean, and the reception staff were friendly throughout, even when we New York newbies asked them to explain to us how the subway system worked. Fine, our room looked onto a police station, but so what? We'd come to see New York, not live in the hotel, so great amenities were all we wanted. Anyway, the Empire State Building still looked wonderful, lit up at night. You wouldn't see that if you got a much more expensive room in a high buildings area. And location-wise too there was nothing to complain about. Right next to Times Square and the theatres, and no time on the subway or taxi to downtown Manhatten. And at a fraction of the price of the glitzy Times Square hotels. Amazing, since the only other hotels I could find for vaguely similar prices were miles out of the city. We had such a wonderful time there. The next time we go to New York, I know exactly where we'll be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Times Sq.”
Reviews.Author: JoeBananasBoston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed overnight from 1-14 to 1-15. The room was very clean and a pretty good size. It was a close walk to Times Square. Take the double decker loop bus, 49.00 for a 48 hour on and off pass. You can go all over Manhattan and Brooklyn for short money. One regret not enough time to see everything. Only bad thing the beds were hard as a rock, but after walking around all day, it didnt really matter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect NYC base”
Reviews.Author: BrumBeachLover
Reviews.Content: The Travel Inn is a perfect base for seeing Manhattan. My husband and I stayed here on the final night of our honeymoon in July 2006. We love New York and wanted somewhere central. We also wanted somewhere that was easy to get to from the Newark airport bus stops - knowing we would have heavy bags from our two week trip to Hawaii. When I found the Travel Inn, it seemed to good to be true. I thought a swimming pool was a great addition - not normally something i would look for in New York, but again, coming at the end of our Hawaii trip, thought it might be nice to get a last dip before heading home to Engalnd. Also, I knew we would be looking to chill out after the long flight so thought we might use the pool a fair amount. The hotel itself is lovely. Clean and spacious, the rooms are not the most contemporary looking, but the furnishings all seem new and it's clean, so we didn't mind. The neighbourhood is a little off the beaten track for tourists, being over on the west side of 42nd street. I wondered about the safety before we went, but as we'd never felt unsafe in NYC before, decided to give it a go. WE need not have worried. We wandered to and from Times Square after dark with no problems as well as walking around the neighbourhood itself. It is the perfcet location for that airport bus as it's about a three minute walk to Port Authority. It's also very close to Times Square and its subway - perfect for exploring the city or eating out. The only negative we had was getting a cab back from 5th avenue after a heavy afternoon shopping. It wasn't a major deal, it's easy to walk from the subway, but we had lots of shopping, so could have done with a cab. That pool - the pool is a great area. It is like being somehwre else. The hotel surrounds the pool, which is half covered and half open, and you wouldn't know you were in NYC. We enjoyed sitting by it with a beer bought from the store next door and reminiscing about our fabulous honeymoon. If it's your first time to NYC then this hotel probably isn't for you as it's not exactly tourist central. But if, like us, you are regular visitors looking for an affordable, good quality base, with the added extras, it's a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, good price, and good for a family”
Reviews.Author: sparkle7778
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Jan 4-7, 2007. There were four of us--2 adults and two children. We wanted something near Times Square that was reasonably priced and would sleep all four of us in the same room. Travel Inn fit that bill. The room was a normal hotel size which fit two double beds, a desk, nightstand, tv/dresser, floor lamp, and extra chair. It was warm out and we didn't need heat. It wasn't quite warm enough for air conditioning. We just opened the window. The hotel is across from the police station and we heard some sirens. I think you could hear sirens anywhere in New York. We didn't hear them very often and we didn't hear them while we slept, even with the window open. None of us are light sleepers. The hotel is about 2 blocks (the long blocks) from the Port Authority terminal. There is a bus station in the terminal, as well as an entrance to the subway. There are thousands of normal, everyday people who walk by this building daily and access the subway from here. There might be some unsavory people included in the mix, but New York is a large city and this is to be expected. The closest Subway stop is the Times Square stop. Although you can enter the Subway at the Port Authority building, you are walking through the Subway tunnels underground until you get to the Times Square stop. We used the Subways to get everywhere. We had no problems checking in or out. There was no wait for either. Everything in our room worked fine. There were clean towels, sheets, etc daily. This hotel acted as a comfortable base for our travels. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fit the Bill”
Reviews.Author: janetti
Reviews.Content: We planned a last minute trip with our family of four (sons 22, 19) and my sister's family after New Year's. A tip from a friend about the reasonable rates, clean rooms, good location and FREE parking led us to this hotel traveling from Virginia. It was all those things. My husband is very fastidious about clean rooms and had no complaints about that. These are basic rooms with everything you need. Our bathroom was very tight however, with no fan which can be helpful in drowning out noise. There was an extra bathroom on the hall which was helpful. We had a room with a pool view and it was nice and quiet. We found the desk staff pleasant and helpful. They even allow you to park there til 5:00 pm after you check out - a bonus if you are trying to get in a few last activities before leaving. The deli next door was great for morning coffee and breakfast and inexpensive. If I was staying longer than 2-3 nights with 4 in a room, I would need something larger but for a short stay, it fit the bill.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: The Twin Cities of Minneapolis and St. Paul Minnesota
Reviews.Title: “You can't beat this place for a budget family trip to Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: ASD392
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and two kids (14 and 11) to NYC to see a couple shows and experience Manhattan for the first time. Since we were staying five nights, a $500-$600 per night room at a typical chain hotel was out of the question. This place was great. Clean room with plenty of space for four people (that's tough to find in midtown). It was an easy walk to Times Square, all the Theatres, restaurant row etc. The neighborhood seemed plenty safe. We walked back from the theatres well after midnight, stopping at the Europan Bakery on 8th for a late dessert. It's a great neigborhood. Everything from cheap deli's and pizza by the slice places to high end gourmet type places within a couple of blocks. This isn't a resort hotel, if you are looking to spend 75% of your time in the hotel at the pool, go to Scottsdale. If you are looking for a clean, affordable, centrally located place to sleep while you are in Manhattan - you can't beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great For The Price!”
Reviews.Author: LouLou69
Reviews.Content: I really can't believe the negativity in some reviews towards this hotel. The price was great, the location was super convinient, it was clean, the water was super hot and the maid service was superb - friendly and secure. The location was great near some decent diners and pubs (Lansdowne Road) and not far from Times Square. We always felt safe even walking alone after dark. We did have a pool room but you come to expect noise in a city anyway Overall no problems - the decor maybe wasn't the most fashionable but I didn't go to New York to stay in and look at bedcovers!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for moeny, very friendly would reccomend !!”
Reviews.Author: lelsbud
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel a year in advance and down to the last minute i was still wanting to stay in a posh hotel as we were staying for 7 nights and concerned about noise etc, but when we arrived, the hotel staff were extremely friendly they gave us a double room over looking the pool which was really big and vocuhers for free wine at the theatre diner and there is a lift so you dont have to struggle with your bag and satelite tv, very warm shower and a large bathroom. The shop inside was also helpful when we bought a map from there. just to the right of the balconys was the empire state building, infact my boyfriend proposed on the balcony over looking this so a fantastic holiday was had by all. The rooms were like a motel inside very clean but needed jazing up a bit .we went Christmas shopping and valuable stuff was left in the room and the maid didnt touch anything once, it was quiet and it was very close to times square, theatres and 42nd street. perfect location. we ate in the theatre diner would reccomend, hard rock cafe and staqdust diner on times square. fantastic !! would definitely go back and stay i miss it already ! dont be concerend at all, but do take down the address as the taxi driver didnt know where he was going, by just pointing on a map. a tip buy a city pass as it is the same price for 2 site seeing tickets for empire state building and gugenheim and you get lots other attractions to go to, also dont go to ellis iland on a saturday as you queue for hours...

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: jayirwin
Reviews.Content: This is the right hotel for you if you like your accommodations on the more generic, bland side. That said, the room I stayed in was very clean and comfortable, with a great bed, and updated bathroom. The only complaint I had was a slight cigarette oder. The hotel is located very close to the action on 42nd street, but also on the bus and truck route from the Lincoln tunnel. If your room is on the street side expect more than normal noise (earplugs are recommended). The front desk help was very pleasant. There's parking (how unusual in New York!) and a handy concessions store in the lobby, which could have been open a little later. But there's a CVS on the corner that's really handy. Overall, I had a very pleasant stay at the Travel Inn and would definitely book there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great deal”
Reviews.Author: lanasmom
Reviews.Content: I will start that I had a certain amount of money I wanted to spend and still be in Manhatten in a decent hotel. I was a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews but as soon as I saw the room I was relieved. At $300.00 a night plus tax at this time of year it was a bargain. The room and bath were very clean and not cramped at all. The wireless internet is $7.00 per 24 hours. We had plenty of hot water and water pressure. There is a menu in the room from a very nice deli just a 1/2 block away that will deliver to your room. We were extremely pleased with our hot meals that were delivered quickly. We were in the nonsmoking section facing the pool which I felt was safe. It is definately an international crowd that stays here, I heard quite a few British accents. The only problem I had was that I had an issue with the wireless internet in the evening and the front desk man was less than helpful and it appeared he was annoyed that I was bothering him. Other that that we were happy. We generally stay in 5 star hotels but at this time of year in NY they are bordering on ridiculous $$$$$ $600 and up per night is just too much!! Stay here and take use the money for shopping, We did.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: NancyG13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the Barbra Streisand concert. We had already spent a lot of money on the tickets, and needed an affordable clean hotel. This definitely fit the bill. We had a room facing the back, off the pool. No street noise etc. I have stayed at three different hotels in NYC, and this was just as good as hotels I paid $200 more for a night. It was clean, comfortable and safe, which is very important for two women, or families with children. The restaurant that is attached is a good price, and the food was not bad. Go to the Theater Row Diner just up the block. Great food at great prices. I would definitely stay there again. I didn't use the free parking, but the lot looked well lit and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Relieved”
Reviews.Author: brainylanie
Reviews.Content: Let me say first, that I was sooooo afraid to stay here, even with all the good reviews, because I know NYC pretty well, and I was very afraid of the location and not very impressed with the pics. However, the price was right for what seemed to be a very expensive week to get a room in the city. My 13 yr. old and I stayed there for one night on Nov. 14. We drove to the hotel and found getting there extremely accessible. Drove right into the garage/check-in area and after self free parking, breezed through check in to go check out the room. VERY clean. No thrills at all, and I mean at all, but clean clean clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. The bad sides are the noise level between rooms, the noise from the street (if you are unlucky enough to get a room that faces it), and the location. It is close enough to walk to most things, but if you come back after 10:00 or so, be careful. Even though its across from a police station, the area becomes very desolate later at night, and it made me quite nervous w/my child to walk past groups of questionable men staring us down. Just take a short cab ride at night. Having said all that --- For the very cheap rates that they offer, combined with free parking, it certainly wasn't a bad experience. On a strict budget?? Go for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Trip to the Travel Inn”
Reviews.Author: ccrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travel Inn as we were in New York for the marathon. Its location is excellent, handy for Times Square, bus station etc. There are loads of good restaurants and diners within a short walk of the Hotel. The rooms were spotlessly clean and comfortable, with loads of hot water! The staff were extremely helpful and the reception area had some comfy sofas as well as a small shop. We really enjoyed our stay and would return there again on future visits

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, great location really bad front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: SarahKarcher
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 1:45 to an empty lobby and desk clerk on a personal phone call and we were told "check in is at 2 you can sit and wait". The lobby and rooms were actually very nice, the location was good and we never felt unsafe. There is a diner just outside the hotel that is great good food and reasonable price. All requests for directions etc were met at the front desk with rude remarks. For example we asked for a cab to a Broadway show one night and were told to just go outside and flag one down. We are going back to NYC this summer and would love the pool, but not staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Reasonable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlieWhite
Reviews.Content: After a crazy number of hours trying to find a hotel in New York on the net we selected this one because of it's price and reasonable trip advisor rating. We found the best price by booking directly with the hotel. The hotel itself is perfectly acceptable but in any other city it would be about half the price but that's New York. The rooms are a good size and clean. All the facilites were working and the fridge was a bonus. We had a room facing the pool so didn't get any street noise. The sound proofing of the rooms is far from ideal and we could hear conversations/ arguments in all surrounding rooms. We were so tired from sight seeing it didn't really make an impact on our sleep though. The area is OK and we felt safe walking back to the hotel at night. It is very easy to hail a cab from the street but it is only a short walk to the subway stations. They have a secure room for luggage if you have a late flight back which is good. Staff were professional and efficient if not overly friendly. Scored it above average because it exceeded our expectations. Would definately stay there again. Missed out on excellent because of the room noise.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Meano
Reviews.Content: We only stopped here 1 night in a two double bed room which cost Â£120.00. I thought it was a great price as for in comparison to other hotels. Has great location and free parking, we parked @ 10am and checked in later that day. We asked if we could leave our car later that day and they kindly let us stay till 3pm - everyone knows how expensive it is to park in NY!. If im ever back in the big apple i will surely consider this again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME!”
Reviews.Author: HARRYPAULG
Reviews.Content: We had a great time! The free parking, check-in, room etc. The location was great. The room was facing the pool. 417 We have been to new york numerous times and we have stayed in 4 star hotels that were not as nice. Even the refrigerator and microwave not even mentioned. We will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: whatthe111111
Reviews.Content: As mentioned great location 5-10 minute walk from Time Square and close to the subway. The rooms were very clean and adequate for our needs. However I did find it very noisey staying across from the police station - but safe!! The cafe next door was very ordinary - give it a miss. There is a great restaurant around the corner on 10th Ave called Mr Biggs, happy hour with half price drinks between 5-7pm the meals are huge. Found the staff on the front desk to be polite, answered questions but offered not much more. Next time in New York would stay here again due to the location, price and the clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and basic services”
Reviews.Author: lutefisk
Reviews.Content: This is a good value for the middle class traveler. Stayed there four nigthts in October of 2006 and found the place to be clean and comfortable. The location is excellent, three blocks from Times Square. The little breakfast joint next to the hotel was great. Ate there each morning and read the paper. I'll stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: mrsall
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I and two teenage sons) stayed here for 8 nights in October. The hotel suited us perfectly. It was clean and comfortable and despite what other people have said the staff were very helpful and we were given extra towels and pillows on request. Our room looked out over the pool so it was relatively quiet considering its great location. The best thing about the hotel for us was the location as the hotel is 5 minutes from Times Square. There is a diner next to the hotel which is OK but the hotel recommends the Theatre Row diner which is one block away and this is very good and cheap (for us Brits anyway!). There is no shortage of restaurants nearby. I can only presume the bad reviews for this hotel are from people who expected 5 star luxury at 3 star prices! I would recommend this hotel to people ike us who go to New York to explore rather than to sit in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this hotel for value”
Reviews.Author: ripper677
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on 42nd St and it's a five minute walk to Times Square. Crosstown bus stops in front of hotel. Subway is a couple of blocks away and hotel is across the street from the Police Department if that makes you feel safer. The hotel is clean, the staff is helpful and friendly, the rooms are large by NYC standards and they have their own parking which is included in price. This is the best value for your dollar in NYC this close to Times Square. There are $500-600 hotels if you prefer. Personally, the money I save is better spent partying in this great old 'Hell's Kitchen' neighborhood. Who wants to sit in a room when in NYC. Staying here gives you a good room for a good price and leaves $100 to $400 a day in your pocket to enjoy. That saved money buys a lot of food and drinks; even at NYC prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: YHosty
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Husband stayed at this Hotel for our Honeymoon in New York.It is in an excellent location - on 42nd street and 10th Avenue.The hotel is very clean with maid service everyday.The rooms are a good size and the beds big and comfortable.We found the staff very helpfull and there was no charge for our safety deposit box,which most hotels charge for.Also when I told the staff that the hairdryer in our room was'nt working it was replaced immediately. The NYPD station is just across the road from this hotel so at night it can get noisy with the police heading out on there runs around Manhattan.There is a very good diner up the road from this Hotel called the Threatre Row Diner which is great for breakfast every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect on a budget”
Reviews.Author: LizzyO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and we were really happy because we weren't sure what to expect on our budget. I really struggled to find a hotel within our price range and was delighted when i found this one. Good things about hotel were price, spotlessly clean room and bathroom, good shower and very comfortable beds. The location is also good - it is on the west side of the city, which isn't quite as nice as the East side, but still fine. The hotel is a short walk from Times Square. There is a deli right next door to the hotel that did a good breakfast and then nice food throughout the day. The only small gripe i have is that there were no tea making facilities in the room - a bit of a pain when you like your cup of tea. However, if you are thinking of staying at this hotel and you like a hot drink, just buy a small travel kettle. Really recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: gentah
Reviews.Content: We have taken 5 or 6 trips to NYC over the last 15 years, and always stay at this hotel. Considering the price, it is a gem. The rooms are not fancy, however, they are a decent size and they are neat and clean. Parking is FREE and there is a swimming pool (outdoor)--2 things that are not common in any Manhattan hotel at any price. The hotel is located very conveniently when driving into Manhattan by the Lincoln Tunnel, you will come out right at 42nd St near the hotel. Just turn left at the light and turn right into the parking lot. Once you get there, you will also find that you are conveniently located in the city as well. It is a few blocks to Times Square. You are in walking distance of many theaters. The convention center is just a few blocks. A bus stop is on the corner and the subway isn't far. There is a little restaurant on the corner that has decent "diner" type food. You are right across the street from the bus station, and there are questionable characters sometimes hang out there, however, there is also a police sub station right there, so we have always felt safe coming and going at any time.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay here”
Reviews.Author: jhein
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 1 year ago and when I decided to travel to Manhatten this year, I booked the Travel Inn again. You get everything what you need: A big and clean room and a bathroom at a good location. For New York the price is fair. Last year I had an room to the street, which was quite loud, because there is a police station directly on the other side an you can here some sirens during the night. This year I got a room at the back facing the pool and it was very quite. The area and the hotel is very safe and I can not understand what other reviewers said about safety. I definitly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We thought this hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: hec286
Reviews.Content: We booked online direct with the hotel and got an excellent rate compared to everything else availible at the time we were there. The location is fine, just 4 blocks from Times Square. We felt very safe compared to e.g. San Francisco where we stayed last year. The rooms are standard motel type rooms but clean and the bathroom was fine...clean, and everything worked. I called ahead and ensured a non smoking room, the person I talked to at that time was a little abrupt, but all the rest of the staff were really nice, especially the gift shop ladies who had great advice on trips and subway routes. You do not enter this hotel through a garage, unless you want to, there is a front door, I do not know how you can get the impression that the only entrance was through the garage! No restaurant, but we ate each morning at the "theatre diner" a block up the street, (as advised here). If you go one block over on 43 and 8,9,10 there are plenty of great restaurants for dining. The grocery store one block up (food emporium) was great to have close by too. When I called the hotel to ask about transport from the airport, they advised taxi. We took the shuttle, be advised this was fine, cheap but because the hotel is over ar 42+ 11, you tend to get dropped off last, so we were in the van for over an hour

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: skittles_2203
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives you exactly what you are looking for in NYC. Location is 10 minute walk to Times Square, easy access from when you drive in, secure garage with parking included in the price, clean clean rooms (big too), however the bathroom is small, and very safe. We had room 431 which had 2 double beds and were erally surprised at the clealiness. We paid total 792$ US for 3 nights, (for 4 people) which is a great deal for NYC. Check in took about 2 minutes, and yes the staff arent the friendliest, but anything we asked for (extra towels) were sent up within minutes. Upon check out, we were charged exactly what we were quoted on the Internet and it took all of 2 minutes. I couldnt think of a better location to see all the sights. The hotel definitely isnt the Hilton, but then again neither is the price. Dont hesitate to book here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money !”
Reviews.Author: Alex_and_family
Reviews.Content: I had to come in NYC in September 2006 and I was late to make a reservation. Given my budget the Travel Inn was the only choice with available room and not to far from the office. I must say this hotel was a pretty good surprise. The location is excellent, close to time square or Grand Central. The room was big and clean, nothing to say. There is an iron which is important for a business traveller. There was however a strong smell of cigarette despite the fact it was a non smoking floor. I did not have time to try the swimming pool but the pool area is very nice. The staff member is helpful but not really friendly. Last thing: there's no restaurant at the hotel, but you'll find everything at walking distance anyway. To summarize: good choice, not expensive, big and clean room. Unfortunately I had to extend my stay and I had to move to an other hotel because the travel inn was fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...Awesome Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: tspencer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel from Sept 23-28, the Hotel is located in a good location. The price was fairly resonable considering you're on 42nd street. The subway to get to all the different attractions is 2 blocks away. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. When I got to the hotel I left my folder in the cab which had my copies of my reservations to the different attractions I already booked, my airlines info, and my passport. The guys in the front was so kind to help me. In fact they allowed me to use there computer and there printer to re-print all my information from my email. They were wonderful. We stayed in two different rooms, one on the 6th floor and one on the 3rd floor. The 3rd floor rooms seemed bigger. Try to request for those rooms if available. Anyways it was a good hotel and will stay there again. Don't worry it is in a safe location. Never once had any problems and I was with my 6 year old and 11 year old son. They had a blast. Hope this helps.....

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Hemma
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at this hotel. The location was excellent as it is on 43rd street but a lot of undesirables were hanging around and I did not feel safe at night. The entrance was through a car garage which was a bit strange. The bathroom was old and run down and the plumbing left a lot to be desired. My hairdrier did not work. Overall the room was comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: thebladder
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for six nights in September and were very happy with the hotel. The hotel is basic but provides very good value for money. Hotel prices in NYC are crazy and a lot of Â£100 a night hotels are basically awful. This one on the other hand was clean and safe with large rooms and pretty close to the action. (about a ten minute walk from times square) We even got a view of the empire state building (and a rather run down police station) from our bedroom window. We got the best rate by going straight to the hotels own website, its a bit tricky to find but if you put "manhattan travel inn" into google its about the second or third hit. I'd reccomend going for a "double double" room as they were bigger than the standard rooms and were the same price. the only slight downside was the noise from 42nd street, I was able to ignore it but my girlfriend did need to sleep with ear plugs in. If you are a light sleeper I'd reccomend asking for a room at the back of the hotel. In conclusion, I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my experience at Travel Inn”
Reviews.Author: Jet_Setting_Kiki
Reviews.Content: I had a whirlwind trip to NYC for an interview. I arrived Monday afternoon at the Travel Inn and was greeted by 2 kind gentlemen. They checked me in very quickly (about 1 minute), informed me of what was nearby, and talked with me about my interview and how to get there in the best time. After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I did request a Quiet Room. Those rooms are located around the pool. It was very, very quiet. The elevator worked fine. My room was very clean. The beds are definitely firm.....and I slept like a baby (a happy, content baby). I was given a prompt wake-up call the next morning. I had to check out soon after my interview....and the check out was also very fast (about 2 minutes). The young lady in the gift shop was helpful when I needed to arrange a shuttle back to the airport. Monday night, I ordered room service (from a place a couple blocks away....Theater Diner). I had a delicious dinner within 25 minutes! On Tuesday, after my interview, I ate right next door to the hotel at the Broadway Cafe. The man there was extremely prompt and attentive. Very good french toast. I felt very, very safe there. It's like any other NYC street....busy and bustling. I really don't understand why people have said they didn't feel safe....I can only assume that they are unfamiliar with big cities. It was also very easy to hail a taxi on the morning of my interview....just walk out of the hotel, turn to your left and walk to that street corner....I had a taxi in about 45 seconds. So, stay at the Travel Inn! Enjoy! You're close to so much!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stuff !”
Reviews.Author: Soundwave
Reviews.Content: My friend booked the hotel for us. I wasn't too sure what to expect. Happily, this was a good place to stay. It was quiet and our room was quite clean and comfortable. The biggest advantages are that you get free parking and the proximity to Times Square. The Travel Inn is also close to a subway station, eateries and even a grocery store. This was my first time in New York and the hotel was a great place to rest in our hectic but very fun stay. I recommend this hotel for all ages. If you come in the dog days of summer ( August ), be sure to bring your swimming trunks for the pool that is almost an oasis in the bustling NYC ! - Montreal and VA visitors

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Bargain! Free Parking means I will come back again.”
Reviews.Author: KC_VA
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews of this hotel and saw the two-star rating at some sites and was a little apprehensive about making a reservation at first. Some relatives then made plans to come to NYC by Greyhound bus, so this hotel became the most convenient option (it is located just 2 blocks away from the Port Authority bus terminal). The location of this hotel is just awesome. Getting to the hotel by car is easy - it is very close to the Lincoln Tunnel entry into NYC. It is within proximity of the excitement of Times Square and the Theatre District - we walked there a few times during our 2-night stay (about a 10-15 minute walk). We also walked all the way to Rockefeller Plaza and took the Top of the Rock tour (a little longer of a walk, but well worth it).
