The 42nd street subway station at Port Authority is also very conveniently located near the hotel - we purchased a $7 one-day Metrocard and traveled to Lower Manhattan in the morning to check out Ground Zero and the Staten Island Ferry (total travel time on the subway to Lower Manhattan was just under 20 minutes). We also took the subway in the early evening to Columbus Circle (Time Warner Center, Central Park) - it is located 17 blocks (but only 2 subway stops) away. The rooms in the hotel were clean but small, though I'm not complaining. We didn't travel to NYC to relax and sit around in our hotel all day long, we definitely went there to visit the sites. There were quite a few people at the outdoor pool - I guess to each their own but my intention wasn't to travel to such a prime, exciting location to enjoy the ambiance of the hotel and take a dip in the pool. I definitely think that the best feature of this hotel was the free parking. I was considering another hotel nearby, but I would have had to pay nearly $30/day to park across the street. I was definitely happy that I did not have to worry about parking and that my car was in a safe & convenient location. The deli near the restaurant was fine, but there was also a Starbucks, Dunkin' Donuts and a 7/11 within walking distance... not to mention 8 million other eateries near Times Square. Bottom line: this hotel is a bargain. We had a total of 3 people staying in my room for 2 nights last week and we paid just under $350 USD (after taxes) without having to pay for parking. I could not find any other deals this good in such a convenient location and I searched almost daily for nearly a month. With everything else being as expensive as it is in NYC, it just makes sense to save as much money as possible on lodging. Cleanliness is definitely a concern for me - I wouldn't go for the least expensive option if I knew that the hotel was not clean, but this was simply NOT a problem at the Travel Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: Sammie4
Reviews.Content: After reading a mixture of past reviews, we were a little aprehensive of what to expect upon arrival with 2 kids aged 10yr & 3yrs at this hotel for a 7 night duration. Well, our aprehension was quashed upon arrival to helpful staff & a great size room with 2 dbls (as previously rqstd months before), a lovely clean & fresh smelling room on the 4th floor. The A/C worked beautifully & the noise levels frm the busy 42nd St. did not disturb us at all. We did not have a great view from our room however the presence of the police station right across the road gave a great sense of `safety' - apparently there are 40K police officers in Manhattan alone (this we learnt from the various tours we went on). The Deli next door provided good food but our preference for the Theatre Row Deli situated 1 block away provided a better ambience & variety - much to to my kids delight!!! Overall this hotel is situated a few blocks away from the main `action', Broadway, Time Sq etc & yellow cabs are in abundance as to be expected!! We will have no hesitate in staying at the Travel Inn again when we are next back in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great free parking in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Margaret2
Reviews.Content: Even though we were warned this was a budget hotel - the free parking lured us to book. We are so pleased we did, the location is great just 4 blocks from centre of Times Square, and even in the extreme temperatures still very walkable. Safe area with NYPD station just across the road, and even a view of the Empire State building from our window. Check in was efficient with the garage next to reception however we had a large car and the bays were smaller than usual. Staff were efficient but certainly not friendly. Pool was an added bonus for this price of hotel, however water was colder than expected. Room decoration was reasonable, very clean, comments before have mentioned small bathroom but even 2 adults and 2 children managed adequately. Soaps etc. were replenished daily. Used deli next door for breakfast - great value.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: Firefly68
Reviews.Content: My friend and I (two 30-something women) stayed here for 3 nights on a shopping trip. The previous reviews are pretty comprehensive and we found the postive reviews borne out by our experience, which was just fine. I was especially impressed with the size of our room (normal hotel room size! In New York!) I've previously stayed in Chelsea at the adorable Chelsea Lodge, but their rooms have only one bed, and we needed two beds. I was a little worried that this hotel is in Hell's Kitchen but there is absolutely nothing wrong with the neighbourhood. The streets were so busy that we felt very safe walking back to the hotel even at midnight. EATING The local Starbucks is right around the corner on 9th Ave (head north) on the main floor of the large apartment building on the corner. Pax Whole Foods (42nd Street, on the way to Times Square) is a great place for a quick, healthy lunch. Lovely Bryant Park (behind the NYC library) is just past Times Square on 42nd Street. It has dozens of free cafe tables, fantastic people watching and public washrooms that look like they belong in the Waldorf. It's a perfect spot for morning coffee and breakfast while you plan your day. There's a little takeaway on the south side of 42nd street (Cafe something or other) similar to Pax - all sorts of sandwiches, yogurt, sweets, fruit, drinks to choose from; and the ubiquitous Starbucks across the street. We managed to get same day reservations at Nobu in Tribeca by eating at the unfashionably early hour (by NYC standards) of 5:45 - 7:45p.m. Considering that Nobu is usually fully booked a month in advance, we were pretty happy. Also loved Pastis, a French-style cafe on 9th Ave at Little West 12th Street. Go before 11:00a.m to get a seat without waiting. TRANSPORTATION If you don't have a lot of luggage, you can walk 2 blocks to the Port Authority Bus Terminal and catch a shuttle to JFK or LaGuardia & save about $7.00 per person over a hotel shuttle booked through the hotel gift shop. SHOPPING We found 5th Ave north of 42nd Street to be much better shopping than Soho; or at least, we both had better luck there. I noticed that prices vary wildly at the souvenir shops around town, so look around before you buy. We saw T-shirts advertised at everything from "3 for $10" to "14 for $10." Personally, I think the best souvenir is a framed photo that street vendors sell for $12-$20 (all the major sights are available). I buy one to commemorate each trip to NYC. MUSEUMS Warning: our two guidebooks (2001 and 2005) both had MOMA and the Neue Gallery (with a cool Klimt exhibition) closed on Mondays... when in fact, they're closed on Tuesdays. Serves us right for not purchasing new guidebooks, I guess. HOTEL DOWNSIDES I would stay at the Travel Inn again without hesitating. It's great value for the price. The only downsides I can think of are these: - 42nd street is fairly boring (parking garage, police station, post office, supermarket, bank, bus terminal) for two blocks toward Times Square; it's not a NYC street with lots of cafes and boutiques on your doorstep. 9th Ave. heading north offers more restaurant choices, all pretty standard fare. - The hotel is the budget offering of the Empire hotel chain, meaning you get decent quality and zero character. It could be any hotel room, anywhere in the world. - If you're in town to shop, a hotel in the Midtown East area would put you closer to the action; for theatre goers, Travel Inn is perfectly located. Hope others find this useful.

Reviews.Title: “A NYC hotel that is NOT overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: Amazon30
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews on Tripadvisor, I booked this hotel. The hotel would definetely NOT win the friendliest hotel award 2006, reception staff were not very 'forthcoming'. However the room was clean and accomodating, but bathroom is tiny! I requested a quiet room, and was located on the 6th floor overlooking pool, heard no noise from main street. I experienced one unfortunate event, when I returned to the hotel one evening, and found our bedroom door was slightly open. Fearing the worst, I opened the door to expect all our belongings etc to be gone, however everything was in place (fortunately, otherwise they being in receipt of a lawsuit!!!). I informed the reception, who were overly complacement and blamed the cleaner for not shutting the door properly!!?? If this incident did not happen, I would of given this hotel an above average rating. It is a couple of blocks away from Time Square, however my two children aged 11 and 14 and myself walked back to hotel every night (10-15 min walk) without any fear (maybe I lived in London too long!!!). I found the people of New York either very friendly or very rude - no midway. I also agree with previous comment, that NYC is definetely not Disneyland ie not child-friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Everything for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: jamijabber
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading online reviews and I was still a little nervous about such a cheap hotel (relative to other NYC hotels), but we were seriously impressed! We arrived early, but the parking attendant told us to go on in and register and then we could park in the lot right away. We parked our van in the FREE lot and left it there for our whole stay. We walked almost eveywhere or to the subway station just a few blocks away. This hotel is in an awesome location! Not a terribly busy or "touristy" area, but close to everything and in a great walking neighborhood. Our kids (ages 6& 8) LOVED the outdoor pool!! It was 80+ everyday we were there so we planned our days to include a stop back at the hotel to enjoy a dip in the pool each afternoon before heading back out to see more. Definitely a bonus!! The staff were all very helpful! This was my first trip to a big city and I was very nervous and ignorant, but they were all very helpful and informative!! We even had a street side room and were never bothered by noise or traffic. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth The Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Punkiedoodle
Reviews.Content: We took our family including 2 young girls to New York City this past weekend and stayed at the Travel Inn. I was impressed by the reviews on this site therefore, I decided to give it a try! When I go back to NYC, I will stay here! The hotel was so easy to get to, right off of the Lincoln Tunnel. The FREE SELF PARKING IS SUCH A PLUS. We arrived around 11:00 am and told them we were here. They checked our reservations and told us we were welcome to park the car and go sight-seeing. They told us we could check-in after 2:00, but our reservation was guaranteed if we wanted to return later (which we did). The parking attendants were very friendly and helpful. You can either leave your luggage in the car (which we felt very safe doing) or check it in the security room in the parking garage. The front desk was friendly and helpful in telling us where the nearest Subway stop was. They even gave us a free Subway map. We walked back to the hotel around 10:00pm and we felt very safe. The walk from Times Square is about 4 (longer) blocks. It is an easy walk with alot to look at, so my children didn't even mind it! Our room was VERY CLEAN and QUIET. It was even facing the train tracks and the noise was muffled. We needed extra towels which were brought to us immediately! The beds were nice and the air-conditioner worked great. The city view is a plus. The pool looked nice, we just didn't have time to use it! The deli (Broadway Deli)next door is WONDERFUL for breakfast. I got 2 eggs, bacon, fried potatoes and toast for less than $4.00. The portions fill you up too! I HIGHLY recommend it! Once again, I can't wait to go back! Hope your experience is as good as ours!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Affordability in Midtown, NYC”
Reviews.Author: katsas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of July 2006 and had a nice and comfortable stay. I travelled to NYC by myself and was a little concerned about my safety, but all is well when you're inside the Travel Inn. I don't know what the other negative reviewers are talking about. But, I can say that even the ritziest places can give bad service too. About the area....It's on the edge of Hell's Kitchen which is "coming up" as many neighborhoods are in NYC. It's an urban place with many different characters and faces. I don't consider any place in NYC "kid friendly," we're definitely not at Disneyland people. About the room: I was upgraded without asking and greeted every time I came into the hotel lobby after a long day of touring the city. Everything in the room worked great. I would strongly recommend this to travellers who are no frills and don't expect the Ritz for budget prices. Get real! Hope this review helps....

Reviews.Title: “Will not return for sure...”
Reviews.Author: cotomom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travel Inn last week. We had requested a nonsmoking double overlooking pool room months ago. Upon check in (3pm), we were given a room on the 3rd floor overlooking 42nd street. The room was dirty and there was a man repainting door casings upon arrival. We were told we could leave our luggage there and it would be cleaned shortly. (The doors were all open on the floor due to the painting). I went back to the front desk to inquire about a room in the back overlooking the pool, and was told there were none available. Traffic noise is very loud and apparant all hours of the night (including multiple sirens from the police station across the street). Especially large buses up and down 42nd street all hours - many going to the convention center located down by the water. The room had beds as hard as rocks and thread bare sheets/towels. The room was cleaned shortly after we arrived but not to my standards. There was still several hairs to be seen all over towels, floor, tub, etc. Both the tub and the sink did not drain properly. The hot/cold in the shower/tub was just that - either hot or cold - no warm! We learned to quickly shower as there were no other rooms available in the city due to conventions. Otherwise we would have moved! Our room smelled of Raid insect spray, the hallway was never airconditioned, the elevator lights did not light up and you often had to wait. The pool is a nice size but don't count on the lifeguard there who sleeps while on duty! The hotel was full of European travellers (not a negative, just a fact). This hotel is NOT in a tourist area. It is 3 blocks from Times Square - 3 LONG blocks equivalent to 9 or so of the short blocks. I agree it is not that safe of an area after dark. There is a Food Emporium grocery store 1/2 a block up which was good for quick snacks/necessities. We did try the Theatre Row Diner about a block up once for dinner. It was reasonably priced by NY standards but the food was adequate at best. We requested late checkout and was denied. The lady in the gift shop (size of a small closet) was nice. Taxi's are difficult to obtain in front of the hotel but the city bus (M42) does stop right in front. This is not a "nice" hotel by any means, but would be better than sleeping in the airport! We paid $50.00 MORE for this hotel than our first 4 nights at the Hilton New York. Which of course is many moons nicer/cleaner/noise free/comfortable/better located than the Travel Inn. I would not dream of staying at this hotel ever again ... for ANY reason.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Inn may be clean, but not so o.k......”
Reviews.Author: kirbey38
Reviews.Content: I am a 37 year old woman, who stayed at the Travel Inn between 6/28 and 7/1/06 with my 9 year old daughter and 14 year old daughter. The hotel was very clean, but that is as far as I care to compliment this hotel. Upon check in, we arrived at 1pm (check in is 3pm), and were told our room was not ready, which is fine, but we just arrived from the airport, and had luggage. Instead of offering the small security room which is located in front of the parking garage (I did not realize it was there until check out), I was told to just put our luggage in our room. Not a good idea, since when we got to our room, it was still a mess from the last occupants, and the door was wide open. I also did not find the location to be that safe at night, especially being a lone woman with 2 children, coming back from the theater and dinner at midnight, having to pass not so child friendly streets. The halls always seemed deserted, and had a wait for the elevator. I would not recommend this hotel if traveling with children, especially small children, as the walk from Time Square tires them easily, feeling of uneasiness, as it is situated away from the hustle and bustle, and in a kind of desolate area. Maybe a good value for couples, as the room was cheap, clean, and if you drive in, parking free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Travel Inn”
Reviews.Author: UghDoug
Reviews.Content: My son, his girlfriend and I spent 6 nights at the Travel Inn in June and had a great time there. This was the second time I've stayed here and it was even better than my first stay. Our room was right on 42nd st. across from the police station. I was concerned about noise, but it wasn't an issue. Our air conditioning worked really well and was very quite. I had stayed in the back of the hotel last year but I think this unit was nicer than the one we had last year (and we were very happy with that one). The hotel is only a few blocks from Time Square and from there you can catch the subway to go just about anywhere. I recommend this hotel because it's reasonably priced (for New York), the rooms are fairly nice, they're clean and it's close to everything you want to do or see in New York. And by the way, If you have never been to New York and you are just trying to decide wheather or not to go-just go. New York can be intimidating, but everyone that Ive ever talked to about going to New York has loved it and couldn't get enough of it.

Reviews.Title: “New York in June”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our 14yro daughter and 10yro son after it was recommended to us by our trqvel agent. The hotel was basic but was kept clean and tidy - after all in New York you are only looking for a place to sleep!. The location was great just 10mins walk from Times Square. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly, they sorted out our transport back to the airport without any prblems. I had read a few reviews on this hotel that mentioned the noise at the front of the building, we didn't find this a problem. The area felt safe and was extremely convenient. We would definatey stay there again. We would definately recommend the Trollies Diner a couple of blocks aways in the direction of TImes Square the food from there was great and the steff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT and AFFORDABLE hotel, but not the best.”
Reviews.Author: dantheman_traveler
Reviews.Content: Our duration at the Travel Inn was from June 18th until June 27th. There is a gift shop at the hotel, but it is only open from 7am to 4pm everyday. Next to the free parking garage, there is a deli located next to the hotel. The food isn't the best, but it does fill you up. The room was very clean when we first entered the room, even though we got to the hotel earlier than the 2pm check-in. The bathroom was very clean, and we had a view of 42nd Street and the NYPD station across the street. The noise at night, which was just a few ambulance and police sirens, didn't bother us at all. We were disappointed when we found out that the pool only operates between 11am and 7pm. We assumed that it was going to close at 10pm. You are about a 5 to 10 minute walk to the heart of Times Square. Hotel staff quickly check you in and out. Very convenient. I would stay at this hotel again, but if this hotel was in the heart of Times Square, it would cost a lot more than what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here - but bring a pillow!”
Reviews.Author: bal1234
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay. Easy to get to, right off the Lincoln Tunnel. Close to everything in New York. VERY VERY Clean. Service was FAST. Check in was a breeze, he nearly had our check in complete before my husband could finish giving his name! Remember to ask for a quiet room. I did and we got a room overlooking the pool. Absolutely no problem with any street noise. The pool looked very clean and would have been wonderful on a hot day. When we were there it was about 70 degrees and very windy, so we didn't use the pool. Rooms were clean, bathroom was clean, hallways were clean. Free parking was the best. It is self parking - which we like. We have a Lincoln Towncar, and have had other NYC places park our car - only to find a scratch that wasn't there before. Places just don't care that much about parking. So my husband parked the car and no worries. Staff is right inside the garage. We were NOT worried about leaving our car. We will definitely stay there again - you can't beat it for the price and cleanliness! OK - as for bringing your own pillow - We had four people staying in the room. We had four pillows. Most of us liked to sleep with more than one pillow. My husband has a neck problem so has to have 3 pillows. We called the desk for an extra pillow for each and were told that we had enough pillows. No extra, one per person. Well, they did come up with two extra pillows for us. I was good - I brought my own pillow!!! My travelmates were laughing at me for doing so when we left home - but they weren't laughing at the hotel. So remember for your visit to New York City - stay at the Travel Inn Manhattan!!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull stay great place friendly peolpe {just fantastic}”
Reviews.Author: plug42
Reviews.Content: Hi this is the Mcarthur family from salford in manchester we recently stayed in this hotel in may and june 2006.The room was fantastic the pool was great i asked for a view of the city wat a view i got.the people where so friendly it was unberlieable.the parkin is free the lifts work the rooms are nice big clean what more could you ask for .You are a ten miniute walk from everthing you want.It was a pleasure to stay there and from me and my family i would like to thank all the people who are involved in the running of the hotel>I Would they there anytime .MANY THANKS.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie9557
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travel Inn for 3 nights June 6-9. There is nothing wrong with this place. The room was very clean. I didnt see not one bug. The bathroom is a little on the small side but who cares, it looks newly remodeled. Yeah, the beds are firm but I have occasional back problems and my daughter does as well and these beds did not bother us. Although we had some rainy days when we were there the pool was filled and looked great. I wish it didnt rain so much so we could have used it some. There was nothing at all wrong with the a/c in our room. It worked just fine. Was actually pretty cool when we kept it running. We had a room facing the pool. Nice and quiet at night. Vending machines and ice were on the 3rd floor where our room was. The deli outside is reasonable and great for morning coffee. Open til about 8pm. The deli down the street had some good food and also reasonable prices. Times Sq. and the subway are about 3 blocks down. We also felt safe in this area. Go for this hotel! You cant beat the price for nice clean accomodations in NYC. We will return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Location”
Reviews.Author: sfogary
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Travel Inn from May 8-11. It is located in a rather quiet neighborhood (for New York!), about a 15 minute walk from Times Square. My wife and I felt very safe in the neighborhood, though there are many transients in the area (the bus depot is nearby, as well as a "home" for transients). The rooms are sparse, but pleasantly decorated. The bed was rather hard, but after walking all day, sleep was not a problem. We found the hotel staff to be very pleasant and helpful. The hotel rates are a bargain for the location; and since we drove down from Boston, the free parking was a HUGE advantage. I would definitely stay there again, and recommend the hotel to budget conscious travellers who want to be close to all of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for NYC visit”
Reviews.Author: Janeth13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travel Inn, NYC for two nights over Memorial Day weekend. We were very lucky to get a room on the top floor, facing 42nd street, with a fabulous view of the Empire State Building. We arrived in NYC at 8:30am and so we dropped our bags in their security room and went out for the day. When we came back to check-in at 2:30pm we had no problem. The room was fine - not glamourous, but definitely value for money. The only disappointment was that there were no coffee-making facilities in the room. We were surprised that the street noise didn't affect us much but I guess that was because we were on the top floor. The air conditioning was very effective, if a little noisy. The diner next door was great for breakfast both mornings and we felt perfectly safe returning to our room each night between 10:30pm and midnight. We had caught the ferry across from Weehawken and so picked up a free shuttle bus to a bus stop across from the hotel when arriving, and simply walked back to the ferry terminal when we checked-out. So convenient! This was a great place to stay - so close to everything! Would definitely stay here next time we visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and safe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travel Inn from 8th to 15th May 2006 following recommendations on this website. It was all true - very convenient within walking distance of all the main attractions and even an aircraft carrier (USS Intrepid) Museum at the end of the street - not many hotels can boast that! A friend advised me that this was an unsafe area, but we felt completely safe, especially with the police station right opposite! We had problems with the wash basin plug and the lift got stuck on one occasion, but staff were instantly on to fix these issue. Room was extremely clean and smartly decorated. We had a room at the back of the hotel, which had its pluses and minuses. It overlooked a run-down area and the railway, but trains were not very frequent and it was quieter than being at the front. Disappointed the pool was not filled by mid-May, but weather was not really good enough anyway. Couldn't make a local phone call from the room without opening an account and paying a $25.00 deposit - bizarre and inconvenient, so had to use a call box. Would definately stay there again, however.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have found a better location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were 3 ladies , first time in New York and not quite sure what to expect . First impressions were not too impressive especially when we saw the view from our window of the railway track but apart from the front desk people who could have been alot more friendly and the pool being empty(it was 80 degrees during the day) we would definately stay there again. We were very impressed about the cleanliness of the rooms and although it was on the doorstep of Times Square it was reasonably quiet at night and felt very safe. Deli next door was so convenient , reasonable & great food, wonderful breakfasts to keep you going for the day. Not quite 10 out of 10 but wonderful value and definately worth a second stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but we'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wanted an affordable, clean, spacious hotel that was within walking distance to Times Square for a weekend trip with my mother and sister. Once again I looked to Trip Advisor for assistance with finding a hotel. Based on the room rates, location and reviews I read, I chose the Travel Inn Hotel on West 42nd Street. Overall, we were satisfied with this hotel. It was nothing fancy for sure, but it was clean, roomy and didn't break the bank. There is a pool there but at the time of our stay, there was no water in the pool. The staff could have been a bit cheerier and the beds were a little on the hard side but we really had no complaints. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel/Price”
Reviews.Author: Cherylg717
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on May 5th...had dinner at Carmines 44th- about 5 few blocks to walk. Very easy to get to if driving there - just outside the Lincoln Tunnel. I wouldn't say it was a luxury NYC hotel. Very Clean ... ammenities were basic. They do have a deli/cafe attached to the hotel for sandwiches, sodas, beer. If you do drive, you pull into the hotel bldg and park your own car in the parking garage. Parking is Included - a nice plus. Overall, this was a great find for the $$$. Very centrally located. Pool opens Memorial day - very large pool/pool area.

Reviews.Title: “As described! Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: facre2505
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from the 19th to th23rd of April.... Hotel is excellent, great location, near everything, great price, helpful staff, very clean. It was an excellent experience. Yes, the room was hot, b/c the AC was not working, but we slept fine. Didn't hear any noise, and my room was facing 42nd St. Overall, an awesome experience. No questions I will stay there again next time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “April 17-21”
Reviews.Author: zenmom927
Reviews.Content: I was really curious after reading the review here...so mixed! But a friend of mine recommended this hotel so the $125 price (booked at their website as others have mentioned) and the free parking sold me. We stayed 4 nights from 4/17 to 4/21. Our room was on the third floor which was right above street level and faced 42nd avenue. All the hotel employees were nice, the room was clean but whoa....it was HOT. I asked the housekeeper about it and she said the AC had not been turned on. The only thing you can adjust in the room is a fan. It was near 80 degrees outside during the day but even at night the room was hot. Not a little hot...sleepig on top of the bed, not under the covers and still waking up sweating, hot! Also I couldn't leave the window open because the noise from the street below and the building across the street is non-stop...and I am not fussy about noise- I work nights and sleep days while the whole neighborhood is leaf-blowing and mowing their lawns and kids are playing- so when I say noisy I mean it. I actually got up and got a video clip of the garbage truck emptying something like 7 dumpsters at some ungodly hour of the morning because I wanted to be able to make people howl with laughter at how crazy it was! It's true that the toilet seat was loose, there was no fan in the bathroom, the shower temp varied by what other people were doing...heating up and cooling down, the mattresses were firm.... but all in all the room was totally acceptable. If not for the AC issue I could tolerate even the noise and recommend it. The deli next door was the best buy around. It was a quick jaunt to the subway or bus...eveything stops in Times Square it seems. I never felt unsafe...the neighborhood seemed to get a litte rundown right at 10th street but it seemed there were a lot of policemen on the block always coming and going from the station across the street. If you really want to drive to NYC and take advantage of free parking and good locaion....call ahead to make sure the AC is on and ask for a room in the back. For the same reason I would check back in here in the winter to see if the heat is on and where the warm rooms are!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from April 9th for 5 nights, and cannot fault it. Staff were friendly and approachable nothing was too much trouble for them. We could not figure out the door lock and wanted more pillows and on both occastions the matters were instantly dealt with. It was very clean both the room and hotel in general, gym facilities were good and always accessable. An excellent location just 5 minutes from Times square and centeral to a hoast of other attractions and sights. For breakfast or any meal there is a very good Deli literally outside the hotel making it very handy first thing in the moring!! We loved every minute of the holiday and would definatly stay at this hotel again and reccomend it to anyone wanted to see New York. The hotel also has a garage and very good gift shop where you can get tickets for a whole range of attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Haylow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Travel Inn for 4 nights in March. We were a bit concerned because we weren't sure how far it would be from transport/attractions etc. We didn't have any problems though because the hotel is a five minute walk from the Port Authority Bus Terminal (where the shuttle bus from the airport stops). It was also a 10 minute stroll to the Times Square/42nd Street subway station from which most trains ran. We never had to take a taxi anywhere, we either walked from the hotel or caught the subway. The hotel itself was basic, but good. The hotel staff were ok and the rooms were very clean. We booked a room with 2 double beds (there were only 2 of us), so we would have some room to move. The bathroom was clean but the toilet cistern was just about clinging on - one push and it was have toppled; and the bathroom door was off its hinges at the bottom. The room costs us less than Â£100 per night, so for the price and location - it would be hard to beat this hotel. There was a great diner, deli, grocery store, pharmacy and Starbucks a few doors away from the hotel. The noise from the traffic was quite loud, but that's to be expected and you just take a pair of ear plugs with you. The area felt very safe, in fact it felt safer in the evening because it was busier than in the day. In all a good hotel in a good location - we'll definitely stay there again on our next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a week at this hotel, driving up from Orlando, Florida to be tourists in New York during her spring break from high school. We chose it because of the many positive reviews on this website and we were very pleased with it overall. The location is great, easy walking distance to Times Square, we actually walked just about every where we went, Central Park, the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center - we even walked to the Guggenheim Museum but I don't recommend that, it turned out to be a lot further away than we estimated! The hotel was very clean, the staff extremely friendly, always ready to help or advise. That it has secure, free parking is a definate plus considering what the public garages charge for parking. Our room was very nice, the bathroom was excellent, there was plenty of room to put everything and being two women, we had a lot of "stuff"! I had to work while there, happily the room had a desk that was the right height and a comfy chair, with wireless connectivity available for my computer a bargain at, what $5.95 a day I think it was. There were only three things I wished that were different - and the first is ..... a bigger tv! The tv was very small and hard for my old eyes to watch from the bed, even when it was pulled out. Secondly, the room was very hot, we had to keep the window open all the time and sometimes even prop the door open to get the room cooled down. The hotel staff were wonderful though about explaining the reason (building heated by one main boiler so heat is maintained at an even temperature in all rooms and although the unit in our room was turned "off" by us, heat was still leaking through) Lastly, the fact that you had to call and pay each day for a code to keep the wireless on for the computer, I wished I could have just paid for the week obviously! But considering the overall experience of the hotel and it's staff, these were minor annoyances, believe me. We would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 3 of us shared a room here for 9 nights at the end of March 2006 & we had no complaints. Room service was excellent and were made up and cleaned thoroughly every day of our stay. Sheets were changed at least twice and nothing was missed. Fresh soap, mini shampoos etc were replaced every day. Housekeeping staff were very friendly and helpful. Front office staff were a bit aloof and I feel they could be a little bit more helpful at times. The location was great and convenient to all attractions, taxis are everywhere and most drivers are more than helpful to visitors. The theater diner up the street was great as was the little diner right next door to the Travel Inn. All in all I would reccommend the hotel as good, clean, convenient & great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent travel inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we have been staying at the travel inn 42nd street for the past 6 years and always exceptional value for money very clean very good position if your going and looking for a quality hotel you have got to try the travel inn you will pleased you did our son lives and works in ct USA is a regular visitor to the hotel , Ann & Peter Young Boston ENGLAND.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but...non-smokers beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and experienced the big snow storm in February (26 inches!). It's close to Times Square and the convention centre so it was very convenient for us. It's in a pretty safe location. We never had any concerns walking back late at night. We had breakfast in the deli downstairs and at the Theatre Diner one block away. Starbucks is at the end of the block and a grocery story is at the other end of the block. The room was spacious but the bathrooms are very small. I'd go as far as to say that the bathrooms are very cramped with very little counter space. The shower provides enough pressure. There wasn't enough light in the shower/tub area though...once the shower curtain as pulled, it was a bit on the dark side. Wireless access was easy to get for a fee of about $6 per 24 hour period. You have to get an access password every 24 hours from the front desk. The rooms were clean enough BUT we had specifically requested a non-smoking room. When we arrived on a Saturday at 2pm, we were told there were no more non-smoking rooms and we were given a smoking room. It reeked of smoke...everything did. They sent up an ozone air purifier for us and delivered fresh pillows to us but for the first 2 days, it was still pretty bad. By the end of the 2nd day, the room smell was ok (a combination of the air purifier and us leaving the doors and windows open when we could). So...would we stay there again? Yes...because after the room stopped stinking, it was a pretty nice hotel and you can't beat the price for that location. Just be wary of the fact that you may not get a non-smoking room if that's important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: anneounschooler
Reviews.Content: Free Parking! Located right across from a police station! Two blocks away from the subway, one block away from Times Square. Wonderful deli downstairs/next door. Rooms are average and worth the price. Pleasant staff. It's a wonderful value and we WILL return.

Reviews.Title: “Come back for more”
Reviews.Author: Horseworrier
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in NY City. Rooms spacious and kept clean...staff very helpful, excellent value for money. Recommend the Deli next door for all breakfast requirements but for your evening meal would recommend Theater Row Diner just up the road for good food and large portions at a low price! Excellent Pharmacy opposite hotel get your digital photo's developed at a fraction of the UK cost!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Aunt and I drove down from Kingston, Ontario and found this hotel very easy to navigate to once we exited the Lincoln Tunnel. Beware of the NYC cab drivers! Parking is FREE! and the room rates were excellent for those who have lots of shopping to do! Only a few blocks from the glitter of Times Square. Good walking distance north to the Madison and 5th Ave shops. It is also a short distance to the shops and Macy's on 34th St. However, don't attempt both in one day! There are lots of Deli's and Starbucks in the area. Rooms were basic and clean. There is internet access for a small fee for those who like to write a letter to home. I highly recommend this hotel for the average shopper looking for a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coqui166
Reviews.Content: What a Wonderful Find. We were a group of 4 Woman. This Hotel is Off 42nd street between 8th and 9th avenue.The Port Authority is across the street.The room has 2 full size beds, we call the desk around 10pm to verify if they had a pillow that was lower than the regular ones and in less than 5 minutes, the perfect pillow was in our hands.Friendly people, the little store inside the Hotel sells the tickets for all the tours you need to take.the clerk was very knowledgeable about where to shop and Go.Rooms were clean every Day,Towels and toiletries were provided,Ironing board etc.Feel free to leave all you shopping bags in the room. they have a Storage room available free of charge..so if you arrive early don't worry...lock them up and start enjoying NYC.Free parking and Pool avaliable in summer time. The deli next to the Hotel was a Marvelous find,succulent breakfast and Sandwiches. We were there the 1st week of march, it was Cold low 20's but we loved it. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “well positioned”
Reviews.Author: grovebury
Reviews.Content: adequate, well positioned, rooms functional, reception staff didn't meet or greet on arrival or subsequent returns from trips, not even a "hello", didn't feel particularly valued or welcome. Attached cafe expensive and service poor (go to Theatre Diner 50m yards away, much better service/food/prices. A basic, relatively inexpensive hotel ideal for those using it merely as a place to lay their heads.

Reviews.Title: “Best NYC Hotel Experience for Regular Folks”
Reviews.Author: Pigeonnumber3
Reviews.Content: This was a clean, friendly hotel with comfortable beds and spacious rooms. And free wireless and free parking!!! The shower had some force. There was room to open 3 suitcases. There was a window with adequate curtains for darkening the room. The location can't be beat - a few blocks from Times Sq, the Port Authority and the 7th Ave subway, and right across the street from an NYPD station! I've stayed in many places in the city that cost the same or more and I have never said I would stay there again. I will definitely stay at this hotel another time. The price was right - although it was winter rates. (They have an outdoor pool, too!)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl002
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I decided to stop off in New York for 2 nights to finish off a caribbean cruise, as we had to fly back to London via JFK from Miami. It was our first time in New York and we fell in love with the city and plan to go back this December for a week. The Travel Inn was everything you want for a city hotel. It was clean, friendly and safe and the staff were all more than helpful. It is a 5 minute walk from Broadway and 10 minute walk from Time Square and Maceys. It was lovely going at Christmas, as all the decorations, the ice rink and market in Time Square and the father christmases on the streets all made it magical. We were a bit concerned being two "girls" on our own, but we did feel safe. The hotel is right opposite New York Police Department and we had a lovely view of the Empire State Building which was illuminated at night. The hotel is only two blocks from the harbour, where you can get cruises around the statue of liberty. There is also a supermarket and deli 1 block away, so everything you need right on your doorstep. We were so tired after two days of hard shopping and sightseeing, that we didn't have the energy to go out again, so ordered room service. They've got quite a good choice of menu and it is delivered from the deli one block down, and both nights we weren't disappointed at all with the quality, amount or price we paid. There is also a deli right next door which is ideal for breakfast. All in all, an ideal hotel, in a good position and friendly, clean and comfortable. One slight downpoint though. Just beware if you book a chaffeur driven limo to the airport. I don't know if it was because we were two women on our own, but we were told that the price of $75 was a flat rate and included everything, including tolls and tips (and it states this in the literature in the hotel), but when we got to the airport he tried to charge us extra on top for the tolls. I was going to give him a good tip (gratuity), because the traffic was really bad and he seemed fed up, but because he tried to rip us off I didn't bother, so he missed out. The tip would have been a lot more than the extra he charged us. Apart from this, New York is wonderful, the people are lovely and we just loved it - roll on December 2006 when we go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for your money in NYC”
Reviews.Author: hyperjulie9
Reviews.Content: Second time I've been to this hotel. My bf and I loved it. Near all the attractions yet not too loud, clean and affordable, could not ask for anything more. Maid service is great, staff is helpful and the breakfast place next store is good and nicely priced. I don't think I'll ever go to another hotel in New York, stayed 4 nites and paid 105$ a nite, amazing deal! Will be back this summer for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: roadrun99
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Travel Inn in early Dec 2005. We found it to be a very comfortable, clean and good value hotel.The bedrooms were much bigger than we anticipatd. It is very convenient for sightseeing in New York. We can recommend the Deli next door for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: morley06
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in the Travel Inn on 42nd St and would definitely recommend it. The rooms are very large and it is great value. Location is pretty good and it is quite quiet (ask for a room facing onto the pool). Staff are very helpful and friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Travel Inn is basically a chain hotel, so didn't blow me away, but was perfectly adequate. The room was clean and tidy and a good size, with a very welcome and useful complimentary copy of Time Out New York. A vending machine for cold drinks and snacks and an ice machine were just down the hall, and there is a small shop in the lobby selling snacks and camera film. Breakfast can be had from the diner next door, where the staff are very friendly and helpful, and the food is delicious. (Police officers from the police station across the street are often seen in there!) The hotel is only a short walk from the Port Authority Bus Terminal and subway station, and the Empire State Building can be seen from the front door. I had no complaints at all while staying there.

Reviews.Title: “We Keep Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: ptowner
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the the Travel Inn for several years, over Thanksgiving and other weekends. It is clean, the price is right, it meets all basic needs. Even when we thought we would splurge for my 50th birthday and find another place to stay...we decided to come back to the Travel Inn. We are looking forward to the hotel, neighborhood, and good times. Don't be afraid to try this hotel. Free parking is a wonderful perk, the diner next door is fine, and the Theatre Diner up the street is good. Check out Cascina, our favorite Italian restaurant @ 9th and 45th.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: OttoScotland
Reviews.Content: We were visiting my sister in law in Washington DC for Christmas and had pre booked the Travel Inn so we could experience the sights and fun of New York at Christmas time. We were driving up from Washington so the free car parking was my initial reason for booking this hotel as well as the comments on this web site. We arrived 19 Dec 2005 and left 21 Dec 2005. I was not disappointed â€“ for the price I paid it was an excellent choice. As others have said how long do you spend in your hotel room in New York? The room we had was well furnished and clean. None smoking room and there was no smell that it had ever been smoked in. The beds were quite firm and the sheets and covers were all clean and crisp. I am quite fussy regarding cleanliness and I was quite happy with our room, the hotel reception, corridors and lifts. Our room was above reception and the street noise was not too bad apart from being woken up at 3am on our last night by New York fire department attending a fire in the subway which runs below the hotel. From our room we could see the Empire State building - nice at night with its holiday lighting. We arrived late morning before check in time but were allowed to park the car in the secure indoor car park so we could start exploring. The hotel also let us leave our car up until 5pm after we had checked out allowing extra time for sight seeing. The underground went on strike the day after we arrived but we still managed to see everything we wanted as the hotel is well situated being only 5-10 minutes from Times Square. Never felt threatened in the streets and side streets around the hotel. All in all I would definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great older hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel October 11-16, 2005. The desk staff was helpful and polite - checkin and checkout was fast and easy. The cleaning staff was friendly and did a wonderful job! Our room was very neat and clean. We were on the 4th floor and faced the police station, but we didn't notice much street noise. Great price - $125 per night booked online in advance - hard to get that price any place - but especially in NYC! There's also a free parking garage, which added even more value to the hotel for us (we drove from Oklahoma and it would have cost us at least $50 per day to park our car). Rooms may be small by some standards, but we were very comfortable. Showers worked fine and were very clean! While this hotel may be a bit older, we thought it was great! Close enough to get to Times Square and subway stations! (We also like the deli right next store, even if some consider it to be a hole-in-the wall. Good, basic sandwiches - and a wonderful hot breakfast!) Will definitely stay at the Travel Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Simple but clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel as we had no reservation for a room in NYC, we only stayed 1 night , Dec 12, they even gave us the room at 10:30 am and we where able to use it. Very clean and just fine for 1 night, rooms are old but pretty big for NYC standards, the parking is free for clients which is great and rare in Manhattan. It was just fine for the price, 125.00 USD , met lots of tourists in the hotel, from UK, Ireland and Netherlands. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Brilliant Value”
Reviews.Author: Alanmcquillan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights while on holiday in NYC. Brilliant location about 10 mins walk from Times Square. This is a basic hotel but excellent value. For $175 a night we had a large double double bedroom with a good sized bathroom. The decor is a mix of styles and in some areas it clearly looks a little worn but it is scrupulously clean and everything worked perfectly. Our room was to the front on the 6th floor facing 42nd Street. It was moderately noisy but not so bad that it disturbed us or stopped us sleeping at all. While we were there temperatures dropped to minus 7 degrees outside with snow and ice but the room was always warm without being stuffy. There is no restaurant in the hotel. There is a diner next door but it looked very seedy and down at heel. However, around 200m away is the Theatre Diner which was excellent and hotel guests get a 10% discount at lunch and dinner there. Above all, what made this place so great was the staff. They were very friendly and helpful at every stage and seemed very professional. The lady who runs the Tourist Kiosk is a delight - a real gem - very helpful and knowledgeable with sound advice and no sales pressure. Great stay. Great little hotel in ideal spot. I would use it again tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: manuribas
Reviews.Content: We were four (3 adults and a teenager), stayed for a week and decided to book this hotel after reading several reviews on NYC hotels of this site. We were given a room where we wanted (5th floor, pool's view), it was clean and proper, altough the space for four was a bit tight. Neighbourhood close to main attractions of NYC by foot or bus/metro, a few blocks from Times Square, Theater District, Empire State Building, Port Authority (buses) and Hudson River (NYC boat cruises). Much better than the ordinary Deli next door, walk some more meters on the same sidewalk and you'll find "Starwich", where you can eat superb sandwiches, have a chat with Mike (one of the owners) and relax in a very cosy and friendly ambiance. It's a must if you want a quality breakfast or a light meal! The only negative thing on the hotel: main desk male service is unhelpful and room cleaning ladies (of the 5th) are somehow rude.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Giving In The Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the travel Inn 20th-28th Nov in order to see the sights of New York, catch the Thanksgiving Parade and most importantly spend lots of money in the sales. The Hotel was just what we needed as a base to do all these things, clean and comfortable with a spacious room with 2 double beds for just the 2 of us. We were on the 4th floor above reception and had a great view of the Empire State building from our window. The Police station accross the road gives good piece of mind in a strange place and not once did we feel threatened walking aroun NYC. The decor was a bit dated and the bathroom needs a bit of tlc, but we were only there to sleep and change and it was a good value room so can't grumble. The Theatre Diner accross the road was excellent for good value food and will even deliver to your room if you don't fancy taking a trip outside, we found this very hand the day of the sales as we came back shattered after a 6am start at Macy's. The location was great just a 10 minute walk to Times Square, 15 to Macys and 20 to The Empire State so we got to see a lot of Mid Town by foot and used the subway at Times Square for the rest (much cleaner then the tube in London by the way). We are already talking about a trip to NYC next year and will definately look to book up again in the same hotel, why pay for a five star hotel when you are never going to be in it, you're better off booking a nice value hotel, and spending the saving in the shops instead

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Naiset
Reviews.Content: After travelling to New York regularly in different seasons, it was great to find this terrific hotel, especially for the super-high rate season of Christmas. The room rates are almost unbelievable compared to others in the same category and it's location is spectacular. The room was spacious, clean and comparable to ones for which I've paid twice the price. Only a few minutes walk from Times Square, the hotel is in that part of Manhatten that used to be called "Hell's Kitchen". The neighborhood is undergoing a big change and now has great new bars and restaurants scattered around. The little deli that's part of the hotel is good for breakfast, but you're only minutes from the Theatre District and all of it's famous restaurants. Being right on 42nd St - you're 2 blocks from the closest subway stop and the cross-town bus M42 stops right outside the door. Another thing that's great about the location is that there are few tall buildings around the hotel so you can actually have a magnificent of the Empire State Building from your room. I'm almost loath to recommend the hotel on the risk of it becoming too popular and prices going up. But if it hadn't been for Trip Advisor reviews we never would have stayed there. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic but clean and the beds were very comfortable. It is easy to walk to Times Sq and lots of places to eat within 5 mins walk. There are no tea or coffee making facilities and the plumbing is very noisy especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless!”
Reviews.Author: LLearn
Reviews.Content: This is a spotless hotel with free parking and in and out privileges...can't find another one like it in the city. Certainly not fancy...but clean and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Be Ready for the Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: NFnative
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Travel Inn along with another couple the weekend of Nov.19,2005. I have stayed here many times although I feel the real reason I stay here is the price rather than the quality of the hotel. They do offer free parking which is a plus, but I decided that I can no longer overlook the other areas that leave me a bit miffed. I had booked two non-smoking rooms and called a couple of days before to request that the rooms be located in the back of the hotel because if you get stuck facing 42nd Street, it's just as noisy as if you slept right on the sidewalk. When we arrived, our rooms were in the back, but they were smoking rooms. The desk said that when I called, they just gave me two rooms in the back without accomodating the non smoking request. I don't know why they simply didn't tell me if things were not going to be the same. So there we were on 42nd Street. The noise level is unbelievable at night. Right across from the Manhattan South police station. The garbage trucks backup alarms will wake you right up. You can't regulate the heat/AC in any of the rooms, just the fan speed. If you open your window because of it, the noise level is phenominal. The double/double rooms have received new matresses which are the hardest I have ever slept in. I have had to bring one of those foam pads with me to soften the feel in the past. The bathrooms are nice but very small, and the last several times I was there put up with mildew on the walls, and between the shower glass sliders. The rooms are a decent size. If you take a shower between 8-9:30am when the hotel is full, there is a great chance you will get stone cold water and the front desk (what else can they say) will tell you that a boiler is out. They have told me this on three different occasions. One time when I turned on the faucet for the bath, all that came out was rusty water, and I had to debate the head housekeeper for a new room. I suppose the straw that broke a camel's back was what happened to my friends down the hall. On our last night (Sunday) the hotel had plenty of rooms available. My friends wife was feeling ill and the toilet got plugged about 2AM in the morning. When she called to ask if they would send someone up, they didn't and would not even offer her another room to use the bathroom. Very ill, awake and angry, my friend and his wife left the hotel to find another bathroom somewhere in NYC at 2AM, and decided afterwards to simply leave and drive home. Not knowing this and calling them about 9AM to see where they might be on the road, they told me they were only about 5 miles from their homes (400 mile trip). Then the story came out. I decided to tell once and for all my experiences and to share theirs, so you may not be surprised if things don't work out if you visit there. I guess the reason I used to put up with all of this is not only did they have free parking, but their rates were quite low a few years back ($109-$139). For this weekend,we averaged $165 per night as NYC hotels have been getting higher rates, especially this year. Well, even though free parking is a plus, I would rather pay the $25-$30 and have a room that is not with mildew, with concrete matresses and possibly not on 42nd Street. I suppose it was easier to overlook all of this when the price was very reasonable, but this hotel is no bargain anymore free parking or no free parking. The back of the hotel is like an old motel with a common walkway between rooms that looks kind of cool, but if you decide to leave your window open, it is right at walkway level and vulnerable to being entered. You certainly wouldn't want to leave it open when you sleep either. Right at walkway level. Many people chose to overlook this and give the hotel a higher rating, but I have been to NYC about 35 times now and will no longer use the Travel Inn and my back is grateful. Believe me, over the course of your trip, don't be afraid to spend an extra $25 for parking. Yes, you do not spend your vacation in a hotel especially in NYC, however do yourself a favor and over the course of your 2-3 day stay, spend the extra $100 for the parking and choose a hotel that allows you to set your own temperature, has cleaner mildew free bathrooms, and matresses that won't make your back ache in the morning. You deserve better while you saved on parking.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for all attractions”
Reviews.Author: markbnyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days Nov '05 and found ourselves within 5-10 minutes walk of Times Square, from which there are many transport links to any part of the city. We walked from the hotel to Lower manhattan in around an hour (the best way to take in more of the city). The rooms are pretty basic, but all have cable TV and internet access and are clean and tidy. Anyone with a criticism of the hotel is spending too much time in their room and needs to get out and see the city! The hotel doesn,t have a restaraunt but being on 42nd street there are deli's, restaraunts, bars and everything else you could need within 5 minutes walk. Oh yes, its got an outdoor pool but not for me in November thankyou!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Dissapoint Us At All”
Reviews.Author: travelerjoyce
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a spacious, 2 double bed room in or on the fringes of the Theatre District and the Travel Inn fit the bill. We read all the reviews posted here and they were mixed, but even booking 3 months ahead for late September we couldn't find anything elsewhere under $200. We were pleased with our choice, it is nothing fancy but the staff are pleasant and the room was clean and fairly spacious, and we thought it a good value as we compare it to other places we've stayed in the big Apple. We made good use of the free safe usage at the front desk. I thought another reviewer said a small breakfast was included which was not the case. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay close to times square”
Reviews.Author: kiwigal
Reviews.Content: Just checked out today from a 2 night stay. Close to times square, very easy to walk. Bed was a bit small as my feet hung off the end when laying down (and i am not tall by any means. However once curled up to sleep bed was fine. Could hear the tv from the room next door when came back for a early night (midnight). Construction going on next door which woke us up at 7.00am. Free parking which was a great saving to be had and friendly staff. would stay again if couldn't get accommodation where i wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Hexab
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Travel Inn for 4 nights at the beginning of November, I was pleasantly surprised with the Travel Inn I feel it gives more of a motel feel than a hotel but for myself and the group I traveled with we preferred that (seemed to give an American movie feel). I have stayed in other hotels in New York but this is the only one I would return to, the staff were extremely helpful at all times of day or night, the rooms were a great size and there were no problems with room cleanliness at all. The only issue was the building site next door being woken up at 6am every morning was not fun, but then it seemed to quite down by 6.30-7am (so time for a bit more of a nap) but saying that wherever you go in NY thereâ€™s building work or street noise. In short the Travel Inn is great value for money and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comme Ci, Comme Ca...”
Reviews.Author: OOLONGJUNKIE
Reviews.Content: Well, the good stuff is the price, and a location that is fairly close to many cool things...I could not get internet access, wireless or otherwise, which I was supposed to get...and they said they were gonna charge me for it...but they didn't in the end...the other weird thing about this place is the bathroom...they have a shower door which is normal enough...but it's a mirrored shower door...which means it reflects light...and there is no light in the vicinity of the bath tub/shower...so it's like you are taking a shower in the dark...weird huh? Well, at least it is if you like to see what you are doing in the shower...other than that the place is fine...a lot cheaper than other spots in NYC...

Reviews.Title: “Annual Fall Mother/Daughter Trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel met all our needs and the Theater District location was central to all our shopping and sightseeing. Although we came in after a red-eye flight, the staff at the front desk were thoughtful and efficient. We appreciated the early check-in and convenience of the coffee shop next door. The double bed room (5th Floor poolside) and bathroom were quite clean, with daily attentive housestaff. The room was very pleasant, and the bathroom amenities (soap, shampoo and lotion), were quite nice, with the toiletries actually being used. The 42nd St Subway/Port Authority is just two blocks up, with lots of neighborhood restaurants and bakeries, between 7th-10th Ave and 43-50th St. There is a Police Station across the street, did not hear any activity, but always felt safe. Times Square is about four blocks up and there were always plenty of cabs in the area when needed. The lady in the gift shop was very helpful, as was the gentleman who held our luggage on departure day. It was very refreshing to actually have someone from the hotel, open the hotel door for us. Unfortunately, we did not experience this type of service from our last stay, in a large chain hotel. We may not get hotel "points" for staying here, but the service and thoughtfulness of the staff will definitely bring us back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Tidy Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Halford
Reviews.Content: Recently stopped at the Travel Inn for 8 Nights. Room we were allocated was at the rear of the Hotel. It was clean tidy with no damaged fittings. Clean towels were provided every day and the room cleaned to a satisfactory standard. Only problem was noise outside, there is building going on next door and for some reason they swop over the skips at midnight. This results in a hell of a lot of noise. Apart from this it was quiet within the hotel. Re normal outside noise, New York is noisy and loud - if you want somewhere quiet then go somewhere else. Overall the hotel was perfectly acceptable. The deli downstairs is also OK, the menu is a little limited but the food is hot, eatable and served quick. Location is good - 7 to 8 minutes to Times Square and the Metro, 5 minutes to the Circle Line boats, 15 minutes to Madison Square Garden. The area feels pretty safe - 42nd street is quite busy with alot of people passing through it and has a good police presence. It obviously gets busier as you get nearer Times Square. If I was to go to NY again I would definetly consider the Travel Inn again. You get what you pay for - a clean tidy basic hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Inn NYC”
Reviews.Author: quiltsnh
Reviews.Content: My son and I went to NYC on a bus trip this past week and part of the trip was accommodations at the Travel Inn. I had read the reviews and was prepared for a budget hotel. When we arrived it had a pleasant small lobby with a gift shop. Next door was the Deli. When we got to our room on the 4th floor we were pleasantly surprised. The room was large by comparison and very clean ... no stale smell. We felt very safe and the hotel was quiet except for what was going on outside. We faced the street with the police sation across the street. The location can not be beat..... about 4 blocks from TIme Square. We felt safe walking from there after dinner. At the other end of the street is the Hudson RIver and it is 2 blocks. This is where the Grey Line Circle tours depart. A walking trail along the river. The Intrepid is docked there at the end of the street. The Deli next door suplied lunch and also breakfast very good and very reasonable for NYC. All and all a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain but you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Gryphon_abroad
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends first trip to New York and what a way to start. The room stank our best description was it was a combination of smoke and of urine. Maybe smoke isn't so bad but why give the choice of a smoking or non smoking room? Anyway by the time we had been directed to our 3rd "non-smoking" room (which was also stinking of smoke but less of urine) we decided that we weren't going to get any better here. We put up with this hotel and still had a great time in New York. The location of the hotel is first class and in a reasonably safe area. It isn't exactly a quiet hotel but it is NYC after all. The staff were fine and friendly as long as you didn't ask anything of them. The room was cheap but adding in the cost of cleaning all clothes afterwards that adopted the stench and the 2 cans of Febreeze we used and we'll be staying somewhere else next time. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franr123
Reviews.Content: 6 ladies stayed in 2 double rooms at this hotel for 2 nights before a cruise out of NYC. We had absolutely no complaints. 1 room overlooked the pool and was very quiet and the other on the 5th floor overlooked the street but we didn't find the street noise bad. Safe & clean. Walking distance to everything we wanted to see. Evangaline in gift shop made arrangements for a van to take us to our cruise and saved us about $50. Unless you really want to pay "big bucks" for a fancy hotel, stay here. We will again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my son to New York for his 10th birthday. I didn't want to spend all my money on the hotel but since I was travelling with my son, I didn't want a flea-bag hotel. I researched the Travel Inn and thought it would fit the bill. I was prepared for a total no-frills, worn-out but safe hotel. I was pleasantly surprised with everything. The staff was very nice. The lobby was small but attractive. The free parking was great, I even left the car there for 5 hours after I checked out. The room was very clean and in great shape. We had two double beds and still had plenty of room to walk around. Our television did not work all that well but I did not call to have it fixed because my son watches enough tv at home. The location is very convenient with a subway stop just a couple blocks away. We could also walk to Times Square in about 15 minutes, maybe less if you are not walking with my son. We did take taxis at night but that was because my son was exhausted. I recommend the Natural History Museum, we never made it off of the dinosaur floor and we were there for 3 hours. Also, we had a great dinner at Blue Hill down near Washington Square. It's not really a place for a ten year old but I am a chef (I have to check out the restaurant scene) and my son is a very adventerous eater. He had the five course tasting menu and just about finished everything. He was even given a tour of the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Unsanitary Conditions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before my boyfriend and I booked our room at the Travel Inn, I read countless reviews about the hotel. A LOT of people had a ton of great things to say about the hotel so I was really looking forward to staying there. Unfortunately, the experience has been a NIGHTMARE. The staff seemed nice, but they are incredibly lazy. We checked in late and kind of looking forward to relaxing after the long plane ride there (from California). Our room was plain and it looked clean, but when we walked into the bathroom, it had a very strong smell of URINE. AND I was going to go pee, but there were dookie stains on the toilet seat and it was disgusting. I checked the shower and there was still hair on the tub and used portions of soap from the people who stayed there before us. It was GROSS. When we lifted up the covers on the bed, there was a pubic hair just lying there. I couldn't take it anymore... I called the front office and someone came in to "clean" the bathroom. Housekeeping you ask??? NOOOO.. at Travel Inn, the maintenance guy does the cleaning at night. He didn't even clean anything, he sprayed the bathroom with PLEDGE... a wood cleaner! and then he said, "See? All clean." In my head, I was thinking oh hell no. I complained the second time and the same guy came in, with windex and he started cleaning our bathroom with a rag. A little better... BUT he used the same rag he was wiping the toilet with on the bathroom walls!!!! I couldn't believe my eyes! I was just glad I was there to see them clean because after that, I wanted to get out of that room and be placed in a different one. The management there is awful. I complained to the manager the next morning, and all he gave me was a complimentary coupon for a free drink at the Theater Row restaurant (which is horrible, by the way). What a joke. I hate to complain so much but I've never seen a room more disgusting than the one we were in. I'm never going to stay there again. By the way, the deli next door is great. That's the only good that came out of staying at that smelly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Travel Inn was great! I was traveling with a friend, both of us young college student females. This hotel was well within our budget at $125 a night, and it was so nice to come home to a clean, air conditioned room at the end of each day. If I had had the time I wish I could have enjoyed the pool and workout room. The guys at the front desk were great as well! Recommend for anyone who isn't expecting bell hops and complimentary breakfasts, but who enjoys a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend in a 2 Double bed room during a hot spell in mid- September. Very reasonable for the location. Small lobby, but rooms clean (and with an old but amazingly effective AC unit). Reception staff efficient. Had some lunch in Deli across the street but try out the Theater Diner 4 blocks up on 42nd - excellent. Hotel booked a private limo service back to JFK ($75 incl tip of $15) which was excellent but be warned - daytime traffic can mean spending an hour plus getting to JFK. Plenty to see and do about the immediate area. However there is ongoing construction right next door and hammering begins at 7am and I suggest this work will continue for some months yet. All in all a very good experience in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Clean, and Safe!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed from the end of August to early Sept. We had terrrific service, a clean, good sized room and a safe place to stay. We paid $140/night and thought it was a fair price in light of the location. Our 11 year old daughter swam daily after the long hot, days in the city. We walked to the subway, harbor, theaters, etc. We'd definitely return. Thanks you Travel Inn

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: syncopation1234
Reviews.Content: First of all, I saved considerable $$$ by booking this hotel on their own website, as opposed to booking through the better known online hotel booking sites. So first suggestion is to google this hotel's website and book directly. I traveled with spouse and two daughters for a last-minute planned trip to NYC. Hotel is inexpensive for NYC, and the parking is free, *with* in-and-out privileges (although we kept the car in the garage for the 3 days we were in NYC). This is almost unheard of in NYC, where some valet services charge $40 a day, and no in/out privilege! So, for people taking a car trip, a plus! (only be prepared to be very patient when parking your car as the spaces are quite tight and you donâ€™t want to hit a pillar or someone elseâ€™s vehicle!) For a "budget" hotel right in Manhattan not far from Times Square, this hotel was actually quite good. The rooms are compact and clean, and the lobby is small but not shabby. The staff (front desk, housekeeping, garage, etc.) were all most helpful and polite (The elevators were rather slow, but this is a minor issue.) No, this place is not the Pierre or the Ritz or the Mandarin Oriental, some things are not "perfect", but it is by and large good value for your money. Our teenage daughters used the swimming pool for about 30 mins one day, the pool is outdoors off the third floor in a rather quaint "courtyard" setting.... refreshing after a rather muggy morning visiting Central Park.... There is no restaurant officially "in" the hotel, but there is a "Broadway deli" directly across the garage entrance from the lobby, and the breakfasts there were adequate to get you started on your day walking and riding around Manhattan. There is another good breakfast diner just East on the south side of W42nd at the corner of Dyer. Hotel is on corner of W42nd Street and 10th Ave. So Times Square (Seventh and 42nd) is 3 blocks or about 10-15 minute walk depending on the crowds. There were lots of people about, so it felt fairly safe, but one should always be vigilant when strolling in NYC anywaysâ€¦ The hotel has a small souvenir store and the friendly lady there was able to book the Gray Line bus tours there, so you can avoid the hucksters waving the pamphlets in your face at every street corner. So if you are going to book the Gray Line tour, go through her, and then walk over to Eighth Avenue and a little north to W47th to the Gray Line bldg to get your ticket. We found the Eighth avenue embarcation point for the Gray Line buses handier than the crowds one block over at Times Sq. Speaking of which, Times Square was cleaned up by Rudy Giuliani, it is no longer the seedy smutty dump it was 25 years ago.
