Our kids (and us) particularly enjoyed the Hard Rock cafe, Virgin megastore, Toys R Us, etc... plus the Gray Line tours all leave from there. (see above paragraph). In conclusion, this hotel is not a fancy hotel to lounge around at, but if you are looking for a clean, small room, with friendly service, right in downtown Manhattan, with free parking, then I recommend the Travel Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal”
Reviews.Author: dueller2
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here Aug 7-12. We had a 4th floor room overlooking the pool. Parking was included in our rate, which was $125 a night (booked several months back in April). The hotel, and especially our room, was clean. The beds were firm and comfortable. The deli next door had good food for breakfast and was inexpensive. The Theatre Row Diner two blocks away was excellent any time of day and very, very reasonable, with an extensive menu selection. We were a short walk away from the Circle Line Cruise and about 4 blocks from the subway. The gift shop was reasonable---we bought 3 decent quality t-shirts for $10 total, and another t-shirt for $12 with an "I Love NY" souvenir coffee mug included in the price with the shirt. The guys parking the cars were great---the desk staff were sometimes a bit abrupt. The hotel is two, short left turns from the Lincoln Tunnel, and two short lefts and a right back on. This property was a good deal for the price, and we'd definitely book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aqchick
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a girls weekend in NYC, where we stayed at the Travel Inn. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to the action while still staying within a modest budget. We were only about 4 blocks from where the action of NYC started and we walked everywhere we went. The rooms were a little small, but they were clean. We had an excellent view of the Empire State Building from our hotel room. We also had a deli right next door that served really good "NYC" food where we ended up eating 2 out of the 3 days that we were there. I would definently stay there again when I come back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this well-located hotel for 2 weeks in June, 2005. We paid $114 per night. It was located right at the bus stop for the No. 42 Bus which runs along 42nd Street, it was just a short walk to the Circle Line Tour Ferry and it was a short walk to the Westway Diner in 9th Avenue, and TheatreRow Diner, 1 block up in 42nd Street. Instead of taking the bus, we easily walked to the Subway at Times Square. Initially, we were placed on the 3rd floor, adjacent the elevator and the soda machine and which was, also, the entrance and exit for the pool. After two nights of little sleep due to the continual noise from the elevator and guests trundling their suitcases over the tiles on the foyer floor, we asked to be relocated. This was eventually done graciously and we enjoyed the remainder of our stay in this 25-hour a day city.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To stay”
Reviews.Author: RGT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights. The room was large and clean. Our room was on the 7th floor, overlooking the pool. Also had a great view of the Empire State Building! Staff was extremely helpful,especially the lady in the gift shop. She really knows New York! Location was a very big plus, along with the FREE underground secured parking area. The deli next door was also very good and reasonable. In room wireless internet access is available for $5.95/24Hrs. We had a great time visiting New York!

Reviews.Title: “The best deal in the Big Apple!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay here again when we come to New York. The rooms were large and clean. Everyone on the staff was friendly and helpful including the front desk, parking attendants, and concierge. The chambermaids remembered our request for extra towels. All provided better than average service. The facility and amenities are excellent! We didn't use the pool, but it was large and clean. Good location for tourists, too!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the size of the room, the price of the room, the neat little deli next door (great place for breakfast) and, especially, the location of the inn. We were driving in from Philadelphia and leaving there for the Berkshires. Quick in through the Lincoln Tunnel, Quick out along 12th. FREE PARKING while we were there. Great access to the shows on 44th. Our room actually faced 42nd and would have been a bit noisy -- we do, however, travel with a white sound machine just for cases like this. Knowing this, if I stayed there again, I would request one of the rooms back toward the swimming pool. Staff is friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here if visiting New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Service and Location, Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With all of the good reviews that this hotel had on this website, we booked through AAA with the hopes that it would just be clean and safe. Needless to say, we were completely blown away by what we found, a true treasure for people looking to visit NYC and to be close to Times Square and the theater district. The location of the hotel is perfect. Located on West 42nd street, the hotel is central to everything New York city has to offer. We saw the Lion King (also highly recommended) and was only three blocks from the theater. We were only about 5 blocks from Times Sqaure, 2 blocks from the Circle line sightseening cruises and about 8 blocks from 34th street which houses Macy's and many other large stores. If safety is a concern for you and your family you can rest assured as there is a police substation right across the street. We constantly felt a police presence and to be honest we were out and about late during our stay and never felt uncomfortable once. The hotel itself has a nice lobby with a very accommodating staff and a gift shop/tourist information center where you can get everything from souvenirs to tour and theater tickets. The room was very large compared with most Manhattan hotel rooms. We had a king sized bed, chair, desk with chair and fridge and microwave. The room was very clean. We are very concious of hotel dirt and looked and couldn't find any. The sheets were clean and crisp and the bathroom was spotless. The bed wasnt the most comfortable in the world, but after walking around NYC all day, you won't even notice. There is pay internet access in the lobby and purchasable internet access and Nintendo 64 games in the room. (Both for about $8.00 per hour). There is room service from a restaurant down the street that is a very extensive menu and free delivery. The TV service could have been better. The reception was awful and there weren't many channels, but again, with walking around Manhattan all day, you won't notice. However, that was really the only problem. We really liked this hotel and we plan on staying here for each of our annual trips to NY from now on. It is in a great location and has a great price. We paid around 140 a night before taxes which is a great price for its quality and location. Some other recommendations is you are looking for food: BB King's lounge is right down the street 3 blocks away and has a restaurant called Lucille's grill. Absolutley fantastic food. The small restaurant right next to the travel inn is a great hidden breakfast and lunch place. We ate breakfast there every morning we were in NY and it was a great sandwich place as well. The ESPN Zone in Times Square was a great restaurant as well. Try the marinara sauce, doesn't look all that appetizing but its the best we've ever had at a restaurant. Other than that, enjoy, NYC is a terrific vacation spot with something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Well Pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in late June-room comfortable, clean, good size-service was excellent-bath a little small-was on back overlooking pool so noise was not a problem-deli next door was great for breakfast-probably 15 minutes walking to Times Sq.-only a few blocks to subway-overall, I was very pleased and would certainly consider it again

Reviews.Title: “excellent, clean, and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: icedkachang
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in July. I highly recommend it! It is a clean, affordable hotel in a central location. It is about a 5 block walk to Times Square, 1 block from a post office, 2 blocks from Gray Line tours stop (where you can do the hop-on, hop-off double decker tourist bus tours), two blocks from the Pier where you can do the Circle Line boat tour of Manhatten. So it is a great location for any tourist. And best of all, it is ACROSS THE STREET from a police station!!! So despite the fact it is super noisy (sirens going off all the time), we felt extremely safe!!! Rooms are very nice, much nicer compared to alot of other two star hotels, beds were comfortable, the air conditioning works extremely well to the point of being cold! bathrooms are very clean and we got plenty of towels and toiletry products left every morning. the hotel even has a pool, which we unfortunately did not get around for using. there is a little gift shop that sells everything you need- beauty products, umbrellas, maps, etc. I thought all the staff were WONDERFUL. there is a GREAT deli next door, we had breakfast here every morning, there is a great selection of sandwiches etc, friendly service. There is even a grocery store (food emporium) a few blocks up. I thought this was a great deal for the price i paid (around $208/nite canadian, booked through expedia) and i don't think you will find anything quite so nice in most of manhatten for this price range.

Reviews.Title: “10 minutes from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found this excellent hotel via our French travel agency and we haven't been disappointed at all. its facilities are: swimming-pool (supervised by a member of staff), well-equiped gym facilities, a deli, and a delivery service. Rooms are done everyday and are air-condiionned The staff is nice. Breakfast is not included. Don't phone from your room cause I've spent 25 dollars in 2 days for a few international call. (2 minutes on a French mobile will cost you more than 5 dollars!) The hotel is situated at 515 West 42nd Street. It's 10 minutes from the subway and 15 minutes from Times Square. It's also 5 minutes from the Circle Line Cruise's departure. We would recommand this hotel as it was cheap for its comfort and quality: about 100 dollars per night for a double room which could welcome four people!

Reviews.Title: “Just far enough off the strip...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights from June 27-July 2. Front desk was helpful and friendly. We were allowed into our room early. It faced the pool on the fifth level - could barely hear street noise. A good ten minute walk to Times Square. Room was made up, vacuumed and replenished daily - nice to come back to after a long day of touring. Rooms are average size. The Double/Double was perfect for two people. Bathroom was small, but in good condition. Shower head was tall (which is unusual and a plus for tall people) and water pressure powerful. Pool was refreshing, but had limited hours (11 - 6:50). Only complaint would be that the elevators are small and hot, fortunately there are only seven stories - so not too long of a ride. I will stay here in the future and refer all to plan to stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Inn Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rajbfy
Reviews.Content: Great Place. We stayed there in first weeek of May. Excellant location. Freindly people. Delli across the hotel is great. Only things beds and room are small for 4 people in the room. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Gingee
Reviews.Content: We came in very late on May 27th (really morning of May 28th). We had no problem getting our room. We had a back room which was pretty quiet except for a train that went through at one point. The room was clean and well kept up. We were on the seventh floor in the corner. It was fairly quiet. We started to hear people around nine in the morning. We didn't have really warm water in this room. Maybe everyone was taking showers at the same time. We stayed there two nights. After our cruise (out of NYC), we stayed there June 6th and 7th. This time we had a room on the fifth floor on the street side. The room was warm. We thought it was because we could hear the outside (like the window wasn't shut right). We played around with the window and it seemed to be a little quieter. The next day we called down to the desk and told them that the room was warm. They promptly sent up a repairman and he said a valve was turned off. It got cooler after that. We had warmer water in this room. The pool area is nice. The young woman at the gift shop was very helpful telling us where to go in NYC. We were within walking distance of Times Square. We walked all over in the area. There is people there all hours of the night. We didn't feel scarred at any time. There is a CVS across the street (good for cheap snacks). If we ever go back to NYC, we would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I just returned from New York where we spent 5 nights at the Travel Inn. I booked this property because it was reasonably priced and got pretty good reviews at Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed by this property at all, as it was exactly what I had expected- in fact better. It offered a clean comfortable room. The room and the hotel showed some signs of wear, but nothing that wasn't acceptable. The bathroom was a little small and while it was ok for us, it might be a problem for some. In particular, the toilet is in a tight space that doesn't leave you much space. A big person might find that uncomfortable. The hotel is 7-8 blocks to Time Square and there's a supermarket just one block away. I grabbed a couple of sandwiches at the deli next door and they were pretty good. Also, this hotel is only about 3 blocks to the Hudson River which might have made for an interesting sidetrip had I realized it before I was being driven back to the airport. All in all, I found the Travel Inn to be a nice little hotel close to everthing and I would recommend this to anyone who wants to stay close to Time Square without paying a small fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ookpik
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel from June 7 - 10. We were both impressed...very clean, the maids brought us fresh towels, soap, and toilet paper everyday and made the beds. Service was prompt..my friend and I used the WebTV and had a problem with our keyboard, so she called the front desk and someone was there within five minutes. He didn't know how to deal with the problem, and said the manager would be on shift in twenty minutes, and he would deal with it. Fifteen minutes later he showed up with the manager, and the problem was fixed. Room was cool, air conditioning worked fine. Police station across the street, we felt safe. Location is good, walk out the front door, turn left, walk a bit and you were in Times Square. I would stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: goflynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June 8-13, probably the hottest days of the month of June. We were so glad to have a nice pool and air conditioning that worked! The rooms are large by Manhattan standards. Typical size rooms, really. Large enough for myself, husband and 2 kids, and the crib fit with plenty of room to spare. The staff were friendly enough. The room was clean and quiet. Free parking in the secure garage clinched the deal! We paid $125 a night, and found that was a screaming deal in Manhattan! We were put in a room overlooking the railroad tracks, but with the window shut, you'd never notice the trains going by. The pool was fantastic, open 11-7 every day but one, when there was a bad thunderstorm. There's a police station across the street, and of course, Manhattan can be noisy, but I found it much noiser on Monday morning when the city went back to work, than it was on the weekend. We felt safe and secure, and the hotel is pretty central, so you can get to the subway close by, and the bus. My only gripe is that the bathroom is a bit tight, and nearly impossible to bathe a 2 year old with the sliding doors on the bathtub, but we managed. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Travel Inn three times before. It was what you would have expected from an economy hotel--basic, somewhat dingy lodging and an indifferent staff. This time, we were given a smoking room despite requesting a nonsmoking room. We did not find this out until we actually got to the room. It reeked--a hazard to our highly allergic daughter. The manager offered no apology, no room change (he said they were completely booked), and no assistance in finding another hotel room in New York, even at one of the other hotels in the Empire Hotel Group. He did offer to "spray" the room and get us a nonsmoking room the next day. Since we could not stay in this room, we called other hotels and found an excellent one that understands customer service. Upon our checking out, the manager was rude and completely failed to understand why he had a disgruntled customer. He made no attempt to remedy the situation or make even a token offer to acknowledge the inconvenience the hotel had caused. He even threatened to charge us for the room if we had used the bathroom while we were searching for another place to stay. And he refused several requests to tell me if he had put any charges on my credit card. So, stay here if you want an inexpensive place and have minimal expectations for customer service. Stay away if you expect the staff to take the word "accommodation" seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Free Parking”
Reviews.Author: TANYA66
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great for Times Sq or SS Intrepid/Harbour Cruises only a few hundred yards walk to either and therefore central enough you can reach anywhere. We were travelling coast to coast so the free parking was a bonus for us. We stayed 3 nights and for Â£87 per room per night incl parking was great value for NYC. I would definantely recommend to car users for value & location. Even if I was travelling without a car I would still consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: duffus07
Reviews.Content: Travel Inn Manhattan was perfect for us.We stayed in a room overlooking the pool for 2 nights .Very quiet.Easy 10 minute walk to Times Square.Pleasant staff and reception friendly but reserved.They kindly allowed us to store our bags for a few hours on our last day before going back to the airport.New York hotels are not the same standard as other cities.The beds were quite hard.But for 125.00 per night its a good deal.The remote wouldnt work on the second morning.House keeping were in the area and fixed it straight away.I felt safe the whole time in NY and having the Police across the road made me feel more secure.We used the New York Pass for one day and the hotel was very convienent to Circle Line ferry and Intrepid Musuem.Madame Tussauds was just down the road also.There is a good deli next door for breakfast.Cheap and fast and tasty.Also just down the road back towards Times Square is a supermarket for all the extra things you need.Throughly recommend for location,nice quiet room and good price.The pool was closed.But it was the start of May and only 64c outside and a really cold wind chill so the pool wasnt an option for us.Would easily stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel. A Great Find.”
Reviews.Author: Irishdancer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from the 21st May - 26th May. With my husband and four kids and my brother. We were all very pleased with this Hotel. The maid cleaned everyday, only she didn't manage to clean to top of the headboard for some reason. It was quite dusty. The bathroom was clean with clean fresh towels in everyday. Television and playstation in the bedroom. We asked for two double non smoking rooms. I have a feeling that someone had used them to smoke in, there was a faint smell of smoke. We were given rooms overlooking the street. It was very noisy. It was even more noisy when the construction men decided to dig up the road at 1.00 AM in the morning. No one got any sleep that night. The rooms were very hot also, we didn't want to open the windows as we had young children with us. The people on the front desk were nice not overly pleasant but ok. The deli next door gets very busy on a morning so get down early. There is a new restaurant up the road called The Theatre Diner, this is very nice, very clean and the food is lovely. Would I stay again most definately.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal value”
Reviews.Author: YokelRidesAgain
Reviews.Content: I can't describe this place as a bargain, even in the most expensive city in the USA. Four nights came to 710 US$, all told. For this I was given a smoking room despite requesting the opposite, and the entrance to my room was through a separate set of elevators requiring a walk through a...scenic...New York City parking garage. Bathroom was spacious, although I had to fiddle with the shower faucet to make the hot water work. Egregriously, the cable TV did NOT include YES...at least I had tickets to the Bombers' games...but most of you probably didn't come to NYC to watch Yankee games. The Empire Hotel group has a far better bargain in the Hotel Newton. Location here is the major advantage; if you really want to be close to Times Square (why?), this is one of the better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & location”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller31
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in May. We had a double double room on 6th floor overlooking the pool. The room was clean and comfortable. Bathroom small. It took the hot water 5 minutes (yes 5 minutes!) to travel along the plumbing to our room. We called the reception and someone came to our room and told us yes thats right it will take 5 minutes. (What a waste of water) The hotel was well located although a little seedy area. I felt safe being across the road from the Police station. There is a great Deli next door to the hotel. The heating the the room was great, although there was no fridge. We paid $160 pn for Thur & Friday and $195 for Saturday night. Location is great - only 10 min walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 29/4 for 4 nights with family on a last minute trip which left our usual choice of hotel (Hyatt Grand Central) unavailable. Was a bit worried about the area before I arrived, but glad to say that the surrounding area is busy with plenty of people around which is reassuring at night. Found this hotel about the same walking distance from 42nd st/Times Square as the Hyatt. The hotel itself is fine, rooms are comfortable and fairly large for New York. House keeping was good the room was spotless every day. As previous reviewers have stated the two guys on the front desk can be a bit abrupt, but we mostly dealt with the two woman receptionists who were brilliant nothing was a hassle, any time I asked a question they treated me like a person not an annoyance, a very bad habit the Hyatt rececption staff have developed. My only complaint was the street noise, we had a room at the front and my young brother is a light sleeper which caused problems. On the whole if we could get a room at the back I would stay here again. Although not Hyatt standard, the staff are friendlier also the big advantage is that this hotel is a lot cheaper which means more money to spend in the shops.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargin!”
Reviews.Author: ukdiva
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend the last weekend of April - Fri - Tues. Great location, very close to Times Sq without all the hectic-ness that comes along with staying in actual Times Sq. The rooms were good, a fair size, clean and the maid service was faultless. It was also no problem for us to leave our bags after we checked out so we could go out in NYC before catching our flight back to the UK, and also no charge, unlike some other Manhattan hotels. Unlike the last reviewer, our heating worked, and when left on while we were out at night, made our room roasting hot, so much so, we had to open the windows to cool down! Didn't use the gift shop or next door deli so can't comment on that, but did have a few drinks in a bar around the corner on 10th St which was fab! I think it was called Biggs, but don't quote me! *lol* I'd definately stay here again, for the price, this hotel is a very good bargin! We are already planning another trip over in Nov.

Reviews.Title: “Close but no cigar...”
Reviews.Author: jarah9
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this establishment, we chose it because of the good reviews it had gotten on this site as well as its somewhat reasonable per night cost. We stayed 4 nites but were somewhat disappointed by the hotel. Here is my list of pros and cons. Pros: Near Times Square, subway station, CVS, Food Emporium, Kraft Restaurant Not too small a room Maid service was amazing, made the room impeccable every morning Front desk and garage security attendants were nice and helpful Cons: The pillows are paper thin, I had to call to get some more, but they were quick to send some to us, so that was not a problem. The real problem is as follows: We were in a double double in front of the pool, when we came out of the room we were directly outside, in the cold weather. Our door had no insulation, the cold wind passed through every nite and we froze like ice cubes. There is no heating system in the room, its the equivalent of living in a cardboard box weather wise. So if you reserve a double double, please ask it be inside and not outside!! This was quite discouraging and I hope they seek to change this situation for future guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great place on a budget”
Reviews.Author: nedfree1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights, arriving April 18, with wife, 16 yo son and 19 yo daughter in no smoking double double on 3rd floor near pool on inside. Relatively quiet with only passing by type hallway pedestrian noise. Check in was fair at best with 2 rude gentlemen behind the desk. I mentioned that we had requested a fridge and one of the guys said it was impossible and we could never get one. I checked with a young lady the next morning, she made a phone call and we had one within 5 minutes! Bathroom was smallish - wish it had the sink outside the bathroom itself. The location is great - near subway and easy bus access on 42nd street. The deli next door is nice and the Food Emporium about 3/4 block to the east was very handy. Evangeline, I hope that's correct, in the gift shop was extremely pleasant and helpful when it came to places to eat, directions, etc. We paid $150/night off the hotel's website which was quite good for 4 people. I would certainly stay there again and would recommend it to all with similar situations.

Reviews.Title: “Better than what we expected”
Reviews.Author: sotanghon6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thought the hotel was nicer than what we expected out of a 2-star hotel. The room was clean and spacious. The location of the hotel is excellent - close to subway stations and to Times Square but distant enough from most of the traffic noise around Times Square. The staff were all friendly, helpful and accomodating. We were arriving very late at night from Virginia, and we thought that it was very nice of someone from the hotel to call us to make sure we were still checking in. This ensured us that we were not losing our hotel reservation for coming too late. The free parking was awesome especially since parking in NY is herendous. My only complaint was that the hotel rates were not too reasonable, but then again, this was NYC where all of the hotel rates are overly excessive. Also, the bathroom was a bit small - this wasn't too big of a problem except that there wasn't much room to place toiletries and clothes. My husband and I would check in at Travel Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: mtlandm
Reviews.Content: Gem of a hotel! Great value prices with nice, clean rooms. Free parking was a plus. Service was friendly and prompt, and we felt very safe. Street noise was loud, but we expect that in NY! Room was a little hot/stuffy, so we opened the window and door to get a nice cross-breeze. Would stay again, but not in summer unless there is AC (our room apparently didn't have it). Overall, very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: newyawkgawker
Reviews.Content: Two families traveling together April 3rd thru 6th, we got next door rooms on the third floor facing the street. The room was very clean, some street noise but what do you expect in NY, heavy curtains that blocked the light from the window, friendly but not intrusive staff. We paid $436. inc. taxes for 3 nights for a double/double. Room was larger than I expected at this price, fine for us. We drove in via the Linclon Tunnel, the hotel at 10th on 42nd St. was three blocks away & very easy to get to - and parking in their attended garage attached to the hotel was included. The desk let us check in 2 1/2 hours early, then let us leave our luggage & van in the garage for most of the day we checked out at no extra charge. Location was very good, three blocks from Times Square, two blocks from a subway station (five minute walk). No coffeemaker, but a decent deli next door to hotel for that necesary first cup. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel April 3rd thru April 7th Spring Break 2005. It is located on 10th and W.42nd street.(Helpful information if your traveling by cab from the airport.) We had 2 rooms (there were 6 of us) My mother, my husband and 3 children. We stayed in rooms 404 and 405. Perfect view of the empire state buliding. It is spectacular at night. This place was awesome. We had no fridge but I noticed when the maid was cleaning the room across from us they had a fridge. No matter we didnt need one. The ice bucket did fine. Evangilne is the lady that runs the small but cute gift shop. It is open at 7:00 am. She is a wealth of knowledge. She told us where to dine what to see how to get there. She was a true asset to our vaction. She reccomended the Trollie Deli. About 2blocks down on 42nd street. Great food great for the budget. Again very small place. But everything in new york is small. Also a bar and grill she reccomended it was called Mr . Biggs. It was right on 10th street. I had a plate of nachos like you wouldnt believe! The front desk was great. I had some noisy people in the next room and he took care of it instantly. Our room faced the street. It was noisy but that is New York. We had the windows open and there is construction going on on our side of the street and every morning at 7:41 a very loud bus or something goes by and woke us up. But that was ok. We wanted to get up and get going for the day. NO NEED for an alarm clock.!!! The place is clean the staff is great and I would definetly stay again! Thumbs up totally. For a family of six with 2 rooms this is the greatest. Not alot of amenities besides the pool and free parking, but nice clean cheap and comfortable. We paid 125.00 per night. 582.00 for the total stay for each room. Thanks for making my first trip to New York great Travel inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were sure glad we read some review before we booked into a NY hotel. We happened to see during our stay some others that we had considered - and they looked dreadful. This place was clean, tidy, well situated and reasonably priced - who could ask for more?

Reviews.Title: “Clean, accommodating, Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tonitraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 4/4/05 for one night. Hotel staff was very helpful in check-in, providing directions, maps, information. The best part was the FREE PARKING. Room was very clean, beds were extremely comfortable. Our room was quiet though it overlooked the pool which was closed for the season. I will definitely stay here again. It was easy to find and access. All my fears about staying in NYC were assuaged by this one stay. Be advised: It is not the Ritz, but it is certainly clean, accommodating, and and professional in its presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TripperTrotter
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with 2 double beds through the hotel website and paid $105 per night (excl of tax). Not in the best area of Manhattan but a three block walk from Times Square and 5 minutes to the Port Authority (for buses, subway, trains). Very big rooms by Manhattan standard and clean. It is worth mentioning that it is the first hotel I stayed in where they actually cleaned underneath the bed! Two drawbacks: the noisy heating system and the traffic (if you get a room facing the street). Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better value!”
Reviews.Author: vnilla
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The FREE parking was the icing on the cake. Room was very clean, had enough room. Our room was a double, double. It faced the street, was noisy with the window up, but everything else was great. Always had plenty of towels, no complaints at all. Staff were nice. If you want a place to stay that's clean and you don't have to be pampered, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Bring a flask ...”
Reviews.Author: Pengegon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travel Inn for 8 days and was mostly very pleased. The room was clean and huge and the staff were unobtrusive and pleasant. I would advise visitors here to ask for a back room on one of the top floors, I stayed on a front room on the 5th and the traffic noise was very noticeable. Though I do recommend this hotel, particularly for its location just a short walk from Times Square, I would advise anyone contemplating a visit to bring a flask so they may have a hot drink in the mornings. I paid a not-inconsiderable sum for my room and was very disappointed to find it had no tea/coffee making facilities nor a refrigerator. Both of these I consider pretty essential, especially for a lengthy stay. And in the summer, how on earth can you have a hotel room with no fridge? Overall then, I consider the Travel Inn, Manhattan, to be a good, convenient, place to stay but it does have its drawbacks. Would I stay there again? Yes, but only in winter and I would bring a very large flask.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place / Great Value / Free Parking!!!”
Reviews.Author: RaZor_Edge
Reviews.Content: Travel Inn is a really great deal in Manhattan!!! Easy access by car and a free parking!!! Incredible location on the 42nd, 3 minutes from Time Square!! There is a Police Station on the other side of the road (secure place). We'll stay there again next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a bargain price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travel Inn in NYC Feb.23-26. We spent an amount of time on this website trying to find a place to stay that suited our needs- clean, affordable, and close to everything. This is definitely it! This hotel was within walking distance to Times Square (where you can catch any of the major subway routes), restaurants, and the theater district. The free parking was a HUGE plus- we left the car inside for 3 days and never had to worry about it, or pay for it! The room was clean and comfortable for a family of 4, and the front desk staff was very helpful with directions, etc. The next time we come to NYC, we will definitely be staying here! YOu can't beat it for value and location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Economical Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Travel Inn on recommendation from friends in New York without even seeing the Trip Advisor comments. I would recommend staying here if you are on a budget, we only paid $120+ Tax for the night for a twin double bedded room for 3 of us. The Deli / Cafe is next door and offers a great breakfast. Over the road from the hotel is the South NYPD Police station which means there is always Police around, giving you a safe feeling. It's walking distance from 34th St Penn Station and most other parts of the City.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Savvy Stay Here! & Students get a Discount!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: no frills.....perfect. who spends time in their hotel room in new york? it was perfect to come back, take a nap and go back out. the pool in July was such an added bonus!!! staff was friendly, there's a police station across the street and the subway is sooo close and it was all centrally located. The student discount was GREAT!!! I try and stay here when I make it back, but I guess the secret is out of the bag..it's always booked solid! Have a great time and check out the piano bar in the village called The Duplex. Saw more talent there than on the grammy's.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Travel Inn!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love Travel Inn! This is one economic hotel in NYC where the staff really cares about their customers! They are helpful and respectful! The rooms are very clean, well kept and roomy! The area feels safe! The free indoor parking is a real plus! The deli next door serves a great breakfast/lunch! This hotel is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: KathyCollins1
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel room and very courteous staff. Nice cafe next door to get breakfast. Takes about 10 minutes to walk to Times Square. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Less than accomodating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Could not control heat ... just on/off switch. No thermostat in room. One slow elevator and a "gift" shop the size of a postage stamp (that has been closed 2 of 3 days). Wireless Internet access does not reach upper floors and printing service advertised in the rooms is not available. No explanation given for the misadvertisement ... just ... it's wrong. Noisy street across from a police station, busy all night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mum & I stayed at the Travel Inn for one week at the beginning of December 2004. While the hotel is basic, it really is all that is required. The staff (manager, front desk, clerks) were all absolutely lovely and extremely helpful. Our room was also kept spotlessly clean. When I go back to NY, which I hope to do as soon as funds allow (!!!), I would most definitely go back to the Travel Inn. The Deli downstairs is amazing for the price. Few blocks down from Times Square, tubes easy to use. All in all, the Travel Inn made our trip all the better. Also, look out for Aveline, the lady who runs the gift shop in the hotel. She is an absolute star and can help you get any tickets to any shows you want. We got fantastic tickets to see 42nd Street for $44 each!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again when in NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks for everyone's review. A good hotel to stay in New York. Stayed for two nights before Christmas. Easy walk to Times Square and subway station. Got a metro card at Food Emporium on the next block, if you get tired of walking, you can take bus 42 that drops you right in front of the hotel. Major advantage is the free parking, check out at 10 am, but leave the car at the hotel until we are ready to leave at 9pm. Policy station across the street, felt very safe at this location. Room was a little noisy even on the 4th floor, but that's understandable. Used the wireless internet service for under $6 per day, connection was slow and not too reliable, not recommended. Room and bathroom was clean, good hot water, only small complain was the room very hot and stuffy, didn't find ways to circulate air other than opening the window. Overall, would stay at this hotel again when in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: worldseeker52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here December 11 for 3 nights. Staff friendly and room was big by NY standards. Hotel was 2 blocks from Theater District and within walking distance to Times Square, Macy's etc. Location away from the crowds and across from the police station. Only complaint was the location of the room, it was on the street side which was very noisy, ask for a room on the courtyard side. The hotel's restaurant was very reasonable. Very pleased with our stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Travel Inn Hotel New York
HotelInfo.Address: 515 W 42nd St, New York City, NY 10036
